spell.name: Absorb Object
entries: You touch an unattended object, which seems to meld into your body. The object must be tiny or smaller. It cannot be detected with even a careful search, although detect magic reveals the presence of a magical aura. The only evidence of its presence is a faint blotch on your skin shaped vaguely like the object. You may have a maximum number of objects stored with this spell equal to your spellcasting modifier.

As a bonus action on your turn, you may touch the spot to cause the object to appear in your hand, ending the spell. If the spell duration expires the object appears in the hand originally used to touch the object. A sentient magic item can make a Wisdom saving throw to resist the effect of this spell.

spell.name: Absorption

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet targeting you with a spell

entries: You attempt to absorb a spell that targets only you. If the spell is of 5th level or lower, the spell is absorbed. If the spell is 6th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10+ the spell's level. On a success the spell is absorbed. An absorbed spell has no effect.

Additionally, when you successfully absorb a spell you briefly store that spell's energy, which can be used to power your own spells. Until the end of your next turn, you may use the stored energy to cast a spell that you have prepared or know without expending a spell slot. The maximum level of this spell is equal to your spellcasting modifier or the level of the absorbed spell, whichever is lower.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the absorbed spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

spell.name: Acid Breath
entries: You exhale a cloud of acidic droplets. Each creature in a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Acid Sheath
entries: You enclose yourself in a fluid sheath of acid for the duration. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it. This sheath grants you resistance to acid damage and any creature that touches you or hits you with a melee attack while within 5 feet of you takes {@dice 2d4} acid damage. If you are in a grapple, other creatures in the grapple take acid damage once per round at the beginning of their turn.
In addition, your melee weapon attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d4} acid damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage you deal when a creature touches you or hits you with a melee attack increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 4th and the additional damage dealt by your melee attacks increases by {@dice 1d4} for every two slot levels above 4th.

spell.name: Acid Storm
entries: You conjure a dark green cloud above a point you choose within range, which unleashes a shower of foul-smelling yellow green rain in a 20-foot-radius, 60-foot high-cylinder centered on that point. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 6d6} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Additionally, on a failed save, nonmagical armor worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. The armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Alarm, Greater

components.m: a tiny bell and a piece of fine silver wire

entries: You set an alarm against unwanted intrusion. Choose a door, a window, or an area within range that is no larger than a 20-foot cube. Until the spell ends, an alarm alerts you whenever a Tiny or larger creature touches or enters the warded area. This includes creatures that are moving on an adjacent plane, such as the ethereal plane. When you cast the spell, you can designate creatures that won't set off the alarm. You also choose whether the alarm is mental or audible.
A mental alarm alerts you with a ping in your mind if you are within 1 mile of the warded area. This ping awakens you if you are sleeping.
An audible alarm produces the sound of a hand bell for 10 seconds within 60 feet.

spell.name: Amanuensis

components.m: a quill and a bottle of ink

entries: You cause writing from one source to be copied into a book, paper, or parchment. Over the course of one minute, this spell can copy up to 250 words and creates a perfect duplicate of the original. The spell copies only nonmagical text, not illustrations or magical writings (such as the text of a spellbook, a spell scroll or glyph of warding). If the target contains both normal and magical writing only the normal text is copied, leaving a blank space in the copied text where magical writing would be expected. Likewise, if the target contains text and illustration, only the text is copied. Blank paper, parchment or a book must be provided for the spell to write upon. This spell does not translate the copied writing. If you do not understand the original, you have no additional ability to understand the copy.

spell.name: Amorphous Form
entries: You transform a willing creature you touch, along with everything it's wearing and carrying, into an amorphous oozelike state for the duration. The spell ends if the creature drops to 0 hit points or dies. An incorporeal creature isn't affected. While transformed, the creature uses the Amorphous Creature stat block.
The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech.
The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

spell.name: Amplify/Silence
entries: You create an area where sounds are either dampened or enhanced for the duration.

Silence. For the duration, no sound can be created within or pass through a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. Any creature or object entirely inside the sphere is immune to thunder damage, and creatures are {@condition deafened} while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a verbal component is impossible there.

Amplify. For the duration, all sounds are louder within a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. Any creature attempting to make a Dexterity (Stealth) check in an area affected by this spell does so with disadvantage. In addition, all creatures in the area have vulnerability to thunder damage.
If the area of Silence overlaps with an area affected by Amplify, or vice versa, both spells are dispelled.

spell.name: Analyze Portal

components.m: a crystal lens and a small mirror

entries: You can detect the presence of any magical portal or gate to another plane of existence within one mile. If you can see a portal or gate within 30 feet you can spend a bonus action on your turn to determine any of the following information:

items: What key or command word is needed to activate the portal.
Any special circumstances governing the portal's use (such as specific times when it can be activated).
A glimpse of the area where the portal leads.

spell.name: Angelskin
entries: Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch gains resistance against radiant damage and against bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

spell.name: Anger of the Noonday Sun
entries: Your body explodes with radiance, bathing the area around you in sunlight. Each creature other than you within a 20-foot-radius sphere centered you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 5d8} radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition blinded}. Undead and Oozes have disadvantage on their saving throw.
If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of darkness created by a spell of 5th level or lower, the spell that created the darkness is dispelled.

spell.name: Animate Elements

components.m: burning incense for air, soft clay for earth, sulfur and phosphorus for fire, or water and sand for water

entries: You call forth an Elemental spirit, which manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This creature uses the Animated Element stat block. When you cast this spell, choose an element: Air, Earth, Fire, or Water. The creature resembles a tiny version of a regular Elemental of the chosen type, and the type chosen determines certain traits in its stat block. The elemental is friendly to you and your companions for the duration and takes its turn immediately after you in initiative. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to the elemental, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.

While {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on this spell, you can use an action to dismiss the Elemental early. If your {@status Concentration|XPHB} is broken, the Elemental doesn't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the elemental. When this happens, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions and it might attack. An uncontrolled Elemental can't be dismissed by you, and it disappears 1 hour after you summoned it.

spell.name: Antimagic Ray

components.m: a pinch of powdered iron or iron fillings

entries: You project an invisible ray from your finger toward a creature or object in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target and everything they are wearing and carrying are cut off from the magical energy that suffuses the multiverse. Spells and other magical effects, except for those created by an artifact or a deity, are suppressed and have no effect on the target and any magical items they are wearing or carrying cease to function and are considered nonmagical items while the spell lasts.
If cast on a willing target, your attack automatically hits. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can choose make a Wisdom saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Appraising Touch

m.text: jeweler's tools worth 25 gp

entries: Objects near you suddenly seem clearer and more in focus, allowing you to notice blemishes and imperfections you had missed before. For the duration, you have a +10 bonus to Intelligence checks made to estimate the value of a precious item and can determine if an object is a magical item at a touch. If you spend 1 minute handling a magical item you can determine the rarity of the item.

spell.name: Arc of Lightning
entries: Choose one creature or object in range and one other creature or object within 100 feet of the first target. A bolt of electricity to arcs between the two targets. Both targets and any other creatures in a 5-foot wide line between those two creatures must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 8d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The lightning ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot above 3rd.

spell.name: Armor of Darkness
entries: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, enveloping them in a protective shroud of flickering shadows until the spell ends. For the duration, that creature has {@sense darkvision|XPHB} out to a range of 60 feet. The creature's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends if the creature dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action. Additionally, the space the creature occupies is considered lightly obscured to creatures other than the target.
Undead creatures affected by Armor of Darkness have advantage on saving throws against Turn Undead

spell.name: Arrow Mind
entries: You expand your awareness to the point where your bow feels like an extension of your own body. When a hostile creature's movement provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to make one ranged attack against the provoking creature.

spell.name: Arrow Storm
entries: One ranged weapon in your hand with the Ammunition property glows faintly when you cast this spell. Until the end of your next turn, you may use an action to expend this energy. When you do so, you may choose a number of targets within that weapon's maximum range, up to your proficiency bonus, and make one ranged weapon attack against each of them with the chosen weapon.

spell.name: Arrow of Bone
entries: You touch one to three pieces of ranged ammunition and imbue them with magic. You or someone else can fire these pieces of ammunition as part of a normal ranged weapon attack. On a hit, the target takes the normal damage from the attack plus an additional {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage. The spell ends on a piece of ammunition after it is fired or if you cast this spell again.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may enchant one additional piece of ammunition for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Aspect of the Earth Hunter

components.m: (a small piece of a bulette's armored shell

entries: Calling upon primal energies, you temporarily bestow several properties of a Bulette upon yourself. Until the spell ends, you have {@sense darkvision|XPHB} and {@sense Tremorsense|XPHB} out to a range of 30 feet and gain a burrowing speed of 20 ft.

spell.name: Aspect of the Wolf
entries: Your features become distinctly more lupine and you gain several qualities of a wolf. Until this spell ends, you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell. Additionally, you gain sharp teeth, which you can use to make unarmed attacks. If you hit with these attacks, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6}+ your Strength modifier.

spell.name: Assay Resistance
entries: When you cast this spell, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. Until this spell ends, any spell or effect you create ignores resistance to the chosen damage type and treats immunity to that damage type as resistance to that damage type instead.

spell.name: Augment Familiar
entries: Reaching out with magic, you empower your familiar, making it tougher and quicker. Your familiar gains 10 temporary hit and has advantage on saving throws. Additionally, when delivering a spell that requires an attack roll, it does so with advantage.

spell.name: Aura Against Flame
entries: For the duration, a willing creature you touch has resistance to fire damage. Additionally, any nonmagical flame that comes into contact with the target is immediately extinguished. The target can use an action to touch an existing magical fire (such as those created by a flaming sphere or a wall of fire spell), ending the spell if it is 3rd level or lower. If the spell is 4th level or higher, the target can make an ability check using your spellcasting ability with a DC equal to 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends. When a spell is successfully ended this way, the target takes no damage from having touched the magical fire, but this spell also ends. If the target fails, they take damage from the fire source normally (taking into account resistance provided by aura against flame).

spell.name: Aura of Evasion

m.text: powdered emerald worth 500 gp

entries: All creatures within a 10 foot radius of you are imbued with an uncanny awareness, allowing them to nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects. When anyone in the radius this aura is subjected to an effect that allows them to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, they instead take no damage if they succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if they fail.

spell.name: Aura of Terror
entries: You surround yourself in an aura of fear, granting you a frightful presence. When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. An affected creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you until this spell ends. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. Once a creature has successfully saved against this spell, they are immune to your aura of terror for the next 24 hours.

spell.name: Avalanche
entries: You summon an avalanche of snow to burry your foes and send them to a frosty death. Choose a point you can see in range. Creatures and objects are affected differently, based on how close they are to the chosen point.

Each creature and object in a 20-foot radius of that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@dice 20d6} cold damage and {@damage 20d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save. In addition, a creature that fails its save by 5 or more is buried beneath the avalanche. A buried creature is {@condition restrained} and unable to breathe until it can free itself or another creature frees it. A creature can try to free itself as an action with a Strength (Athletics) check (DC is your spell save DC). Another creature can attempt to dig out a buried creature, which takes one minute of work to free the buried creature.

Each creature and object within a 40-foot radius but outside of the initial 20-foot radius must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 10d6} cold damage and {@dice 10d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, a creature that fails its saving throw is pushed to the edge of the area in a straight line away from the center of the avalanche.
The avalanche uproots small trees and other vegetation and extinguishes all unprotected flames in the area. The snow remains in the area and is considered difficult terrain until it melts naturally.

spell.name: Avasculate
entries: You shoot a ray of necromantic energy from your outstretched hand, causing any living creature struck by the ray to violently purge blood or other vital fluids through its skin. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes necrotic damage equal to half of its current Hit Points (up to a maximum of 75) and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is also {@condition stunned} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level, the purged blood vessels spread outward to create a multi-layered mass of bloody, adhesive tissue that traps nearby creatures in a 20-foot cube centered on the target. For the next minute, in addition to the regular effects above, this mass turns the area into difficult terrain. A creature in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the mass until the spell ends. A creature {@condition restrained} by the mass can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself. After one minute, the mass loses its necromantic energy and decays into a pile of dead tissue.

spell.name: Awaken Construct

m.text: a carnelian worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: After spending the casting time tracing magical pathways within a precious gemstone, you touch a Huge or smaller Construct. The target must have either no Intelligence score or an Intelligence of 3 or less. The target gains an Intelligence of 10. The target also gains the ability to speak one language you know. It retains all other statistics.

The awakened Construct is {@condition charmed} by you for 30 days or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. When the {@condition charmed} condition ends, the awakened creature chooses whether to remain friendly to you, based on how you treated it while it was {@condition charmed}.

spell.name: Awaken Sin
entries: You command another creature you can see in range to repent, projecting a crushing sense of guilt onto the target. The target must make a Wisdom save. It takes {@dice 4d10} psychic damage and has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn on a failed save. If they fail the save by 5 or more, they are {@condition stunned} until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and suffers no additional effects.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Awaken Undead

m.text: an onyx gemstone worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: After spending the casting time tracing magical pathways within an onyx gemstone, you touch a Huge or smaller Undead creature. The target must have either no Intelligence score or an Intelligence of 3 or less. The target gains an Intelligence of 10. The target also gains the ability to speak one language you know. It retains all other statistics.

The awakened Undead is {@condition charmed} by you for 30 days or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. When the {@condition charmed} condition ends, the awakened creature chooses whether to remain friendly to you, based on how you treated it while it was {@condition charmed}.

spell.name: Awaken, Mass

m.text: an agate worth at least 2,500 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: After spending the casting time tracing magical pathways within a precious gemstone, you touch a number of Huge or smaller Beasts or Plants up to your spellcasting modifier. Each target must have either no Intelligence score or an Intelligence of 3 or less. Each target gains an Intelligence of 10 and gains the ability to speak one language you know. If a target is a Plant, it gains the ability to move its limbs, roots, vines, creepers, and so forth, and it gains senses similar to a human. Your GM chooses statistics appropriate for the awakened Plant, such as the statistics for an awakened shrub or an awakened tree.

The awakened Beasts and Plants are {@condition charmed} by you for 30 days, or until you or your companions do anything harmful to them or you cast this spell again. When the {@condition charmed} condition ends, each awakened creature chooses whether to remain friendly to you, based on how you treated it while it was {@condition charmed}.

spell.name: Babau Slime
entries: This spell causes a willing creature to secrete a slimy red layer of corrosive jelly that coats its skin, armor and equipment. A creature that touches the target or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes {@dice 1d8} acid damage. Any creature in a grapple with the target takes {@damage 1d8} acid damage at the beginning of its turn.

spell.name: Backbiter
entries: A weapon you can see when casting this spell shimmers briefly with a black aura, which fades after a moment. The next time that weapon is used to make a melee attack, it shifts to try and strike the wielder instead. The wielder of the weapon must make a Strength save. On a successful save, they have disadvantage on that attack. On a failed save, the weapon twists to strike at the wielder. The weapon hits automatically, dealing that weapon's damage dice plus your spellcasting ability modifier to the wielder. Once this attack is made, the spell ends. A sentient magic item can make a Wisdom saving throw against this spell. On a successful save, the spell fails.

spell.name: Backlash
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, a faint red aura entwines the target before fading from sight. The next time the target attempts to cast a spell of 3rd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the target's spell fails and has no effect. When this spell causes another spell to fail, the caster takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage per level of the spell being cast. Once the target has attempted to cast a spell, regardless of whether the spell was successful or failed, this spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

spell.name: Ball Lightning

components.m: a handful of copper and iron pellets

entries: A 5-foot-diameter ball of concentrated lightning appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range and lasts for the duration. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 4d10} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. As a bonus action, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet. If you ram the sphere into a creature, that creature must make the saving throw against the sphere's damage, and the sphere stops moving this turn. When you move the sphere, you can direct it over barriers up to 5 feet tall and jump it across pits up to 10 feet wide.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Balor Nimbus

time.condition: which you take when damage would reduce you to zero hit points

entries: Calling upon the vengeful power of one of the most powerful of fiends, you spend your last breath to create a fiery conflagration. Every creature within 30 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@dice 20d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion ignites flammable objects in that area that aren't being worn or carried.

spell.name: Bands of Steel
entries: With a gesture, bands of steel streak from your outstretched hand to a point you can see within range, which last for the duration or until you cast this spell again. When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the bands. On a hit, the target is {@condition grappled} by the bands. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the bands up to 10 feet in any direction, dragging the {@condition grappled} creature with them.

Alternatively, if the bands are not currently grappling a target you can instead move the bands up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. The DC to escape this grapple is equal to your spell save DC. A creature can choose to attack the bands. The bands are an object that has an AC of 19 and 10 + your spellcasting modifier hit points. If the bands are reduced to 0 hit points, the spell ends.

spell.name: Barghest's Feast
entries: Black flames flicker over a corpse, utterly consuming it. You destroy the remains of a dead creature, preventing any form of raising or resurrection that requires part of the corpse. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a wish spell. When you successfully cast this spell, you gain temporary hit points equal to {@dice 6d6} + the target's challenge rating (or the target's level, if it doesn't have a challenge rating).

spell.name: Battering Ram
entries: You choose a creature or object you can see in range, slamming them with a burst of force. The target takes {@dice 2d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier force damage and must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pushed 10 feet away from you. If the target fails its save by 5 or more, it is also knocked {@condition prone}. This spell has no effect on targets protected by a Shield spell

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Battle Hymn
entries: Choose any number of willing creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll before the spell ends, the target can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the attack roll. Additionally, as a bonus action on its turn, an affected creature can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

spell.name: Beast Claws
entries: When you cast this spell, your hands transform into a pair of claws. These claws count as natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes using your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. In addition, you gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

The base damage increases to {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level; {@dice 1d8} at 11th level; at {@dice 1d10} at 17th level. Once you reach 5th level, attacks made with these claws count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

spell.name: Beastland Ferocity
entries: You choose a willing creature in range, granting them the ability to fight on beyond their normal limits. While this spell lasts, the target does not fall {@condition unconscious} when reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright. They are still considered dying until stabilized or regaining at least 1 hit point and must make a death saving throw at the beginning of each of their turns, dying as normal once they have accumulated three failed death saving throws. So long as the target is at 0 hit points, they have advantage on melee attack rolls.

spell.name: Beget Bogun

m.text: 10 gp worth of roots, herbs and other plant matter, which the spell consumes

entries: You infuse magic into a pile of plant matter, infusing it with life. When you create a Bogun, choose one of the following spells: entangle, faerie fire, or fog cloud. The Bogun is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys your commands.

See the creature's game statistics in the Bogun stat block below. In combat, the bogun shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it can take on its turn is the dodge action, unless you use a bonus action on your turn to command it to take one of the actions in its stat block or the Dash, Disengage, Help, Hide or Search action. The Bogun lasts until it is reduced to zero hit points, at which point it dies. If you cast this spell while you already have a Bogun, your current Bogun dies.

spell.name: Belker Claws
entries: Smoke envelops your hand as you call upon the power of an evil air elemental to strike at a creature. Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d12} poison damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the smoke lingers in the creature's lungs. At the beginning of each of its turns for the next minute it takes another {@dice 1d12} poison damage and may repeat this save, ending the effect on a successful save. Creatures that do not need to breathe are unaffected by this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 2nd and the ongoing damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Binding Winds
entries: Calling upon the power of elemental air, you encircle a 5-foot-radius, 30-foot-high cylinder centered on a point you can see within range with whipping winds. For the duration, the area is considered difficult terrain. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to zero for the rest of the turn. Any creature within the spell's area is {@condition deafened} by the winds and any ranged attacks that pass through the spell's area have disadvantage. Constitution saving throws made by creature's within the spell's area to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} have disadvantage.

spell.name: Bite of the King
entries: Your mouth opens impossibly wide as you attempt to swallow your foe whole, leaving no trace behind. Choose one creature you can see in range. That creature must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is transported into an extradimensional space. A creature in this space is {@condition blinded}, {@condition restrained} and takes {@dice 6d8} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 6d8} acid damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature trapped in this space can attempt to cut its way out. Treat the inside of this space as an object with an AC of 20 and 35 hit points. If a trapped creature can successfully reduce the space to 0 hit points, it appears in the closest unoccupied space to you. If a creature dies while within this space it is devoured, its body completely destroyed. Anything it was wearing or carrying at the time is also destroyed, except for magical items, which are instead transported to a random location in the Abyss.

spell.name: Bite of the Wild
entries: Your teeth seem to elongate as your visage assumes beastial features. For the duration of the spell, you can use your action to bite as a melee spell attack, which deals {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier piercing damage. When you deal damage with this attack you gain temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt. When this spell ends, you lose all temporary hit points granted by this spell.

The damage increases to {@dice 2d6} when you reach 5th level; {@dice 3d6} at 11th level; at {@dice 4d6} at 17th level. Once you reach 5th level, your bite counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

spell.name: Blackfire

components.m: a pinch of dust from a vampire destroyed by sunlight

entries: You point at a creature you can see in range, shooting a ray of black energy at it. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target is engulfed in blackfire, which feeds on their life force. For the duration of the spell, any creature that starts its turn engulfed in blackfire must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 10d8} necrotic damage and gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage but does not gain one level of {@condition exhaustion} and is still engulfed in blackfire.

A creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of a creature engulfed in blackfire must make a Dexterity saving throw, becoming engulfed in blackfire on a failure. blackfire cannot be extinguished by normal means, but ends on all affected creatures when the spell ends. Creatures under the protection of a death ward spell or similar magic are immune to blackfire.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the creature has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws made while engulfed in blackfire.

spell.name: Blacklight

components.m: a piece of coal and the dried eyeball of any creature

entries: Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with {@sense darkvision|XPHB} can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it. While you are within the spell's area of darkness, you can see normally as though it were not there.

If the point you choose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the darkness emanates from the object and moves with it. Completely covering the source of the darkness with an opaque object, such as a bowl or a helm, blocks the darkness.
If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 3rd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

spell.name: Blade Storm
entries: You empower the weapon used in the spell's casting, unleashing a flurry of blows. When you cast this spell, make a melee attack with the weapon used in the spell's casting against any number of creatures within 5 feet of you, making a separate attack roll for each creature. On a hit, a target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects plus an additional {@damage 1d8} force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the bonus damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Blade Thirst
entries: You touch a melee weapon, imbuing it with the power to steal the vitality from your enemies. The next time a creature successfully hits with a melee weapon attack using that weapon, it deals an additional {@dice 2d12} necrotic damage, the creature gains temporary hit points equal to the additional necrotic damage dealt and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the bonus damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Blade of Pain and Fear
entries: A column of disembodied gnashing teeth appears in your hand in the shape of a sword. When you cast the spell, or as an action on your turn, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes slashing damage equal to {@dice 2d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier and must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you for the duration of this spell.
A creature {@condition frightened} by this spell can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success, it is no longer {@condition frightened} of you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Blades of Fire
entries: A sword made entirely of elemental fire bursts into existence, orbiting around you. Whenever a hostile creature moves within 5 feet of you for the first time on a turn, one of the swords strikes at it. When a sword strikes at a creature, the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 2d10} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. As a bonus action on your turn, you either can create another sword or command one of your existing swords to strike at a creature within 30 feet of you. Once a sword strikes at a creature, either from your command or from a creature moving within 5 feet of you, it ceases to exist.

When this spell ends, any remaining swords you have explode outward in a burst of fire. Each creature of your choice in a 10-foot radius sphere centered on you must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@dice 1d10} fire damage for each remaining sword on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
You may have a maximum of three swords at a time.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the maximum number of swords you can have summoned at a time, as well as the number ofswords you create when you cast this spell, increases byone for each spell level above 1st.

spell.name: Bladeweave
entries: As you finish casting this spell, you are filled with a magical finesse, as every movement you make with your weapon seems beautiful and full of flourish. On the turn you cast this spell, or as a bonus action while the spell lasts, you can empower the next melee weapon attack you make this turn. When you hit a creature with an empowered melee weapon attack, the target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or have disadvantage on any attack roll or ability check it makes before the end of its next turn.

spell.name: Blast of Force
entries: You draw upon magic in its purest form, causing a wave of invisible energy to blast outward from a point you choose within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 6d4} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d4} foreach slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Blessing of Bahamut
entries: While this spell lasts, if you fail a saving throw you may choose to succeed instead. Once you have chosen to succeed on one failed saving throw this spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level, the number of times you may choose to succeed on a failed saving throw before this spell ends increases to two. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the number of times you may choose to succeed on a failed saving throw before this spell ends increases to three.

spell.name: Blinding Breath
entries: You expel a blast of blinding radiance. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, a creature that fails its saving throw is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. If it fails this save by 5 or more, it is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute instead. A creature {@condition blinded} by this spell can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect for itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} foreach slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Blinding Spittle
entries: Make a ranged spell attack against a creature you can see in range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d8} acid damage and is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition blinded} by this spell can use an action to clear their eyes and end the {@condition blinded} condition.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Blindsight
entries: You touch a willing creature to grant it the ability to sense its surroundings. For the duration, that creature has blindsight out to a range of 30 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the blindsight granted by this spell increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Blistering Radiance

components.m: a bit of tinder and a small lens

entries: You hurl a ball of light towards a point you can see in range, which erupts into a brilliant sphere of scorching light. Each creature in a 50-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, a creature {@condition blinded} by this spell can make a Constitution saving throw, ending the {@condition blinded} condition on a success.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Constitution saving throw. The creature takes {@dice 5d10} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
If any of this spell's area overlaps with an area of darkness created by a spell of 6th level or lower, the spell that created the darkness is dispelled

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} foreach slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: You touch a willing creature, filling them with a primal fury. Until the spell ends, the target cannot cast spells or concentrate on them and has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. Whenever the target makes a melee weapon attack or damage roll, the target can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to the attack roll or damage roll. This spell ends early if the target is knocked {@condition unconscious} or if their turn ends and they haven't attacked a hostile creature since their last turn or taken damage since then.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spellslot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional.creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Blood Sirocco
entries: You cause a stifling wind to tear across the landscape, emanating from your outstretched arms in a 60 foot cone and lacerating those caught in the gale. Each creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Strength saving throw or take {@dice 10d6} slashing damage and be pushed 15 feet away from you. A creature pushed by this spell is knocked {@condition prone} if it is Medium or smaller. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not pushed.
Any creature in this spell's area must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving closer to you.
This wind disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and other flames in the area (including protected flames, such as those of lanterns).
As a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends, you can change the direction in which the cone emanates from you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} foreach slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Blood Wind
entries: You choose a willing creature you can see within range. The next melee weapon attack that creature makes on its turn can strike enemies as though their reach were 10 feet greater than normal. This range increases to 15 feet when you reach 5th level, 20 feet when you reach 11th level, and 25 feet when you reach 17th level.

spell.name: Blood to Water
entries: A blue-tinged ball of energy hovers above your hand, slowly turning red as your foes have their blood turned into pure water. Up to five creatures you can see within range must make a Constitution saving throw when you cast this spell and at the start of each of your turns for as long as this spell lasts and the target is still within 30 feet of you when your turns starts. A target takes {@dice 12d6} necrotic damage and gain one level of {@condition exhaustion} on a failed save. On a successful save they take half as much damage, gain one level of {@condition exhaustion} and this spell has no further effect on them.
This spell has no effect on creatures without blood, such as Constructs, Elementals, Oozes, Plants and Undead.

spell.name: Bloodhound
entries: For the duration of this spell, a creature of your choice has a +10 bonus to Wisdom (Survival) checks to track the target designated when you cast this spell.

spell.name: Bloodstar

m.text: a ruby worth at least 30 gp

entries: You summon a small, intangible blood-red crystal to hover at a point of your choice within range to siphon the blood from your enemies wounds. When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. The bloodstar sheds red-tinted light, providing dim light in a 30-foot radius area. Whenever an affected creature within this radius takes damage it must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 4d10} necrotic damage and have its max HP reduced by the amount of necrotic damage taken. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. A creature can only take damage from Bloodstar once per round.
As a bonus action on your turn, you may move the Bloodstar to any location within range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Bodak's Glare

m.text: a black onyx skull worth at least 500 gp

entries: You attempt to drain the life from nearby creatures with a baleful glare. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 12d10} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the target fails its save by 5 or more it is reduced to 0 hit points unless it is immune to the {@condition frightened} condition. Any creature of challenge rating 3 or less (or level 3 or less, if it doesn't have a challenge rating) that fails this save is instantly slain unless it is immune to the {@condition frightened} condition.
A Humanoid that is slain by this spell rises as a bodak 24 hours later unless the target is restored to life or its body is destroyed. Your GM has the creatures' statistics.

spell.name: Body Blades
entries: You cause razor-sharp spikes to erupt from your body and limbs. They appear metallic but are not actually metal and do not interfere with your movement or spellcasting. You are proficient with these weapons, which count as melee martial weapons that deal {@dice 1d6} piercing or slashing damage. When you make an attack using these blades you can use your spellcasting ability modifier instead of Strength or Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level, the blades you create have a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls. When you use a spell slot of 4th level, the bonus increases to +2. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the bonus increases to +3.

spell.name: Body Harmonic
entries: You choose one creature to suffer from discordant energies. Choose one ability score when you cast the spell. The target has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with the chosen ability score. As a bonus action on your turn, you may choose a different ability score to affect.

spell.name: Body of War
entries: This spell transforms you into the form of a {@creature Warforged Titan|ERLW} (the GM has the creatures' statistics). The transformation lasts for the duration, or until you drop to 0 hit points or dies. Your game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of a Warforged Titan. You retain your alignment and personality.

You assume the hit points of your new form. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of hit damage doesn't reduce your normal form to 0 hit points, you aren't knocked {@condition unconscious}.
You are limited in the actions you can perform by the nature of your new form, and you can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech.
Your gear melds into the new form. You can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of your equipment. As an action on your turn, you can choose to end this spell and transform back.

spell.name: Body of the Sun
entries: You draw upon the power of the sun, causing your body to emanate fire. Until the spell ends, fire radiates from your body in all directions, creating a 5-foot aura of flame around you. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. You are unaffected by the flames.
The fires emanating from your body provide bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} foreach slot level above 2nd. When you cast this spell using aspell slot of 5th level or higher, the light created by thisspell is sunlight

spell.name: Bolster Focus
entries: When you cast this spell, your ability to concentrate on spells you cast is enhanced. For the duration, you have advantage on Constitution saving throws you make to maintain your {@status Concentration|XPHB} on a spell.

spell.name: Bolt of Glory
entries: You fire a bolt of pure white energy toward a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 6d10 + 40} radiant damage. If the creature is Undead or a Fiend, it continues to burn with radiant energy, taking an additional {@damage 4d6} radiant damage at the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the initial damage increases by{@dice 2d10} and the extra damage against Undead and Fiendsincreases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Bolts of Bedevilment
entries: You fire a black bolt of energy from your finger at a creature you can see in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@dice 4d12} psychic damage and must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure the creature is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.
On each of your turns while the spell lasts, you can use your action to fire another bolt, targeting the same creature or a different one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Bombardment

components.m: a quartz crystal embedded into a rock

entries: You choose a point you can see in range, causing boulders to tumble into being, burying those beneath them. centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 8d10} bludgeoning damage and is buried under 5 feet of rubble on a failed save. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not buried.

A creature buried by this spell is {@condition restrained} and has total cover. As an action on its turn, a buried creature can attempt to free itself with a Strength (Athletics) check with a DC equal to your spell save DC. If another creature wishes to free a buried creature, It takes one minute of digging for a single creature to dig out a buried creature.
After this spell is cast, the area is covered by 5 feet of dense rubble, which is considered difficult terrain.

spell.name: Bonefiddle
entries: You call up a ghostly fiddle bow in the air above the targeted creature, which immediately descends into the targets body and begins to saw back and forth against its skeleton. At the start of each of its turns, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving or take {@dice 3d6} slashing damage. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and the spell ends. So long as the spell lasts an eerily beautiful tune, audible from as far away as 300 feet, emanates from the target. Creatures have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing to locate the target and any creature with hearing that comes within 10 feet of the target can automatically pinpoint its location.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Brain Spider

m.text: ink made from drider venom and moltings worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: This spell allows you to listen in on the thoughts of other creatures and manipulate their actions. When you cast this spell, you can choose up to 8 creatures you can see in range. While the spell lasts, you can use an action to eavesdrop on the thoughts of all 8 targets at once, learning any of the following pieces of information as desired:

items: A creature's surface thoughts.
A piece of information that the target knows about a specific topic, thing or being.
The thoughts and memories of one creature of the group in detail.

entries: As an action you can attempt to implant a suggestion into the mind of any one of the eight creatures. When you do so, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you may mentally suggest a reasonable course of action to the target, which is pursues to the best of its ability. The target continues to pursue the course of action until it is completed, or until the target takes damage, the spell ends or you give the same target another suggestion. On a successful save, the target is unaffected by this suggestion. A creature automatically succeeds on its saving throw if it can't be {@condition charmed}.

spell.name: Brambles
entries: You touch a nonmagical wooden weapon. Until the spell ends, that weapon sprouts sharp thorns, causing melee weapon attack to deal {@damage 1d4} piercing damage in addition to its normal damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th Level or higher, the bonus increases to {@dice 2d4}. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the bonus increases to {@dice 3d4}.

spell.name: Breath of the Jungle
entries: With a word of power and a flick of your wrist, a foulsmelling mist appears. You create a 15-foot-radius sphere of poisonous mist centered on a point you choose within range. The mist spreads around corners. It lasts for the duration or until strong wind disperses the mist, ending the spell. Its area is lightly obscured. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Constitution saving throw. The creature is {@condition poisoned} on a failed save and unaffected on a successful one. Creatures are affected even if they hold their breath or don't need to breathe.

spell.name: Brilliant Aura
entries: With a touch, you cause the weapons carried by a willing creature to burst forth with brilliant energy, transforming them partially into light and allowing them to pass through nonliving matter as though it weren't there. Until the spell ends, any melee or ranged weapon attack made by that creature against a target wearing armor has advantage, ignores cover and deals an additional {@damage 1d8} radiant damage. Weapons under the effects of Brilliant Aura have no effect on Undead, Constructs or objects.

A weapon loses the benefits of this spell if the creature ends its turn while not carrying that weapon, or another creature attempts to use the weapon. Additionally, the creature can use a bonus action on their turn to subdue this effect on a single weapon they carry until the start of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you may target one additional creature when casting this spell for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Bristle
entries: You touch a creature, causing them to sprout long, deadly-looking spikes that respond to your mental commands. The spikes are flexible enough not to impede movement. Whenever a creature within 5 feet of the target hits the target with a melee attack you may use your reaction to cause the spikes to strike at the creature, dealing {@damage 2d6} piercing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Buoyant Lifting
entries: Choose one creature within range. Until this spell ends, that creature has its jump distance increased by 5 feet, and its weight is reduced to one-half of normal If the creature is underwater, it rises 30 feet towards the surface at the start of each of its turns. If the creature is unwilling, it may make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, this spell does not affect it.

spell.name: Burning Blood

components.m: a drop of blood and a pinch of saltpeter

entries: You corrupt a creature's blood with a hot, corrosive infusion. Choose a creature within range that you can see. When you initially cast this spell and at the start of each of your turns while the spell lasts, target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} acid damage and {@damage 2d6} fire damage and if the creature would regain hit points, it regains only half as many hit points until the start of your next turn. On a successful save it takes half as much damage and there is no additional effect.
This spell does not affect Constructs, Elementals, Oozes, Plants, or Undead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the acid damage or the fire damage (your choice) increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Burrow

components.m: a claw from a burrowing creature

entries: You touch a willing creature. The target gains a burrow speed of 30 feet for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Buzzing Bee
entries: A small but extremely loud spectral bee appears, buzzing around the head of a creature you can see in range. While the spell lasts, the target has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws that they make to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on a spell.
The bee follows the target in spite of darkness, invisibility, or any other attempts at hiding or concealment.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can direct the bee to switch targets to another creature you can see within 60 feet of the current target.

spell.name: Cacophonic Burst
entries: You cause a burst of discordant noise to erupt at a point of your choice within range. Each creature in a 20-footradius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 8d8} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spellslot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} foreach slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Cacophonic Shield
entries: You create a barrier of sonic energy in a 10-foot radius sphere around yourself. The sphere is centered on you and moves with you. Creatures near the barrier hear it as a loud but harmless buzzing, audible up to 30 feet away. Sounds do not cross the barrier and ranged weapon attacks that cross the barrier in either direction have disadvantage. A creature that attempts to cross the barrier or ends its turn in the same space as it takes {@dice 3d12} thunder damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition deafened} by this effect may repeat this save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save. If a creature crosses the barrier as a result of your movement, they do not take damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spellslot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} foreach slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Caltrops
entries: With a throwing gesture, coppery sparks spring from your palm to land at a location you can see within range. These caltrops cover the ground in a 5-foot cube. Any creature in the caltrops' space when you cast the spell must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@dice 1d4} force damage. A creature must also make this saving throw when it enters the caltrops' space for the first time on a turn or ends its turn there. Until a creature damaged by Caltrops regains at least 1 hit point, or until the spell ends, its walking speed is reduced by 10 feet. This spell ends early if you cast it again.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4})

spell.name: Capricious Zephyr
entries: A 5-foot radius ball of swirling wind and dust appears in a point you can see in range, pushing your foes across the battlefield. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}.

The zephyr disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50 percent chance to extinguish them.
As a bonus action, you can command the zephyr to move up to 30 feet in any direction.

spell.name: Cast in Stone
entries: You attempt to turn any number of creatures that you can see within range to stone. Each target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is {@condition restrained} as its flesh begins to harden. On a successful save, the creature isn't affected.

A creature {@condition restrained} by this spell must make another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves against this spell three times, the spell ends for that creature. If it fails its saves three times against this spell, it is turned to stone and subjected to the {@condition petrified} condition. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of either kind.
If the creature is physically broken while {@condition petrified}, it suffers from similar injuries if it reverts to its original state.

spell.name: Castigate
entries: You rebuke your foes with the conviction of your sacred words. Each creature of your choice within 30 feet that can hear you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 5d8} force damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition deafened}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Celebration
entries: You begin to perform a captivating song, compelling those around to join in the revelry. Each creature of your choice within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is distracted by your performance, causing it to have disadvantage on dexterity saving throws and attack rolls until the end of your next turn. If a creature is already distracted by this spell and fails its save, it additionally gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}. If a creature fails its save while it has any levels of {@condition exhaustion}, it instead falls {@condition unconscious} and this spell no longer affects it. A creature regains consciousness if it takes any damage or another creature uses an action to shake or slap the {@condition unconscious} creature awake.
On each of your turns while the spell lasts, you can use your action to cause each creature of your choice within range to repeat this saving throw.
Once a creature has succeeded on a saving throw against this spell, they are immune to its effects for the next hour. Creatures that can't be {@condition charmed} are immune to this spell.

spell.name: Chain Missile
entries: You fire a salvo of magic missiles at a creature you can see in range, which ricochet upon striking your target. You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart hits the same creature, then ricochets to hit a second target you can see within 120 feet of the original target. You can direct these ricochets to hit one creature or several, so long as they are within range and are not the original target. Each dart deals {@damage 1d4 + 1} force damage to its target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spellslot of 5th level or higher, the spell creates one more dartfor each slot above 4th.

spell.name: Chain of Eyes
entries: With a touch, you can use another creature's vision instead of your own. An unwilling creature may make a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful saving throw this spell fails. While {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on this spell, you may use a bonus action on your turn to switch between seeing with your own eyes or seeing through the eyes of a creature affected by this spell.

If an affected creature makes physical contact with another creature while you are seeing through its eyes, you may extend your Chain of Eyes to include the new creature. If the new creature is unwilling, it may make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is now affected by this spell. On a successful save the creature is unaffected by this casting of chain of eyes.
This spell may affect a maximum of three creatures at a time. If you attempt to extend your chain beyond this number, the oldest affected creature in the chain is no longer affected by this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the maximum number of creatures you can affect increases by one for each slot above 3rd. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you may freely switch between seeing through the eyes of a creature affected by this spell with no action required.

spell.name: Cheat
entries: You attempt to manipulate fate to alter the outcome of a game of chance. When you make an ability check while {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on this spell, you may grant yourself advantage on the roll, provided it involves a mundane game of chance. If the game of chance involves magic items or magic other than this spell, then this spell ends and nothing happens.

spell.name: Circle Dance
entries: Tracing a compass rose on the ground, you name another creature that you are familiar with as you make a wide circular sweep. The direction you are pointing in when you finish casting this spell is the direction the creature is located. Additionally, you get an impression of its current physical and emotional state. If the creature is hostile towards you, it may make a Charisma saving throw. On a successful save, you still know the direction the creature is located in, but do not any further information. If the creature you name is dead or on a different plane when you cast this spell, the spell fails.

spell.name: Clarity of Mind
entries: You touch a willing creature, ending one effect that {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} the target. For the next minute, that creature has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

spell.name: Claws of Darkness
entries: You draw material from the Plane of Shadow, causing your hands and forearms to elongate and change shape into featureless claws of inky blackness. When you cast the spell, or as an action on your turn, you may make a melee spell attack against a creature within 10 feet of you. On a hit, the creature takes {@dice 2d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier cold damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, that creature's speed is halved and it can't take reactions until the start of your next turn.
While {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on this spell, you cannot cast any spells that require somatic or material components.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Cloak of Bravery
entries: You cloak yourself and any number of allies within 60 feet of you in a glittering mantle of magic that bolsters their courage. Creatures of your choice within this aura have advantage on saves against being {@condition frightened}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, affected creatures cannot be {@condition frightened}.

spell.name: Cloak of Dark Power
entries: You create a dusky haze around a creature in range. This haze does not interfere with vision, but the target and anything it is wearing or carrying are protected from the sun. For the duration of the spell, the target suffers no ill effects from being in sunlight or bright light. Additionally, any items the target is carrying that would be harmed by exposure to sunlight are unaffected while this spell lasts.

spell.name: Cloak of the Sea
entries: With a touch you imbue a creature with a blue-green aura. While underwater, the target gains the following benefits:

items: The target can breathe underwater in addition to its normal mode of respiration.

Any creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. An attacker is immune to this effect if it doesn't rely on sight, as with blindsight, or can see through illusions, as with truesight.

The target's movement is unaffected by difficult terrain, and spells and spells and other magical effects can neither reduce the target's speed nor cause the target to be {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition restrained}.

entries: When out of water, even partially, the creature gains none of these advantages. The creature can enter or leave water without ending this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Close Wounds

time.condition: which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you take damage

entries: A creature of your choice that you can see within range that has just taken damage from any source regains hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spellslot of 2nd level or higher, the Healing increases by {@dice 1d4} foreach slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Cloud of Bewilderment
entries: You create a small cloud of noxious, disorienting vapors in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range. The sphere spreads around corners and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. Any creature that ends its turn in the area of this spell must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature has disadvantage on ability checks as long as it remains in the cloud and for {@dice 1d4 + 1} rounds after leaving.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the radius of the cloud increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Cloud Wings
entries: You touch a willing creature, causing mist to form in the shape of wings on the creature's back. If the creature has a fly speed, that speed is increased by 30 feet. If the creature cannot already fly, then this spell does nothing.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Cloudburst
entries: You cause clouds to gather above a point of your choice in range and a heavy rain begins to fall in a 100-foot radius, 300-foot cylinder focused on that point. The rain causes the area to be lightly obscured. It automatically extinguishes unprotected flames and has a 50% chance of extinguishing protected flames.
This spell does not function indoors, underground, underwater, or in desert climates. After the spell ends, the water created evaporates over the next 10 minutes.

spell.name: Cloud-Walkers
entries: You cause gaseous shrouds of cloudstuff to form around the feet of any number of willing creatures within range. For the duration of this spell, each of those creatures gains a flying speed of 60 feet. Additionally, targets are lightly obscured from creatures directly below them.

If a creature is flying when the effect ends, the creature descends 60 feet per round for 1 minute until it lands, which it does safely. If it can't land after 1 minute, the creature falls the remaining distance.

spell.name: Clutch of Orcus
entries: You attempt to crush the heart of a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, a {@condition paralyzed} target takes {@dice 4d8} necrotic damage and must make another Constitution saving throw. On a successful saving throw, this spell ends.

If the target dies while you are {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on this spell, its smoking heart appears in your hand and each hostile creature within 30 feet of you that can see you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, nothing happens. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Cocoon
entries: You touch a dead humanoid or a piece of a dead humanoid. Provided that the creature has been dead no longer than 10 days, silk threads begin to coalesce from thin air around the target until it is fully encased. For the next 10 days, this spell preserves the body and begins the slow process of rebirth.

While in the cocoon, the target is protected from decay and can't become undead. If someone casts a spell on the target that would raise it from the dead, the casting time is reduced to 1 action and the spell requires no material components. The cocoon is immune to poison and psychic damage, has an AC of 10 and 1 hp. If the cocoon is destroyed, the spell ends.
If the spell lasts the full 10 days, it forms a new adult body for the target, which then calls the soul to enter that body. If the target's soul isn't free or willing to do so, the spell fails.
