The magic fashions a new body for the creature to inhabit, which likely causes the creature's race to change. The GM rolls a {@dice d100} and consults the following table to determine what form the creature takes when restored to life, or the GM chooses a form.

components.m: a silkworm cocoon, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Cold Fire
entries: You are able to change the flames of a fire into cold flames. Affected flames deal cold damage rather than fire damage to creatures that come into contact with them, including fires produced by magical sources. Flames affected by Cold Fire burn blue and white for the duration of the spell.

If the fire is part of a creature (a fire elemental, for example), then that creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes {@dice 3d8} cold damage and this spell ends. On a successful save, the creature is unaffected.

spell.name: Cold Snap
entries: This spell causes a powerful cold front to form in a 1-mile-radius from the location where you cast this spell, lowering the temperature in the affected area by 5 degrees every minute until the temperature reaches -20 degrees fahrenheit (the DMG has rules for the effects of extreme cold environments).
Spells that deal cold damage in the area of this spell while it lasts deal an additional {@damage 2d4} cold damage.

spell.name: Combust
entries: You conjure a brightly glowing comet in the air above a point on the ground within range that you can see. It immediately strikes the ground, and every creature within 10 feet of the point of impact must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 11d6} fire damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and is not knocked {@condition prone}.The comet breaks apart on impact, creating a field of dense rubble within 10 feet of the point of impact. This rubble is difficult terrain.You must cast this spell in an area with at least 40 feet of vertical space above the point of impact, or else the spell fails.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Cone of Dimness
entries: You let loose a translucent gray cone of energy drawn from the shadowy places of the world. Each creature in a 30 foot cone must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is {@condition blinded} for the next minute. A creature {@condition blinded} by this spell may repeat this save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save.

spell.name: Consumptive Field
entries: You attempt to drain the life force of those around you in a 30-foot radius sphere centered on you. When you cast this spell you may designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. When an affected creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. Whenever this spell reduces a creature to 0 hit points or damages a creature currently at 0 hit points, you gain 5 temporary hit points. When you gain temporary hit points from this spell, they stack with any temporary hit points you have already gained from this spell, up to a maximum of 20.
Undead are not affected by this spell

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} and the maximum temporary hit points you can have at a time as a result of this spell increases by 5 for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Contagious Fog
entries: You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of fog centered on a point within range. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} poison damage and contracts {@disease Cackle Fever} (DMG chapter 8). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and suffers no additional effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the radius of the fog increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Contingent Energy Resistance
entries: When you cast this spell you must touch a willing creature. The next time that creature would take damage from one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning or thunder, that creature gains resistance against that damage (including against the triggering damage). For the rest of the duration, the target has resistance against that damage type and this spell will not grant resistance against any other damage types.
This spell ends immediately if you cast it again.

spell.name: Conviction
entries: You touch one willing creature and choose one ability score. For the duration of the spell, that creature has advantage on saving throws using that ability score.

components.m: a bit of parchment with holy text written on it

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you choose one additional ability score for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Corona of Cold
entries: You surround yourself with a protective aura of cold that is harmful to others within a 10-foot radius sphere centered on you. You have resistance to fire damage. Additionally, each creature other than you that starts its turn in your aura must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d10} cold damage and has disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity saves for the next minute, as they begin to shiver uncontrollably. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and suffers no additional effects.
If a creature is no longer in the area of this spell may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the ongoing effect for itself on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Corporeal Instability
entries: Your touch transforms a creature into a spongy, amorphous mass, its shape melting and uncontrollably writhing. Choose a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 3d12} psychic damage and is {@condition paralyzed} and {@condition blinded} for the duration. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and this spell has no additional effect.
At the end of each of its turns, a {@condition paralyzed} target takes {@damage 3d12} psychic damage and may make another Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends.

spell.name: Corpse Candle
entries: A spectral, skeletal floating hand carrying a lit candle appears at a point you choose within range. The candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet. As a bonus action on your turn you can command the hand to move up to 30 feet in any direction. The hand and candle vanishes if it is ever more than 30 feet away from you or if you cast this spell again.

Any creature within the light cast by this candle is outlined with a sickly greenish light. {@condition Invisible|XPHB} creatures within the radius of this spell can't benefit from being {@condition invisible} and creatures on the ethereal plane appear as wispy outlines

components.m: a piece of corpse untreated by any manner of preservative

spell.name: Corrosive Grasp
entries: Your hand glistens and smokes as you strike out at a nearby creature. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d4} acid damage and an additional {@damage 2d4} acid damage at the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage (both initial and later) increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Crawling Darkness

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

You conjure a shroud of dark, writhing tentacles around your body. These tentacles do not hinder your movement and provide you with three-quarters cover. You have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks and can grapple targets without requiring a free hand.

As an action on your turn while this spell lasts, you can command the tentacles to attack one creature within 5 feet of you. In addition, whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, you may use your reaction to have the tentacles strike back at your attacker. With either option, make a melee spell attack against the target, which deals {@damage 5d10} bludgeoning damage on a hit.

spell.name: Creaking Cacophony
entries: You create a chaotic medley of groans and creaks, as if hundreds of intertwined trees and branches were grinding together. Choose a point within range that you can see. The cacophony affects all creatures that can hear in a 40-foot radius sphere centered on that point. All affected creatures within the area have disadvantage on perception checks that involve hearing and all spellcasters make {@status Concentration|XPHB} checks at disadvantage to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on spells.

In addition, the cacophony enhances and focuses sound. Creatures in the area that do not have immunity or resistance to thunder damage gain vulnerability to thunder damage until they leave the area of the spell.

spell.name: Creeping Cold
entries: You reach out your hand and make a crushing motion, turning the target's sweat to ice as frost forms on and inside their skin. One creature within range that you can see takes {@dice 1d6} cumulative cold damage per round for the next three rounds ({@dice 1d6} on the first round, {@dice 2d6} on the second round, {@dice 3d6} on the third round). The creature can make a Constitution saving throw each round, halving the damage for that turn on a success.

components.m: a small glass or pottery vessel filled with ice

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can concentrate on this spell for one additional round for each slot level above 2nd, with increasing cumulative damage each round ({@dice 4d6} on round 4, {@dice 5d6} on round 5, etc).

spell.name: Critical Strike
entries: Until the start of your next turn, whenever you make a melee weapon attack you deal an extra {@damage 1d6} damage and can score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, this spell lasts for one additional round for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Crown of Glory
entries: You crown yourself with your deity's favor. When you cast this spell, choose one other willing creature as your champion. For the duration of the spell, you are proficient in all charisma based skills. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any Charisma ability check you make.

In addition, the creature designated as your champion is immune to fear, gains 10 temporary hit points at the start  of each of its turns and has advantage on all attack rolls it makes. If any of these temporary hit points remain when the spell ends, they are lost. The creature also can attack twice, instead of once, when it takes the Attack action on its turn. It ignores this benefit if it already has a feature, like Extra Attack, that gives it extra attacks.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level or higher, you may instead designate up to three creatures as your champions.

spell.name: Crumble
entries: You bring the concentrated forces of erosion to bear on an unattended, nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried, or 5-foot section of a structure. The target takes {@damage 10d6} force damage. This damage ignores damage threshold, if the object has it. If this reduces the target to 0 hit points, it crumbles to dust.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Curse of Impending Blades
entries: You curse a creature, causing it to have difficulty avoiding attacks, often seeming to stumble into harm's way. For the duration of the spell, other creatures have advantage on attacks they make against the cursed creature and the cursed creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

components.m: a nail through a piece of leather

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration is {@status Concentration|XPHB}, up to 10 minutes. If you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the Duration is 8 hours. If you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the Duration is 24 hours. If you use a 9th level spell slot, the spell lasts until it is dispelled. Using a spell slot of 5th level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

spell.name: Curse of Lycanthropy

m.text: a pint of animal blood, which the spell consumes

entries: Dipping your hand in blood, you call upon the curse of lycanthropy to destroy your foe. Make a melee spell attack against one creature in range. On a hit, the creature takes {@damage 10d10} necrotic damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points it dies, as {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier giant rats claw their way out of its body. These rats use the giant rat stat block, only a creature bitten by one of them must make a Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wererat lycanthropy (your GM has the creatures' statistics). These rats are not hostile to you and your companions but do not listen to your commands. If there are no other living creatures in the area, they disperse in random directions to spread their disease.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and the number of wererats created increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Cursed Blade
entries: You draw upon dark powers and whisper a curse as you touch a melee weapon. For the duration, any damage caused by weapon attacks using this weapon can't be healed by any means unless the individual has first received a remove curse or greater restoration spell. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action.

spell.name: Cyclonic Blast
entries: A blast of whirling wind issues forth from your
outstretched fingers, sweeping up all who stand in its way.

The twisting torrent of wind forms a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide in a direction you choose, originating on you. Each creature and object in the line must make a Strength saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d8} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save. If a creature fails its save by 5 or more, it is also pushed up to 120 feet away from you in a direction following the line following the line. If a creature cannot travel the full distance (for example, if there is a solid barrier in the way), it takes an additional {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half the initial damage and is neither pushed nor knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the initial and secondary damage each increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Daggerspell Stance
entries: While you are wielding a pair of daggers, both of those weapons become magic weapons with a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls. In addition, whenever you take the dodge action while holding one of these daggers in each hand you have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. If another creature tries to use one of the daggers to make an attack roll, this spell ends on that dagger.

spell.name: Dark Way
entries: You create a ribbonlike, weightless unbreakable bridge. This bridge must be anchored at both ends to solid objects, but otherwise can be at any angle. If the anchor points are moved or destroyed, the spell ends. The bridge is 5 feet wide, 1 inch thick, and has a maximum length of 120 feet.

The bridge can support a maximum of 500 pounds. If a creature stepping onto the bridge causes the total weight total to exceed this limit, that creature falls through the bridge as if it weren't there instead. A creature that desires to pass through the Dark Way can do so at will, no action required. The bridge provides no cover from ranged attacks or spells and unattended objects pass freely through it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the maximum length increases by 60 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Darkbolt
entries: You call forth a nimbus of jet-black energy, which allows you to shoot black bolts of power. When you first cast this spell, or as an action on your turn at any point before this spell ends, you may hurl one or more bolts of dark energy  at targets within range. You may throw a maximum number of bolts equal to 2 + your spellcasting modifier.

If you choose to throw more than one bolt in a single action, they can be at one target or several. A target must make a Dexterity saving throw for each bolt. A creature that fails its saving throw takes {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage. In addition, the first time a creature fails its saving throw by 5 or more in a turn, it is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

An undead creature that fails its saving throw instead regains {@dice 2d8} hit points and has its movement speed increased by 5 feet until the end of its next turn. A creature can choose to fail its saving throw.
If you stop {@status concentration||concentrating} on this spell before you have thrown the maximum number of bolts, the extra bolts are lost.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the maximum number of bolts you may throw increases by 1 for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Darkfire
entries: Dark flames appear in your hand. The flames remain there for the duration of the spell and harms neither you nor your equipment. They emit no normal light, though can be seen by creatures with {@sense darkvision|XPHB} as if they shed the light of a torch. When you cast this spell, or as an action while the spell lasts, you can use these flames to strike at foes. When you do so, you can choose to make a ranged spell attack at a target within 120 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d8} fire damage. Alternatively, you can make a melee spell attack at a target within 5 feet of you, dealing {@damage 6d8} fire damage on a hit instead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Darkvision, Mass
entries: You grant yourself and any number of creatures in range the ability to see in the dark. For the duration, those creatures have {@sense darkvision|XPHB} out to a range of 60 feet.

components.m: either a pinch of dried carrot or an agate

spell.name: Deadfall
entries: A tangled mass of logs, huge branches and fallen trees appears in the air, immediately collapsing in on itself and potentially trapping and crushing those caught below. Each creature and object within a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 15d6} bludgeoning damage, is knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition restrained} on a failed save, or takes half as much damage and is only knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.
A creature {@condition restrained} by this spell can use an action on its turn to attempt a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.
The spell fails if there is not at least 40 feet of vertical space directly above the point.

This spell leaves behind a considerable amount of dead wood and detritus. This pile of detritus is 5 feet high, with a 20-foot-radius, which counts as difficult terrain. The pile of detritus is flammable. Any 5-foot cube of detritus exposed to fire or lightning damage ignites, burning away over the course of the next hour and dealing {@damage 2d8} fire damage to any creature that starts its turn in the fire.

spell.name: Deafening Clang
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon erupts with a blast of sonic energy, and the attack deals an extra {@damage 1d8} thunder damage to the target. Additionally, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition deafened} for 1 minute.
A creature {@condition deafened} by this spell can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, it is no longer {@condition deafened}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage dealt by the attack increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot.

spell.name: Death Armor
entries: Black flames crackle to life around your body, wreathing you in necrotic armor. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it. The armor grants you resistance to necrotic damage. In addition, whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, the armor erupts with necrotic flames, dealing {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage to the attacker.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, then whenever your shield deals damage to a creature, you gain temporary hit points equal to half that damage.

spell.name: Death Dragon
entries: Calling upon dark powers, you surround yourself in a dragon-shaped cocoon of bones and necrotic energy. This cocoon provides the following benefits:

items: You gain 75 temporary hit points. If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost.

You are proficient with your unarmed strikes and your reach with your unarmed strikes increases by 5 feet. Your unarmed strikes deal {@dice 2d6}+ your spellcasting ability modifier slashing damage plus {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage.
When you make an unarmed strike, you can use your spellcasting modifier, instead of Strength, for the attack and damage rolls.
You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn.
You have resistance to necrotic damage, immunity to poison damage and cannot be {@condition poisoned}.
You have advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

spell.name: Death Pact
entries: You permit a willing creature to enter into a binding agreement with a deity or other being of power, allowing them to return to life if slain for a price. The being must be known to you: a god, a primordial, a demon prince, or some other being of cosmic power willing to bargain with you.

When the spell is cast, the creature must bargain with the being to determine an appropriate payment. The being is not under any compulsions to make a bargain. Typical payments might include such tasks as: founding a new temple in a major city, recovering a very rare magical item, defeating a powerful cleric of an opposing deity, or making an offering worth at least 25,000 gp. Once a payment has been determined the being sets a length of time, typically no more than a month, for the creature to fulfill its own end. Either the being of power or the creature it is bargaining with can end negotiations before a bargain has been struck with no negative repercussions.

Once, after the bargain has been made and the creature would die for any reason except old age, even if they have not yet fulfilled their end of the agreement, the creature is immediately restored to life with all its hit points. This spell closes all wounds, neutralizes any poison, cures all diseases, and lifts any curses affecting the creature when it died. The spell replaces damaged or missing organs and limbs.

If the creature fails to fulfill its end of the bargain within the allotted time, the creature immediately dies and cannot be restored to life by any means until another creature has fulfilled the bargain on their behalf.
This spell automatically fails if the creature is already under the effects of another casting of Death Pact.

spell.name: Death Throes
entries: You imbue a willing creature with vengeful energy. If the target is reduced to zero hit points before the spell ends, this energy bursts forth violently. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d6} necrotic damage and {@damage 5d6} fire damage on a failed save, of half as much damage on a successful one.
This spell ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the fire damage and the necrotic damage each increase by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Death Ward, Mass
entries: You choose any number of creatures within 30 feet of you and grant them a measure of protection from death.
The first time one of those creatures would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, the creature instead drops to 1 hit point, and the spell no longer affects that creature.

If the spell is still in effect when one of the creatures is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantaneously without dealing damage, that effect is instead negated against the target, and this spell no longer affects that creature.

m.text: powdered silver worth at least 2,500 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Decomposition
entries: Calling upon your link to the natural world, you create an aura of decay, which affect all hostile creatures in a 60-foot-radius sphere centered on you. Until the spell ends, the sphere moves with you, centered on you. Whenever an affected creature within the area takes damage the wound begin to fester, causing that creature to take an additional {@dice 3d6} points of necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns until this spell ends. If a creature takes damage while already affected by this spell, they do not suffer any additional effects.

A creature can spend an action on its turn to make a Wisdom (medicine) check against your spell save DC to end this effect on a creature. Any source of magical healing also immediately ends this effect on a creature. This does not prevent the creature from being affected by this spell again if it takes further damage.

spell.name: Decoy Image
entries: You create illusory copies of yourself and any number of allies of your choice within 30 feet of you. The illusory copies appear at any point within range that you can see. The illusion seems completely real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted. The illusion cannot damage or otherwise cause harm any creature (such as by extremely loud sounds or a troglodyte's stench).
The illusion mimics what you and your allies do, staying a distance away from you that you specify, up to 300 feet. If the illusion takes any damage, it disappears and the spell ends.
Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an
Illusion. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an Illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC.

Additionally, If the terrain differs significantly between that of an illusion and that of the creature it is mimicking, or if any creature takes an action the illusion can't duplicate (such as climbing a tree), then any creature observing the illusion can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the Illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and any noise it makes sounds hollow to the creature.
If one of your allies moves more than 30 feet away from you, that creature immediately disappears from the illusion.

spell.name: Deep Breath
entries: Your lungs fill with air, though you feel no need to exhale. For the duration, you do not need to breathe. When this spell ends, you can continue to hold your breath as if you had just taken a deep breath.

spell.name: Deeper Darkvision
entries: You touch a willing creature to grant it the ability to see in the dark, both magical and nonmagical. For the duration, that creature has {@sense darkvision|XPHB} out to a range of 60 feet. If a creature already has darkvision, this spell increases the range of their {@sense darkvision|XPHB} by 60 feet. Additionally, this spell allows the creature to see in magical darkness as if it were nonmagical darkness.

spell.name: Defenestrating Sphere
entries: You create a small, violently swirling sphere of air and launch it at your enemies. When you cast the spell, you can make a ranged spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d6} bludgeoning damage and must make a strength Saving throw if the creature is Medium sized or smaller. On a failed save, the creature is also knocked {@condition prone}. If the creature fails this save by 5 or more, it is swept up by the sphere and thrown 10 feet into the air, landing {@condition prone} at a random location within 10 feet of their original position and taking falling damage as normal.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet and repeat the attack against a creature.

m.text: a gray pearl worth 100gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Dehydrate
entries: You draw the moisture out of a creature you can see within range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. Constructs and Undead aren't affected, and Plants and water elementals make this saving throw with disadvantage. The target takes {@damage 6d8} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, if the target fails its saving throw 5 by or more, it also suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion}.
Nonmagical plants within 5 feet of the creature that aren't creatures, such as trees and shrubs, wither and die instantly.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Deific Vengeance
entries: A burst of radiance emanates from you in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d8} radiant damage. An undead that fails this save becomes {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. An undead can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage with no additional effects. A creature has disadvantage on the initial save if it has dealt damage to you or one of your allies in the last 1 minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, increase the radiant damage by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Delusions of Grandeur
entries: This spell creates delusions within the mind of a  creature you can see, manipulating them into bouts of overconfident recklessness. At the start of each round, the creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, nothing happens. On a failed save, the creature is enamored with its own prowess and can take no actions on its turn except for those involving weapon attacks and can't take reactions until the start of its next turn.

spell.name: Demon Dirge
entries: You utter ancient words, wreaking havoc on the corporeal form of a creature of evil. Choose one creature you can see within range. If that creature is a Fiend it must make a Constitution saving throw at the beginning of each of its turns while the spell lasts. A Fiend takes {@damage 3d10} radiant damage on a failed save. In addition, a Demon that fails  this save is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Demonhide
entries: Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch gains resistance against radiant damage and against bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

spell.name: Desiccating Bubble
entries: A 15-foot-diameter sphere of supernaturally dry air appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range and lasts for the duration. Any creature that ends its turn within the sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. Constructs and undead aren't affected, and plants and water elementals make this saving throw with disadvantage. The creature takes {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage on  a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. As a bonus action, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet. If you ram the sphere into a creature, that creature must make the saving throw against the sphere's damage, and the sphere stops moving this turn. When you move the sphere, you can direct it over barriers up to 5 feet tall and jump it across pits up to 10 feet wide.
Nonmagical plants that come into contact with the sphere that aren't creatures, such as trees and shrubs, wither and die instantly.

components.m: a tiny bag or bladder filled with air and a sprinkle of dust

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Devil Blight
entries: You utter ancient words, wreaking havoc on the corporeal form of a creature of evil. Choose one creature you can see within range. If that creature is a Fiend it must make a Constitution saving throw at the beginning of each of its turns while the spell lasts. A Fiend takes {@damage 3d10} radiant damage on a failed save. In addition, a Devil that fails this save is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Diamondsteel
entries: You touch a suit of nonmagical metal armor, imbuing it with a sparkling shine. For the duration, any creature that wears the armor gains +2AC in addition to what the armor normally provides. In addition, while you are wearing the armor, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

m.text: diamond dust worth at least 50 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Dinosaur Stampede
entries: You manifest a herd of spectral, stampeding dinosaurs to crush your enemies.. When you cast this spell, the spectral stampede erupts from you in a 10-foot-wide, 40-foot-long line, charging in a direction you choose. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d10} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.
You can create a new stampede as an action while the spell lasts. When you create a new stampede, the point where it originates is where the last stampede ended rather than at you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Dire Hunger
entries: You fill another creature you can see in range with a feral hunger, to the point where it can think of little else. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails the saving throw, the target becomes maddened by terrible pangs of hunger for the duration, viewing all creatures as a food source.

The creature's face distends and elongates into a toothy snout filled with serrated teeth. The creature gains a bite attack, which counts as a natural weapon it can use to make unarmed strikes. If it hits with them, it deals piercing damage based on the creature's size instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike, according to the following table:

In addition, the target can't take reactions and must use its action each turn to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach using its bite attack. If there is no creature within its reach, it must first move as far as it can towards the nearest creature.
The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

spell.name: Dirge of Discord
entries: You create an unholy, cacophonous dirge that fills your targets' minds with the screams of the dying, the wailing of the damned, and the howling of the mad, which affects all creatures in a 30-foot radius sphere centered on you. When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. An affected creature's speed is halved in the area, and when the creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} until the end of its next turn.

components.m: a pinch of ashes from a destrachan

spell.name: Discern Shapechanger
entries: For the duration, you can see the true form of creatures within 60 feet, including Shapechangers and creatures transformed by magic. In addition, you automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on saving throws against them.
The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

components.m: a balm of honey and lotus flower

spell.name: Dispelling Breath
entries: You exhale a cloud of starlight motes, which gravitate towards sources of magic within the cloud. For each creature, object or magical effect in a 15-foot cone, any spell of 3rd level or lower ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

spell.name: Dispelling Screen
entries: You create a shimmering, immobile screen of violet energy up to 60 feet long, 30 feet high, and 1 inch thick -centered on a point you can see within range. Alternatively, you can shape the wall into a Sphere up to 30 feet in diameter centered on a point you choose within range.

For the duration, whenever a creature, object or magical effect passes through the screen, any spell of 4th level or lower on it ends. For each spell of 5th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.

components.m: a sheet of fine lead crystal

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

spell.name: Disquietude
entries: You fill the mind of a Humanoid that you can see in range with doubt and suspicion, to the point where it cannot bear to be near other creatures. For the duration of the spell, if any creatures are within 15 feet of the target, the target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the target must move so that no creatures are within 15 feet of them before they can take any other actions. If they cannot move in such a way, or if moving would take them into direct danger (such as the edge of a cliff) the creature instead must spend its entire turn taking the dodge action.

spell.name: Disrupt Undead
entries: Choose an Undead creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional Undead for each slot level above 3rd. The Undead must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Dissonant Chant
entries: You create a distracting and discordant chant. Each creature other than yourself within a 100 foot radius of you that can hear you has disadvantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing and on Constitution saving throws they make to maintain their {@status Concentration|XPHB} on a spell. In addition, each creature other than yourself that is {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on a spell at the start of its turn while in the area must make a DC10 Constitution saving throw or else lose {@status Concentration|XPHB} on that spell.

spell.name: Dissonant Chord
entries: You emit a terrible, piercing note. The note pulses in the air, radiating like a shockwave and audible out to 300 feet. Each creature you choose within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 8d6} thunder damage. A creature that succeeds on its saving throw takes half as much damage. A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes damage if it's in the spell's area.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Distort Speech
entries: Choose one creature that you can see within range to make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, any words the target speaks for the duration come out as meaningless gibberish. Spells requiring verbal components automatically fail and any attempts to communicate verbally are unintelligible. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Distract
entries: You point at a creature you can see in range. That creature makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, ambient noises and objects suddenly seem every bit as interesting than the threats before them. The next attack roll made against that creature is made with advantage.

spell.name: Distracting Ray
entries: You fire a dazzling ray at a creature in range that you can see. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, the target also has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws that they make to maintain their {@status Concentration|XPHB} on a spell for the next minute.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Divine Agility
entries: You touch one creature, imbuing it with agility and skill in combat. Until the spell ends, the target gains the following benefits:

items: The target has advantage on Dexterity ability checks and on attack rolls made using a finesse or a ranged weapon.
The target can attack twice, instead of once, when it takes the Attack action on its turn. It ignores this benefit if it already has a feature, like Extra Attack, that gives it extra attacks.

Whenever the target is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

spell.name: Divine Insight
entries: Immediately after making an ability check roll, before knowing the result, you may use your reaction to gain a bonus to that roll equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. Once you have used this ability three times, this spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may gain a bonus on two additional ability check rolls before the spell ends for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Divine Interdiction
entries: You call upon your deity to quell the healing powers of others. Choose a point you can see within range. Creatures within a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on that point can't regain hit points for the duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the radius increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 2nd. When you cast this spell with a 5th level spell slot or higher, you can use a bonus action on your turn to move the sphere up to 20 feet in any direction.

spell.name: Divine Protection
entries: Golden light radiates from you in a 15-foot aura. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. Each allied creature in the aura (including you) gains a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws.

spell.name: Divine Sacrifice
entries: The first time you hit with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, you give up a portion of your own life force to empower your strike. The attack deals an extra {@damage 5d6} radiant damage to the target. Additionally, you take 10 necrotic damage. The necrotic damage you take ignores resistance and immunity.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage dealt by the attack increases by {@dice 2d6} and the damage you take increases by 4 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Dolorous Blow
entries: You touch a weapon, imbuing it with a longing for battle. Until the spell ends, weapon attacks made with that weapon score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

spell.name: Doomtide
entries: You fill a 20-foot-radius sphere with illusory black, creeping mist that vaguely resembles thousands of slender grasping tentacles centered on a point you choose within range. It lasts for the duration or until strong wind disperses the mist, ending the spell. Its area is heavily obscured. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Intelligence saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 2d12} psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the start of it's next turn on a failed save, or half as much damage and is not {@condition stunned} on a successful one.

The mist moves 20 feet away from the point where it was cast at the start of each of your turns, rolling along the surface of the ground. The mist, being heavier than air, sinks to the lowest level of the land, even pouring down openings.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Downdraft
entries: Each creature flying more than 10 feet above the ground in a 20-foot-radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range must make a Strength saving throw. A creature plummets up to 100 feet straight downward on a failed save, taking falling damage if the downdraft causes them to hit the ground or collide with an object. On a successful save, they plummet up to 50 feet instead.

spell.name: Draconic Might
entries: You bolster yourself or a creature you touch with the might of a dragon. For the duration, the target has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects and can make a Wisdom (Perception) check on its turn as a bonus action. In addition, choose one of the following damage types: acid, lightning, poison, fire, or cold. For the duration, the target's weapon attacks have a +1 bonus to attack rolls and deal an extra {@dice 1d6} of the chosen type when they hit.

spell.name: Dragon Ally
entries: This spell summons a Dragon. When you cast this spell, you may choose one type of dragon from among the five chromatic (black, blue, green, red or white) or five metallic dragon (brass, bronze, copper, gold, silver) types. If you do, the Dragon is of that type. If you know a specific dragon's name, you can speak that name when you cast this spell to request that creature, though you might get a different creature anyway (GM's choice).

You may ask the dragon to perform one task in exchange for a payment from you. Tasks might range from the simple (fly us across the chasm, help us fight a battle) to the complex (spy on our enemies, protect us on our foray into the dungeon). You must be able to communicate with the dragon to bargain for its services.

The summoned Dragon is under no compulsion to behave in any particular way. It typically requires payment for its services, which takes the form of coins, gems, or other precious objects the dragon can add to its hoard. This payment must be made before the dragon agrees to perform any services.

As a rule of thumb, a task that can be measured in minutes requires a payment worth 100 gp per minute. A task measured in hours requires 1,000 gp per hour. And a task measured in days (up to 10 days) requires 10,000 gp per day. The DM can adjust these payments based on the circumstances under which you cast the spell. If the task is aligned with the creature's ethos, the payment might be halved or even waived (chromatic dragons are more willing to perform tasks that are evil, while metallic dragons are more willing to perform tasks that are good). Non-hazardous tasks typically require only half the suggested payment, while especially dangerous tasks might require a greater gift. Creatures rarely accept tasks that seem suicidal.
At the end of its task, or when the duration bargained for elapses, the creature returns to the place it was summoned from (after reporting back to you, if appropriate and possible).

A creature enlisted to join your group counts as a member of it, receiving a full share of experience points awarded.This spell summons a Dragon. When you cast this spell, you may choose one type of dragon from among the five chromatic (black, blue, green, red or white) or five metallic dragon (brass, bronze, copper, gold, silver) types. If you do, the Dragon is of that type. If you know a specific dragon's name, you can speak that name when you cast this spell to request that creature, though you might get a different creature anyway (GM's choice).

You may ask the dragon to perform one task in exchange for a payment from you. Tasks might range from the simple (fly us across the chasm, help us fight a battle) to the complex (spy on our enemies, protect us on our foray into the dungeon). You must be able to communicate with the dragon to bargain for its services.

The summoned Dragon is under no compulsion to behave in any particular way. It typically requires payment for its services, which takes the form of coins, gems, or other precious objects the dragon can add to its hoard. This payment must be made before the dragon agrees to perform any services.

As a rule of thumb, a task that can be measured in minutes requires a payment worth 100 gp per minute. A task measured in hours requires 1,000 gp per hour. And a task measured in days (up to 10 days) requires 10,000 gp per day. The DM can adjust these payments based on the circumstances under which you cast the spell. If the task is aligned with the creature's ethos, the payment might be halved or even waived (chromatic dragons are more willing to perform tasks that are evil, while metallic dragons are more willing to perform tasks that are good). Non-hazardous tasks typically require only half the suggested payment, while especially dangerous tasks might require a greater gift. Creatures rarely accept tasks that seem suicidal.
At the end of its task, or when the duration bargained for elapses, the creature returns to the place it was summoned from (after reporting back to you, if appropriate and possible).
A creature enlisted to join your group counts as a member of it, receiving a full share of experience points awarded.

spell.name: Dragonbane Aura
entries: Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against Dragons. The protection grants several benefits:

items: Dragons have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target.
The target has advantage on saving throws against Dragon breath weapons.
The target is can't be {@condition frightened}.

m.text: powdered platinum, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Dragonskin
entries: Your skin toughens and becomes scaly like that of a chromatic dragon of a color that you choose. Your base AC becomes 13+ your Dexterity modifier. Additionally, you gain resistance to one damage type, based on the color of dragon you chose when casting this spell: acid (black), cold (white), lightning (blue), fire (red) or poison (green).
The spell ends if you don armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

spell.name: Duelward
entries: Whenever you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell before the spell ends, you may end this spell and attempt to interrupt that creature, requiring no action to do so. If the creature is casting a spell of 5th-Level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 6th level or higher, make an ability check using your Spellcasting Ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level.
On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect.

spell.name: Earth Lock
entries: You cause a 1-foot length of subterranean tunnel to constrict, closing against others who might wish to traverse its length. This spell affects only naturally occurring  tunnels made of stone or earth that are 10 feet in diameter or less. The section of wall constricts, closing entirely over the course of 1 round. Any large or smaller object or creature in the area of this spell is pushed, unharmed, to one side or the other. A creature can decide which side it ends up on, while an object is pushed to a random side. If a huge or larger object or creature is in the area when you cast this spell, it prevents the tunnel from constricting until the creature or object is moved.

As a bonus action, you or the creatures you designate when you cast this spell can command a tunnel you have secured with this spell to open or close, which takes 1 round to complete. A dispel magic spell causes the tunnel to revert to its original shape, while a knock spell temporarily suppresses the spell, causing the tunnel to open for the next 10 minutes.
If a creature burrows through the earth lock or if the tunnel is dug out, the spell ends.

m.text: a diamond chip worth at least 25 gp embedded in a piece of charcoal, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Earth Reaver
entries: Choose a spot on the ground you can see within range. The ground erupts in a shower of rocks, dirt and fire in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point. Each creature and each object that isn't being worn or carried in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@dice 6d6} bludgeoning and {@damage 4d6} fire damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and is not knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the bludgeoning damage or the fire damage (your choice) increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Earthen Grace
entries: You grant a creature you touch an affinity for earth and stone. For the duration, The target's speed increases by 10 feet and they can't be knocked {@condition prone} as long as they are standing on dirt, mud, grass, sand or stone and they have resistance to falling damage when they land on one of these types of materials. In addition, earth elementals have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Earthfast
entries: You touch a rock formation or stone structure, greatly bolstering its durability. You can bolster up to a 25-foot cube of material, granting it +2 bonus to AC and 25 hit points for the duration. This spell does not function on constructs.
If you cast this spell in the same location every day for one year the effect becomes permanent.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the hit points granted increases by 25 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Easy Climb
entries: You create a path of handholds and footholds up the surface of a cliff-face, tree trunk, wall, or other vertical obstacle. The handholds can extend down or up the surface, up to a maximum of 100 feet from a point you touch.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the maximum range the handholds will extend increases by 100 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Easy Trail
entries: The undergrowth parts for you and your companions, and paths are abundant and easy to find. For the duration of this spell, each creature you choose within 30 feet of you (including you) is not slowed by difficult terrain and cannot become lost except by magical means.

spell.name: Ebon Eyes
entries: You touch a willing creature to grant it the ability to pierce the deepest gloom. For the duration, that creature has {@sense darkvision|XPHB} out to a range of 60 feet and can see in magical darkness as though it were normal darkness.

components.m: a pinch of powdered black gemstone of any type

spell.name: Echo Skull
entries: You touch a dried animal skull, causing it to glow with a green radiance, which quickly fades. For the duration of the spell, as long as you and the skull remain on the same plane, you are telepathically linked to the skull. As an action, you can see and hear through the skull as if you were standing where it is until the start of your next turn.
During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your present location.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level, the duration increases to 24 hours, to 1 week at 7th level, to 1 year at 8th level and indefinitely at 9th level.

spell.name: Effulgent Epuration
entries: When you cast this spell, 9 floating silvery spheres the size of your head appear and begin orbiting around your body. As a bonus action on your turn, you may command one or more of these spheres to begin orbiting another creature or call them all back to you.

For the duration, whenever a spell is cast that targets a creature one of these spheres orbits, or includes them in its area of effect, that creature may choose to have one of these spheres absorb the spell instead. A spell absorbed this way fails and has no effect. Once a sphere has absorbed a spell, it fades away.

spell.name: Electric Jolt
entries: A white-hot electric spark dances on your fingertip and then bolts toward a creature you can see in range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} lightning damage. The target has disadvantage on this save if it is wearing armor made of metal.
This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Electric Loop

components.m: a loop of copper wire and a magnet

entries: Electricity leaps from your fingertips, arcing among foes in a loop around you. Each creature of your choice within 15 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} lightning damage

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Elemental Body
entries: This spell transforms you into a powerful elemental warrior. The transformation lasts for the duration, until you drop to 0 hit points or die, or until you take an action to end the spell early. The new form can be either an earth, water, air or fire elemental myrmidon (MToF). Your game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen myrmidon. You retain your alignment and personality. You GM has the creatures' statistics.

You assume the hit points of your new form. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed. If you reverted as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to your normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce your normal form to 0 hit points, you are not knocked {@condition unconscious}.

You are limited in the actions you can perform by the nature of your new form and you can't cast spells. Your gear melds into the new form, with the exception of the armor used to cast this spell, which your new form fills. Your new form is proficient with this armor. You can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of your other equipment.

m.text: a suit of plate armor worth at least 1500 gp

spell.name: Embrace the Wild
entries: You touch a willing creature and bestow upon it a magical enhancement as it takes on the physical features of a beast. Choose one of the following effects; the target gains that effect until the spell ends.

items: {@b Charge.} If the creature moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature then hits it with a melee attack on the same turn, the creature takes an extra {@damage 2d6} damage and must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be knocked {@condition prone}.
{@b Rampage.} When the target reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, it can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make another melee attack.
{@b Pack tactics.} The target has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of its allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.
{@b Blood Frenzy.} The target has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Emerald Flame Fist
entries: One of your hands bursts into an aura of brilliant emerald flame, shedding bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. As an action on your  turn while your fist is alight, you may make a melee spell attack against a creature or object within 5 feet of you. On a hit the target takes {@damage 10d10} fire damage and is engulfed by  an aura of flame for the next minute. At the beginning of each of its turns, a target engulfed in flame must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 3d10} fire damage. On a success, the fires have been doused and the spell ends. An object engulfed in flame automatically fails this saving throw. Your fist remains alight until you successfully strike a target or you stop {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on the spell, whichever comes first.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the initial damage and ongoing damage each increase by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Energized Shield
entries: For the next minute, a willing creature you touch has resistance to one damage type of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. The next time the target hits a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, the attack deals an extra {@damage 2d6} damage of the chosen damage type to the target, and the spell ends. This spells ends immediately if you cast it again.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Energy Ebb
entries: You release a black needle of crackling energy that suppresses the life force of whatever creature it touches. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature you can see within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d8} necrotic damage. Until the spell ends, you can use your action on each of your turns to automatically deal {@damage 8d8} necrotic damage to the target.

The spell ends if you use your action to do anything else, if the target is ever outside the spell's range, or if the target has total cover from you. Whenever the spell deals damage to a target, it's maximum hit points are reduced by half the damage dealt. The maximum hit point reduction lasts until the target receives a greater restoration, heal, wish spell or similar magic.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Energy Immunity
entries: For the duration, the willing creature you touch has immunity to one damage type of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder

spell.name: Energy Spheres
entries: You create a circle of five colored spheres that orbit your head at a distance of 1 foot. These spheres provide as much light as a torch and each one corresponds to a different one of five damage types (acid, cold, lightning, fire, thunder). These spheres can be used offensively or defensively.

When you cast this spell, or as a bonus action on your turn, you can command one of these spheres to strike a creature you can see in range. Make a ranged spell attack against that creature. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d8} damage of the corresponding damage type.
Alternatively, if you would take damage and still have a sphere of that damage type, you may use your reaction to reduce that damage by {@dice 5d8}.
Once a sphere has been used either to attack or absorb damage, it is destroyed and cannot be used again.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage dealt or absorbed increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Energy Transformation Field
entries: You create a lasting zone of transformative magic that absorbs magic energy from spellcasting in order to power another spell tied to that location. This field extends in a 30-foot radius sphere from a point you choose within range. When you cast this spell, choose another spell you can cast of 5th-level or lower to link to the field. The field absorbs the magic of spells cast within this sphere, causing those spells to fail and have no effect. When the field absorbs a spell, it gains a number of charges equal to the level of the absorbed spell. The field can have a maximum of 10 charges at one time.

When the field has a number of charges equal to or greater than the level of the spell linked to it, it attempts to cast the spell using your spellcasting ability, expending a number of charges equal to the level of the linked spell. The field acts on initiative order 20 and can only cast one spell per round, requiring no components. If the spell requires a target, the field will choose the valid target nearest to the center of the energy transformation field. If a linked spell requires {@status Concentration|XPHB} to maintain, the field maintains {@status Concentration|XPHB} for the maximum duration before casting the linked spell again. Spells cast by the field are not absorbed by it.

Ongoing spells that were initially cast outside of the area are not absorbed upon entering the field. A dispel magic spell cast on the field is absorbed by the field unless cast with a 9th-level spell slot, and an antimagic field prevents the energy transformation field from absorbing magical energy while it lasts. If two or more field spells share an overlapping area, each field has an equal chance of absorbing a spell effect in that area. Only a wish or similar spell can destroy the energy transformation field.

m.text: the central eye from a beholder and 5000 gp with of powdered diamond, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Energy Vortex
entries: Energy wells within you and explodes outward in a furious vortex. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, lightning, or fire. Each creature in a 20-foot radius of you other than you must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d8} damage of the chosen type on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
You can choose to include yourself in the vortex. If you do, the damage is increased to {@dice 8d8} of the chosen type and creatures (including you) make their saving throws with disadvantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Enervating Breath
entries: You exhale a cloud of living darkness, draining the life from anything it touches. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 12d8} necrotic damage on a failed save and has its maximum hit points reduced by half the damage taken. A creature takes half as much damage on a successful save and does not have its maximum hit points reduced.
Whenever this spell deals damage to a creature, you regain hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt.
Until the spell ends, you can use your action on each of your turns to repeat this attack. The spell ends if you use your action to do anything else.

spell.name: Enhance Familiar
entries: With a touch, you infuse your familiar with power. Until the spell ends, your familiar gains 20 temporary hit points and a +2 bonus to its AC. In addition, your familiar gains the ability to attack, using either an attack from its stat block or a slam attack. This attack is a melee weapon attack it can make against a creature within 5 feet of your itself, which uses your spell attack modifier to hit and deals {@damage 1d8} + your spellcasting modifier force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, your familiar gains 5 additional temporary hit points for and increases the damage of its slam attack by 1 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Entangling Staff
entries: At your touch, your quarterstaff sprouts wiggling vines that grasp at anything they touch. For the duration, whenever you hit a creature with a melee attack using that weapon, the target is also {@condition restrained} and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. A target {@condition restrained} in this way can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself. If you are ever more than 5 feet away from a {@condition restrained} target, the target is automatically freed.

You can only have one creature {@condition restrained} at a time and are unable to use that weapon to make attacks until the {@condition restrained} target frees itself or you command your staff to release the target, which requires no action. When the spell ends, the vines wither and release any target they are currently  restraining.

spell.name: Enveloping Cocoon
entries: A cocoon of shimmering blue-green force encloses a large or smaller creature you can see in range. When you cast the spell, the creature trapped inside the cocoon is surrounded in a solid barrier, which prevents any matter from passing through it and blocking and spells cast into or out from the area. A creature inside the cocoon can't leave it by nonmagical means. If the creature tries to use any form of teleportation, it must first make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the creature can use that magic to exit the cocoon. On a failure, the creature can't exit the cocoon and wastes the use of the spell or effect. The cocoon also extends into the Ethereal Plane, blocking ethereal travel.

The cocoon lasts until you either stop {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on it or the cocoon is destroyed. The cocoon has an AC of 15 and 100 hit points. The cocoon is too confining to permit much movement and any attacks made by the creature inside the cocoon have disadvantage.
In addition, when you cast this spell, choose one of the following two options:

items: The creature inside the cocoon heals 1 hp at the end of each of its turns.
The creature inside the cocoon takes. {@damage 4d6} force damage whenever it hits the cocoon with a melee or ranged attack.

entries: This spell can't be dispelled by a dispel magic spell.

spell.name: Essence of the Raptor
entries: Your move speed increases to 60 feet, unless it is higher normally, and you have advantage on Dexterity checks and Dexterity-based weapon attacks. In addition, if you move at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and hit it with a melee weapon attack, that creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be knocked {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Evil Glare
entries: Your eyes begin to tingle, brimming with dark energy. When you cast this spell, you may target a creature you can see within range with your gaze. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 8d10} psychic damage and is {@condition paralyzed} for the next minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition paralyzed}. A {@condition paralyzed} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The creature must be able to see you to be affected. A creature immune to the {@condition frightened} condition is immune to this spell.
On each of your turns until the spell ends, you can use your action to target another creature with your gaze. You can't target the same creature twice with a single casting of this spell.

spell.name: Exacting Shot
entries: You touch a willing creature. Until the spell ends, that creature's ranged weapon attacks ignore half and three quarters cover, and attacking at long range doesn't impose disadvantage on their ranged weapon attack rolls. In addition, the target's ranged weapon attacks deal an additional {@damage 1d8} damage.

spell.name: Excavate
entries: A passage appears at a point that you can see in range on a wooden, plaster, or stone surface (such as a wall, a  ceiling, or a floor) within range. You choose the opening's dimensions: up to 10 feet wide, 10 feet tall, and 60 feet deep. The passage creates no instability in the structure surrounding it.

spell.name: Explosive Cascade
entries: You cause a bright ball of flame to manifest and streak across the battlefield, immolating anything it touches. The flame appears at a point you can see within range and extends up to 60 along a path you choose, filling each 5-foot cube it passes through with fire. Each creature and unattended object within this path must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 9d6} fire damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. A creature or object can be affected only once by each casting of this spell.

components.m: bat guano, sulphur and copper packed into a metal tube with one closed end

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} and the path extends for 10 additional feet for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Eye of Power
entries: You create an {@condition invisible}, magical eye within range that hovers in the air for the duration. You mentally receive visual information from the eye, which has both normal vision and {@sense darkvision|XPHB} out to 60 feet. The eye can see in every direction. As an action, you can move the eye up to 30 feet in any direction. There is no limit to how far away from you the eye can move, but it can't enter another plane of existence. A solid barrier blocks the eye's movement, but the eye can pass through an opening as small as 1 inch in diameter.

In addition, you can cast any spell of 3rd level or lower that has a range other than Self through the eye. Any spell cast in this manner functions as though it had been cast from the eye's location rather than yours.

spell.name: Eyes of the King
entries: You summon four Fiendish servants, which appear in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. They look like medium-sized bats that blaze with a faint ghoul-green light and use the Eye of the King stat block below. One of these creatures disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The bats are allies to you and your companions. In combat, the bats share your initiative count, but take their turns immediately after yours. You can telepathically communicate with the bats and they obey your mental commands (no action required by you). If you don't issue any, they take the Dodge action and use their move to avoid danger. Additionally, as an action, you can choose one of your bats to see through their eyes and hear through their ears until the start of your next turn gaining the benefits of their blindsight. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regard to your own senses. While doing so, you can freely switch between different bats, no action required.

spell.name: Faith Healing
