entries: A creature you can see within range regains a number of hit points equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on Undead or Constructs.

As part of casting this spell, you can have it consume the material component used. If you do, this spell instead restores hit points equal to 4 + your spellcasting ability modifier and the range is increased to 30 feet.

m.text: a vial of powdered silver worth 25 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st, or an additional 4 hit points for each slot level above 1st if your material component is consumed.

spell.name: False Gravity
entries: You touch a willing creature. The target can travel on any solid surface as though that surface possessed its own gravity. As a bonus action, a creature can choose a solid surface it can see to begin to "fall" towards it. A character falling in this fashion approaches the surface at 30 feet per round, taking no falling damage when it lands on that surface.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Familiar Pocket
entries: You touch a small container or a garment with a pocket. The space inside the container or pocket becomes a pocket dimension that lasts until the spell ends. The inside of the pocket is a 2-foot-by-2-foot extradimensional space. As an action, you can command the space to seal or unseal itself. When sealed, the pocket becomes airtight and waterproof. The pocket will remain sealed until you spend an action to unseal it or a creature inside the pocket opens it. The air inside the space lasts for 1 hour so long as the pocket is sealed.
Anything inside the extradimensional space drops out when the spell ends.

components.m: a tiny golden needle and a strip of fine cloth

spell.name: Fangs of the Vampire King
entries: You sprout vampire-like fangs. These fangs are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. Additionally, once per turn when you hit with these fangs, you deal an additional {@damage 3d6} necrotic damage and gain temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

spell.name: Fantastic Machine
entries: You create a mechanical Construct, which manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This Construct uses the Fantastic Machine stat block below. When you cast the spell, you can choose whether the machine is Small, Medium or Large, as well as how many limbs it has, up to a maximum of 8. In addition, you may choose one of the following:

items: The machine's speed is increased to 50 feet.
The machine gains a climbing speed equal to its walking speed. It can climb up, down and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings.
The machine gains a fly speed of 25 feet.

entries: When you cast the spell, you may specify any number of cantrips you can cast. While the machine lasts, it has the ability to cast these spells. In addition, you may choose one 1st level spell you can cast. The machine can cast this spell once per hour without requiring any components a number of times equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. If a spell the machine casts uses an ability modifier or requires a spell save DC, it uses your spellcasting ability modifier.

The machine follows orders given by you, but will not willingly harm another creature. It is intelligent enough to recognize basic cause and effect and will refuse commands that cause harm to a creature indirectly (for example: grappling a creature inside an area of effect that deals damage). The machine will act independently to protect its own existence so long as such protection does not involve disobeying a command or harming another creature (for example, it will walk out of a burning building unless ordered to stay inside).

In combat, the machine shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action, provided that action does not involve dealing damage to another creature.
When the spell ends, the machine is reduced to 0 hit points, or if you cast this spell again, it collapses into a pile of scrap metal worth 500 gp.

m.text: 500 gp worth of scrap metal, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Favor of the Martyr
entries: You touch a willing creature. So long as this spell lasts, the creature suffers none of the effects of several conditions. These conditions are {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition poisoned},  {@condition stunned}, {@condition unconscious}, or {@condition exhaustion}. Favor of the Martyr does not remove those conditions, nor does it prevent those conditions from being applied to the target after this spell has been cast. Once this spell ends, the target is affected by those conditions again normally.

spell.name: Fell the Greatest Foe
entries: You touch a willing creature. The target gains the ability to deal greater damage against larger creatures. For every size category of an opponent larger than the target of the spell, they deal an extra {@dice 1d6} points of damage with melee weapon attacks.

components.m: a dragon's claw or giant's fingernail

spell.name: Field of Ghouls
entries: When you cast this spell and at the start of each of your turns while the spell lasts, each creature other than you in a 30-foot radius sphere centered on you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 8d6} necrotic damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. Then, each creature with 5 or fewer hit points within range that failed its saving throw dies.
Creatures with 0 hit points make this save with disadvantage.
A humanoid that dies within the radius of this spell
immediately rises as a ghoul under your control. The ghouls created by this spell are under your control for 24 hours, after which they stop obeying any commands you've given them.

spell.name: Field of Icy Razors
entries: Razor sharp ice crystals surround any number of creatures within range. Each of these creatures must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d10} cold damage and {@damage 6d10} slashing damage and its speed is reduced by 20 feet for 1 minute on a failed save. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage and is not slowed.

m.text: a silver shuriken shaped like a snowflake, with at least 50 gp

spell.name: Fiendform
entries: This spell transforms you into the form of the Fiendish creature whose blood, flesh or bone you used when casting this spell. The transformation lasts for the duration, or until you drop to 0 hit points or die. The new form can be any Fiend whose Challenge Rating is 5 or lower. Your game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen Fiend. You retain your alignment and personality.

You assume the hit points of your new form. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed. If you revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to your normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce you to 0 hit points, you aren't knocked {@condition unconscious}.

You are limited in the actions you can perform by the nature of your new form. You can't speak or take actions that require hands or speech unless your new form possesses the ability to do so and you can only cast spells that your new form can cast.
Your gear melds into the new form. You can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of your equipment.

m.text: a vial of blood, or a bit of flesh or bone from a Fiendish creature, which this spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the CR of fiend you can transform into increases by 1 for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Fierce Pride of the Beastlands
entries: Green-white fog rises from the ground as you cast this spell, and great feline shadows take shape within the misty cloud. When you cast this spell, you summon up to 6 celestial spirits that take the form of lions and appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. Your GM has the creatures' statistics.

These lions are considered both Beasts and Celestials, and disappear when they drop to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The summoned lions are friendly to you and your companions. The lions have their own turns, which they take immediately after you. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.
As action on your turn, you can summon up to six more lions in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. You can have a maximum of six lions summoned by this spell at a time.

spell.name: Find the Gap
entries: You touch a willing creature, granting it the ability to perceive weak points in their opponent's defenses. The target's first melee or ranged weapon attack each turn has advantage.

spell.name: Find Temple
entries: While this spell lasts, you can sense the direction of the nearest temple to your god. If there is none within the spell's area, the spell instead shows you the direction of the nearest temple dedicated to a god of the same alignment as yours. You can also choose a specific temple to search for, but you must have visited the temple personally at some point in the past.

spell.name: Fins to Feet
entries: This spell transforms tails, tentacles, fins, or other extremities used for swimming into humanoid legs. The target loses its swim speed for the duration and gains a walking speed of 30 feet. In addition, it gains the ability to breathe air. An unwilling creature can make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is unaffected.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Fire Shield, Mass
entries: You touch up to 3 willing creatures. Thin and wispy flames wreathe their bodies for the duration, shedding bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it.

The flames provide a target with a warm shield or a chill shield, as you choose. The warm shield grants a target resistance to cold damage, and the chill shield grants a target resistance to fire damage.

In addition, whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits a target with a melee attack, the shield erupts with flame. The attacker takes {@damage 2d8} fire damage from a warm shield, or {@damage 2d8} cold damage from a cold shield.

components.m: A bit of phosphorus or a firefly

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Fire Shuriken
entries: You touch up to three weapons with the thrown property and imbue them with magic. You or someone else can make a ranged weapon attack with one of the weapons by throwing it. On a hit, the target takes regular weapon damage and an additional {@damage 4d6} fire damage. Hit or miss, the spell then ends on that weapon.
If you cast this spell again, the spell ends early on any weapons still affected by it.

components.m: a shuriken coated with pine sap and sulfur

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may enchant one additional weapon for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Fire Spiders
entries: You call forth a teeming mass of Tiny fire elementals the size of common spiders. The spiders spread across the ground in a 10-foot-radius centered on a point you can see within range. Each creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can command the swarm to move up to 30 feet. At the end of each turn where you do not command the swarm to move, the swarm moves up to 15 feet towards the nearest hostile creature if one isn't already in the affected area.

When the swarm moves, it can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, as well as jump across pits up to 10 feet wide. The spiders ignite flammable objects not being worn or carried, and shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 6th

spell.name: Fire Stride
entries: You gain the ability to step into fires and move from one fire to another. The fires you enter must be at least as big around as you are. Fire elementals are not considered "fires" for the purpose of this spell, nor are sources of great heat, such as pools of lava.

While standing in a fire, you instantly know the locations of all suitable fires within 500 feet and can transport yourself to one of them as a bonus action. If a fire's location doesn't offer enough space for you (for example, a fire contained inside a furnace too small to hold you or a fire already occupied by a large cauldron), it is not a viable destination and you don't sense it's location.
Fire Stride provides no protection against fire.

spell.name: Fire Wings
entries: You transform your arms into wings of flame, granting you a flying speed of 60 feet for the duration. The flames do not damage you or any items you carry. While your arms are transformed in this way, you cannot hold items in your hands or cast spells that require somatic components.

These wings are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes, using your spellcasting modifier rather than strength for attack rolls. On a hit, you deal fire damage equal to {@dice 2d6} + your spellcasting modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.
When the spell ends, you fall if you are still aloft, unless you can stop the fall.

spell.name: Firebrand
entries: You cause the ground to erupt in a fiery burst at four different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes {@damage 10d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one fiery burst is affected only once.

m.text: a flask of alchemist's fire, which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Fireburst
entries: With a circular gesture the air around you fills with flame, exploding outward a moment later. Each creature other than you in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on you must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Fires of Purity
entries: You touch a creature, purging it of one or more debilitating effects of your choice. The effects removed can be any of the following:

items: An effect that {@condition charmed} or {@condition petrified} the target.
A curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item.
A reduction to one of the target's ability scores.
An effect reducing the target's hit points.
A disease.
Any of the following conditions: {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition poisoned}.

entries: For each effect purged beyond the first, the creature takes {@damage 1d8} fire damage. The maximum number of effects you can purge at once is equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

spell.name: Fireward
entries: You create a protective ward, spreading from a point you choose to fill a 20-foot sphere for the duration. When you cast this spell, all fires, both magical and nonmagical, are extinguished in the area and each creature gains resistance to fire damage so long as it remains in the area. For the duration, no new fires can be lit in the area and any creature that enters the area gains resistance to fire damage so long as it remains in the area. In addition, when a fire elemental enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw. That creature takes {@damage 6d8} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spell.name: Fist of Stone
entries: You transform one of your hands into a mighty fist of living stone. While transformed, your fist cannot be used to hold or use objects. This fist can be used as a melee weapon, which deals bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d8} + your strength modifier. Attacks with this fist count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

components.m: a pebble inscribed with a stylized fist design

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, then the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Flame Dagger
entries: The blade of a dagger you are holding bursts alight with flame. For the duration, you can use your spellcasting ability instead of Strength or Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls of melee attacks using that weapon. That weapon deals fire damage instead of piercing. If you let go of the weapon, the spell ends at the end of the current turn. The spell ends immediately if you cast it again.

spell.name: Flame of Faith
entries: A nonmagic weapon you touch bursts into flames. These flames do not harm whoever wields the weapon. For the duration, the weapon deals an additional {@damage 1d8} fire damage on a hit. In addition, when you hit a Fiend or an Undead creature with this weapon, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d8} radiant damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot 4th level of or higher, the extra fire and radiant damage each increase by {@dice 1d8} for every two slot levels above the 3rd.

spell.name: Flame Whips
entries: Your forelimbs transform into flaming whips. When you cast this spell, or as an action on your turn while the spell lasts, you may make up to two melee spell attacks against a creature or object within 15 feet of you. Each melee attack can be at the same target at different ones. On a hit, a target takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage.
While this spell lasts, you cannot cast spells with material components, nor can you carry items with your forelimbs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Flashburst
entries: You create a blinding, dazzling flash of light. Each creature other than you within a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on you must success on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} for a 1 minute. A {@condition blinded} creature can repeat this save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. In addition, any creature within 15 feet of you that fails its saving throw by 5 or more is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

components.m: a pinch of sulfur or phosphorus

spell.name: Flensing
entries: With a cruel utterance, you unleash terrible energies that can literally tear flesh from bones to inflict incredible pain and psychological trauma. A creature you can see within range must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d10} necrotic damage, {@damage 6d10} psychic damage and has disadvantage on Charisma and Constitution checks and saving throws for the next minute. On a successful save, the target takes half damage and has no additional penalties.

On each of your turns for the duration, you can use your action to force the target to make another Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 6d10} necrotic damage and {@damage 6d10} psychic damage, or half this much on a successful save.
The spell ends if you use your action to do anything else, if the target is ever outside the spell's range, or if it has total cover from you.

spell.name: Fleshshiver
entries: You snap a bone you hold in your hand, and the sound is echoed from your target. One creature you can see within range must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 10d8} necrotic damage and is {@condition incapacitated} for the duration of the spell. On a successful saving throw, the target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition incapacitated}.
If the target has a Challenge rating of 5 or lower (or level, if it doesn't have a Challenge rating), it automatically fails its initial saving throw.
An {@condition incapacitated} target must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, it is no longer {@condition incapacitated}.

m.text: a bone, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Flight of the Dragon
entries: You touch a willing creature. The target gains a flying speed of 80 feet for the duration. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft, unless it can stop the fall.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Floating Disk, Greater
entries: This spell creates a circular, horizontal plane of force, 3 feet in diameter and 1 inch thick, that floats 3 feet above the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. The disk remains for the duration, and can hold up to 2000 pounds. If more weight is placed on it, the spell ends, and everything on the disk falls to the ground.

The disk is immobile while you are within 20 feet of it. If you move more than 20 feet away from it, the disk follows you so that it remains within 20 feet of you. It can move across uneven terrain, up or down stairs, slopes and the like, but it can't cross an elevation change of 10 feet or more normally. You may use your action to command the disk to move up to 20 feet in a round in any direction. If you move more than 100 feet from the disk (typically because it can't move around an obstacle to follow you), the spell ends.

m.text: a vial of mercury worth 100 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Focusing Chant
entries: You enchant up to three creatures of your choice within range. Whenever one of those creatures makes an attack roll or saving throw before the spell ends, that creature cannot have disadvantage on the roll.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Force Chest
entries: You create a lidded box of force at a point you choose within range. When you create the box, you can choose whether the box is translucent, or if it and its contents are {@condition invisible}. The sides and lid of the box are solid walls of force, and it can contain up to 12 cubic feet of nonliving material (3 feet by 2 feet by 2 feet). The box cannot be opened unless a creature first speaks the password determined by you when you cast the spell.

Nothing can physically pass through the box. It is immune to all damage and can't be dispelled by dispel magic. A disintegrate spell destroys the box instantly. The box also extends into the Ethereal Plane, protecting its contents.
You can cast this spell on an existing force chest to extend its duration by a week. If a force chest lasts for 1 year, the spell becomes permanent.

spell.name: Force Claw
entries: You create an invisible claw made out of force at a point you can see in range. When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. The claw defends a 10-foot-radius sphere, centered on that point. When a creature enters this area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the claw attacks it. Make a melee spell attack against the creature. On a hit, the target takes force damage equal to {@dice 2d8}+ your spellcasting ability modifier.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can command the claw to move to a new point within 20 feet of its current location.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every two slot levels above 4th.

spell.name: Force Ladder
entries: You create an immobile, invisible ladder of force to spring into existence at a point you choose within range. The ladder is 2 feet wide and extends straight up anywhere between 10 to 60 feet tall, with rungs spaced 1 foot apart. Though the ladder is solid for any creatures that interact with it, objects pass harmlessly through the ladder. The ladder is immune to all damage and can't be dispelled by dispel magic. A disintegrate spell destroys the ladder instantly, however.

m.text: a miniature silver ladder worth 50 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the maximum height of the ladder increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Force Missiles
entries: You create two powerful missiles of magical force. Each missile hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A missile deals {@damage 2d6} force damage to its target. The missiles all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several. After striking a target, each missile explodes in a 10-foot radius sphere. Each creature within range of one of these explosions, including the target, must make a Dexterity saving throw (a creature only makes one save regardless of how many explosions it is in the area of). On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} force damage for each missile it was in the area of. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.
This spell is counted as magic missile for the purpose of spells such as shield.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the spell creates one more missile for every two slot levels above 4th

spell.name: Forcewave
entries: Unleashing a wave of force, you attempt to send your enemies tumbling away from you. Each creature within 10 feet of you must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is pushed back 30 feet and falls {@condition prone}. If a creature fails its save by 5 or more, it is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, a creature is pushed back 15 feet, but is not knocked {@condition prone}. When casting this spell, you can choose any number of creatures to automatically pass their saving throw.

If a creature pushed by this spell impacts another object or creature as a result, the target takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage for every 5 feet it was pushed before impact. If the target impacts another creature, that creature takes half as much damage as the target.

components.m: a small piece of string and a drop of water

spell.name: Foreshock
entries: You grasp the stone firmly and point your fist outward as a huge, silent explosion ripples through the earth. A shockwave radiates from you in 20-foot radius sphere, centered on you. Each creature other than you in that area that is touching the ground must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the ground in that area is loose earth or stone, it becomes difficult terrain until cleared, with each 5-foot-diameter portion requiring at least 1 minute to clear by hand.

In addition, this shockwave deals {@damage 6d8} force damage to any structure, unattended object made of dirt, clay or stone as well as any earth elemental. An earth elemental that passes its saving throw takes half as much damage in addition to not being knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Fortunate Fate
entries: You touch a friendly creature, suffusing them with a golden glow that quickly fades. The next time that creature is reduced to 0 Hit Points but not killed outright, it regains 80 Hit Points and ends the blindness or deafness conditions or any diseases affecting the target. This spell has no effect on Constructs or Undead.

spell.name: Foundation of Stone
entries: You call upon the strength of the earth to rise and lend its stability to a creature of your choice within range. The target has advantage on Strength saving throws for the duration. In addition, the target is considered to have half cover, as earthen ramparts rise around it to protect it from harm. If the creature moves or is no longer standing on solid ground (for example, if it is hovering), it loses these benefits until the start of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Freeze
entries: You fire a thin blue ray at a creature you can see within range. That creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 10d8} cold damage and is encased on ice. On a success, the creature takes half as much damage and is not encased on ice. While encased on ice, the creature is {@condition restrained}, cannot cast spells that require somatic components and has total cover. The creature takes an additional {@damage 2d8} cold damage at the end of each of its turns while encased.

An encased creature can use an action on its turn to attempt to break free, making a Strength check against your spell save DC. Alternatively, another creature can attempt to free the encased creature. The ice encasing the creature has an AC of 15 and 50 hit points. The creature is freed if the ice is reduced to 0 hit points, and any excess damage dealt to the ice carries over to the creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 2d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Freezing Fog
entries: A bank of freezing mist billows out in a 15-foot-radius sphere, centered on a point you can see within range. This sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. The fog is so thick that a creature moving through the area must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves.

When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d6} cold damage. If a creature fails its save by 5 or more it also falls {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and does not fall {@condition prone}.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can designate a new point you can see within range. At the end of each of your turns, the Freezing Fog moves 5 feet towards the current point, until it is centered on it or you use another bonus action to choose a new point.
Freezing Fog coats all solid surfaces with a slick, icy rime as it passes. After Freezing Fog has left a space, the ground is coated in slippery ice for the next minute.
Slippery ice is difficult terrain. When a creature moves onto slippery ice for the first time on a turn, it must succeed on a DC10 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check or fall {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Frost Breath
entries: As you exhale across your cupped hands, your breath shoots forth tinged with frost and crystals of ice. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d8} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, any creature that fails its save by 5 or more is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn by the sudden shock of cold.
Creatures that have resistance or immunity to cold damage cannot be {@condition stunned} by this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Fugue
entries: You create a discordant cacophony of haunting and alien music. When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it.

When an affected creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d12} psychic damage and suffers a random additional negative effect. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and there is no additional effect.
To determine the additional negative effect for a creature that fails its save, roll a {@dice d6} for each creature to determine which of the following effects the creature suffers from:

rows: The affected creature can't move this turn.
The affected creature is knocked {@condition prone}.
The affected creature can't take actions this turn.
The affected creature uses its action to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach. If there is no creature within its reach, the creature does nothing this turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Gem Barrier
entries: The gemstones in your hand crumble to dust, granting a creature you touch resistance to one or more damage types of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. For each damage type chosen, you must spend 50gp worth of gemstones.

m.text: variable gp worth of gemstones, which the spell consumes, see text

spell.name: Gembomb
entries: You turn a gem into a bomb, hurling it at a point you can see within range. Each creature within a 5-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d6} force damage on a failed save, of half as much on a successful save.

The more valuable the gem, the more powerful the explosion. For every 10gp of value in the gem consumed for this spell, you may either increase the radius by 5 feet or the damage by {@dice 1d6}. You can enhance either of these traits a maximum of 2 times each in this fashion .

m.text: a gem worth at least 1gp, which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the base damage increases by {@dice 1d6}, and the maximum number of times a trait can be enhanced increases by one for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Gemjump
entries: You create a bond between yourself and the gem used to cast this spell. When you cast this spell, choose a trigger word. As an action any time after you have created this bond, you may speak the command word to instantly teleport yourself and up to three willing creatures within 10 feet of you to unoccupied spaces closest to the gem, provided you and the gem are both on the same plane.
Once you have used the trigger word, the gem shatters and the spell ends.

m.text: a gem worth at least 250 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you may bring one additional creature with you when you teleport for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: General of Undeath
entries: Each Undead creature within a 120-foot-radius sphere centered on you must make a Charisma saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is unaffected. On a failed save, the creature is either {@condition frightened} of you or {@condition charmed} by you (your choice). A creature {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened} by this spell may repeat this save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

If a creature with a Challenge Rating of 5 or less (or the creature's level, if it doesn't have a challenge rating) fails its save, you may have that creature fall under your control instead. It will obey verbal commands you give, no action required. You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its turn, or you can issue a general command. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete.
An Undead creature with a Challenge rating of 1 or lower automatically fails its saving throw.

spell.name: Ghost Trap
entries: You create a field of protective energy, in a 100-foot radius sphere centered on a point you choose in range, which extends into the Ethereal plane. Any creature on the Ethereal plane that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn and is forcefully returned to the plane it originated from. If it occupies the same spot as a solid object or creature when this happens, it is immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and takes force damage equal to twice the number of feet is it moved. On a successful save, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn but remains on the Ethereal plane.
This spell has no effect if you cast it while you are on the Ethereal Plane or a plane that doesn't border it, such as one of the Outer Planes.
You can create a permanent ghost trap by casting this spell in the same location every day for one year.

m.text: rare herbs worth 50gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Ghostharp
entries: You channel the spectral resonance of sounds once  heard in your vicinity, attempting to recreate them. When you cast this spell, you set your musical instrument down and choose a point in time up to 24 hours ago. If you choose a time 8 or more hours ago, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals the number of hours ago you chose. On a success, or if the point chosen was fewer than 8 hours previous, the musical instrument begins to play itself, only rather than music, it begins to  play any sounds audible from that location at the chosen point in time for the duration of the spell. Verbal components of spells and other magical effects (such as bardic inspiration) sound garbled and unintelligible and bestow none of their original magical effects. On a failure, nothing happens.

spell.name: Ghoul Gauntlet
entries: Your touch causes a creature to begin transforming into a ravening, flesh-eating ghoul. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d6} necrotic damage.

For the next minute, the creature's body continues the transformation into a ghoul. At the start of each of its turns, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage. On a successful save, the target takes no additional damage and the spell ends.

If the target dies while under the effects of this spell, it immediately rises as a ghoul under your control. (The GM has game statistics for these creatures.) As a bonus action on each of your turns, you can mentally command any creature you animated with this spell if the creature is within 120 feet of you (if you control multiple creatures, you can command any or all of them at the same time, issuing the same command to each one). You decide what action the creature will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as to guard a particular chamber or corridor. If you issue no commands, the creature only defends itself against hostile creatures. Once given an order, the creature continues to follow it until its task is complete. The creature is under your control for 24 hours, after which it stops obeying any command you have given it.

spell.name: Ghoul Gesture
entries: A greenish ray stabs from your pointing finger to strike at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is also {@condition incapacitated} until the end of your next turn. If it fails it's save by 5 or more, it is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of your next turn.

components.m: a pinch of dirt from a ghoul's lair

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Ghoul Light
entries: You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. Until the spell ends, the object is wreathed in a sickly greenish flame. These flames provide bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The flames provide no heat and cannot be smothered or quenched, but completely covering the object with something opaque blocks the flames from providing light. The spell lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell.
In addition to providing light, all undead within a 20-foot radius of the object have advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration is 1 hour. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration is 24 hours. When you use a 9th level spell slot, the spell lasts until it is dispelled.

spell.name: Giant's Wrath
entries: You touch one to three pebbles, infusing them with powerful magic. You or someone else can make a ranged spell attack with one of the pebbles by throwing it or hurling it with a sling. If thrown, it has a range of 60 feet. If someone else attacks with the pebble, that attacker adds your spellcasting ability modifier, not the attacker's, to the attack roll.

Whether thrown or hurled with a sling, the pebbles transform into boulders mid-flight. On a hit, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 3d10} + your spellcasting ability modifier. Hit or miss, the spell then ends on the stone.
If you cast this spell again, the spell ends early on any pebbles still affected by it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Girallon's Blessing
entries: You touch a willing creature. The target sprouts a pair of arms, ending in clawed hands with opposable thumbs.

These arms function like your primary arms. In addition, the claws are natural weapons, which the target can use to make unarmed strikes. On a hit, the target deals {@damage 1d6} + Strength modifier slashing damage instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

components.m: a few strands of girallon hair

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Glimpse the Immemorial
entries: You can see and hear into the past, glimpsing events that happened previously at your current location. The level of detail you see and hear depends on the span of time you wish to observe, chosen from the following options:

items: {@b Days.} You sense the events of the past, up to seven days previously. You gain detailed knowledge of the people, conversations, and events that transpired.

{@b Weeks.} You gain a summary of the events of the past, up to one year previously. Exact wording and details are lost, but you know all the participants and highlights of the conversations and events that took place.

{@b Years.} You gain a general idea of the events of the past, up to 100 years previously. You notice only noteworthy events such as deaths, battles, scenes of great emotion, important discoveries, and significant happenings.

{@b Centuries.} You gain a general idea of the events of the past, up to 1000 years previously. You notice only the most remarkable of events, such as coronations, deaths of important personages, major battles and other truly historic happenings.

m.text: an hourglass-shaped diamond worth at least 1,000 gp

spell.name: Glowing Orb
entries: You touch the glass sphere, creating a permanent magical light source inside it. The orb emits bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for another 15 feet. You can use an action to expand or reduce its radius of bright and dim light by 5 feet, to a maximum of 40 feet each or a minimum of 5 feet. In addition, you can use an action to make the light visible only to the orb's controller for 1 minute. If a glowing orb is smashed, the magic is lost.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can give control of the glowing orb to another creature. If the creature that controls the glowing orb dies, any creature can attempt to gain control of the glowing orb as an action by succeeding on a DC 15 Intelligence check.

m.text: a fist-sized glass sphere worth 50 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Golden Barding
entries: You touch another willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a shining set of barding appears on it until the spell ends. The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier and its speed increases by 10 feet. The spell ends if the target dons regular armor, ends its turns more than 5 feet away from you, or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the target's base AC becomes 15+ its Dexterity modifier instead. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the target gains a flying speed equal to its walking speed.

spell.name: Grace
entries: You touch a willing creature, bathing it in a silvery glow. For the duration, the target's speed increases by 10 feet, and it sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet. In addition, whenever the target hits with a melee weapon attack, it deals an additional {@damage 1d4} radiant damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 3rd and target's speed increases by an additional 5 feet for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Graymantle
entries: A skull-shaped cloud of sickly gray energy wraps around a creature you can see in range. That creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 8d8} necrotic damage and is enshrouded in gray radiance for the next minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and is not enshrouded.

While enshrouded, a creature cannot regain hit points or cause another creature to regain hit points through spells or magical abilities. At the end of each of its turns, a creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 2d8} necrotic damage and remains enshrouded. On a successful save, the effect ends.

spell.name: Hail of Stone
entries: You create a rain of stones in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you can see. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d4} bludgeoning damage on a successful save, or half as much damage on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Hailstones
entries: You create three frigid hailstones and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several. Make a ranged spell attack for each hailstone. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8} cold damage and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. This effect can stack if a creature is hit by more than 1 hailstone.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you create one additional hailstone for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Hamatula Barbs
entries: You cause a willing creature to sprout slender, sharp-edged barbs from their body and clothing. These barbs do not hinder their movement or actions. If a creature hits the target with a melee attack while within 5 feet of the target, that creature takes {@damage 1d10} piercing damage. In addition at the start of each of its turns, the target deals {@damage 1d10} piercing damage to any creature it is grappling or that is grappling it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Hand of Divinity
entries: You touch a willing creature, beseeching your deity to bestow a fragment of their power upon them. For the duration, the target can cast a single spell of your choice using your spellcasting modifier without using a spell slot. The chosen spell can be any spell that you can prepare of 2nd level or lower. Alternatively, the chosen spell may be Cure Wounds (if you are good or neutral) or Inflict Wounds (if you are evil). Once the target has cast the chosen spell, this spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the level of spell you can grant your target increases by one level for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Hardening
entries: Your touch strengthens an object, making it resistant to harm. The object gains a damage threshold of 5. This spell has no effect on objects that already have a damage threshold, or on objects that are larger than 10 cubic feet.

m.text: an ointment made of diamond dust worth 10 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Harmonic Chorus
entries: You create a mantle of harmonious tones, bolstering the spellcasting capabilities of your allies. For the duration, whenever you or a friendly creature within 15 feet of you casts a spell using a 1st level spell slot or higher which deals damage or restores hit points, they roll one of the spell's dice an additional time and add the extra damage or healing to the spell. If the spell affects multiple creatures, the extra damage or healing only affects one of those creatures (the creature casting the spell chooses which one).

spell.name: Haste, Swift
entries: With a few quick words, the world moves a bit slower around you. Until the start of your next turn, your speed is doubled, you gain a +2 bonus to AC, you have advantage on Dexterity saving throws.
In addition, on the turn you cast this spell, you gain an additional action. That action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.

spell.name: Haunting Tune
entries: You weave magic into your music, enough to make even the most hard-hearted quail. When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see within 30 feet of you to be unaffected by it. Whenever a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on the first attack roll or ability check it makes that turn. A creature that can't hear is unaffected by this spell.

spell.name: Hawkeye
entries: You enhance your eyesight, causing distant objects and creatures to seem closer and more distinct. For the duration, the short and long range of ranged weapons you wield is doubled and you ignore penalties for attacking at your weapon's long range. You can see up to 1 mile away with no difficulty, able to discern even fine details as though looking at something no more than 100 feet away from you. In addition, you have a +5 bonus to Wisdom (Perception) checks.

spell.name: Healing Lorecall
entries: You call upon your natural healing arts to guide your magic. If you are proficient in the Medicine skill, any spell you cast that restores hit points to a single target restores additional hit points to that target equal to your proficiency bonus.

spell.name: Healing Sting
entries: Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d12} necrotic damage and you regain hit points equal to the damage dealt.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Healing Touch
entries: You transfer some of your life essence to a willing creature. When you cast this spell, you may spend up to three Hit Dice. For each hit dice spent this way, you roll that die. The target regains hit points equal to twice that number plus your spellcasting modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the maximum number of Hit Dice you may spend increases by 1 for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Heart of Stone
entries: You exchange your own living heart for a finely carved heart of stone used in the casting of this spell. Your living heart can be stored or hidden anywhere you like, where it continues to beat for the duration of the spell. While the spell lasts, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing from nonmagical attacks, as well as resistance to cold, fire and lightning damage.

If your living heart is destroyed, you die. When the spell ends, your living heart instantly returns to its proper place in your body and the stone heart is transported to where your living heart had been located. If you die from causes other than your living heart being destroyed, this spell ends 1 minute later.

m.text: a carved heart made of precious stones worth 5,000 gp

spell.name: Heart Ripper
entries: Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. That creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 3d10} force damage and is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition stunned}. A creature {@condition stunned} by this spell can make another constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
A creature of challenge rating 1 (or level, if it does not have a challenge rating) or less that fails its saving throw instantly dies as its heart bursts out of its body.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and the challenge rating (or level, if it does not have a challenge rating) at which a creature dies increases by 1 for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Heartfire
entries: A flickering red fire bursts in the area, wreathing creatures in flame. Each creature in a 20-foot cube within range must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is outlined in fire. For the duration, a creature outlined in fire takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage at the start of each of its turns, sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet and cannot benefit from being {@condition invisible}.
A creature can use an action to extinguish the flames on an outlined creature, ending the effect on that creature.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Heat Drain
entries: You drain the heat from your foes in order to strengthen yourself. Each creature of your choice in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 20d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, you gain 10 temporary hit points for each creature damaged by this spell, up to a maximum of 100.

spell.name: Heatstroke
entries: A creature you can see within range begins to suffer from the full brunt of the desert sun. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the target takes {@damage 6d8} fire damage and gains a level of {@condition exhaustion}. On a successful save the target takes half as much damage and does not suffer from {@condition exhaustion}.
If the target has resistance to fire damage, it does not gain a level of {@condition exhaustion}, even on a failed save.

spell.name: Herald's Call
entries: You give a rousing call to distract your enemies and inspire your allies. Each creature of your choice within a 20-foot radius sphere centered on you increases their speed by 10 feet while the spell lasts. If they leave the sphere, this increased speed lasts until the end of their next turn. In addition, each creature of your choice that enters the area for the first time in a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have its speed halved for the duration. A slowed creature that is no longer in this area can repeat this save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spell.name: Hidden Lodge
entries: A 10-foot-radius immobile dome of force springs into existence around and above you and remains stationary for the duration. The spell ends if you leave its area.

Nine creatures of Medium size or smaller can fit inside the dome with you. The spell fails if its area includes a larger creature or more than nine creatures. Creatures and objects within the dome when you cast this spell can move through it freely. All other creatures and objects are barred from passing through it. Spells and other magical effects can't extend through the dome or be cast through it. The atmosphere inside the space is comfortable and dry, regardless of the weather outside.

Until the spell ends, you can command the interior to become dimly lit or dark. The dome is transparent from the inside and almost perfectly camouflaged from the outside. At any distance of more than 30 feet, the dome is completely indistinguishable from natural terrain. A creature within 30 feet that is searching for the dome must first succeed on an Intelligence saving throw to recognize the hut as an artificial dwelling and not part of the landscape.

spell.name: Hiss of Sleep
entries: With a few whispered words, this spell sends creatures into a magical slumber. Each creature within 20 feet of a point you choose within range must make a Wisdom saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake. A creature with a challenge rating of 3 or less (or level, if it doesn't have a challenge rating) automatically fails this saving throw.
Undead and creatures immune to being {@condition charmed} aren't affected by this spell.

spell.name: Holy Star
entries: You create a glowing mote of energy that stays near your shoulder, which sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The mote has three charges, which can be expended in the following ways:

items: {@b Spell Turning} If you are targeted by a magic missile, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll of 5th level or lower, you may use your reaction and spend a charge to reflect the effect back at the caster as though it originated from you, turning the caster into the target.
{@b Protection} If you are hit by an attack, you may use your reaction and spend a charge to grant yourself +10 AC, including against the triggering attack, until the start of your next turn.

{@b Fire Star} As an action on your turn, you may spend a charge to make a ranged spell attack against a creature you can see within 90 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 12d6} fire damage.

entries: When you have expended all charges, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you start with two additional charges for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Holy Storm
entries: A driving rain begins to fall in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range. The area inside the cylinder is lightly obscured and any ranged attacks into or through the area have disadvantage. Any unprotected flames in the area are extinguished. Any Fiend that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} radiant damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

m.text: a flask of holy water worth at least 25 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Holy Transformation
entries: A charge of holy energy courses through you, surrounding you in a barely perceptible golden aura as you assume a mantle of celestial power. For the duration, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your creature type becomes Celestial.
You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover.
You have {@sense darkvision|XPHB} out to a range of 60 feet.
Your weapon attacks are magical.
When you hit with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d4} radiant damage.
You gain the ability to speak and understand Celestial.

spell.name: Horrible Taste
entries: You touch a willing creature. Until the spell ends, any creature that successfully hits the target with a bite attack must make a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Creatures with an Intelligence score of 4 or lower will instinctively avoid the target and avoid biting them unless provoked.

spell.name: Howling Chain
entries: A blood-red chain made of force appears in an unoccupied space you can see in range.

The chain attacks any creature hostile to you that moves to a space within 15 feet of the chain for the first time on a turn. When the chain attacks, make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier force damage and must make a Wisdom saving throw. The target is {@condition frightened} for the next minute on a failed save.

While {@condition frightened} by the chain, a creature must take the Dash action and move away from the chain by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to the chain, the creature can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, that creature is no longer {@condition frightened}.

components.m: a small, platinum length of chain worth at least 500 gp

spell.name: Hunter's Mercy
entries: You grant yourself an instinctive ability to strike for your enemies weak point. The next time you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack, you can roll the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the damage total.
Once you have successfully hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack, the spell ends.

spell.name: Hurl
entries: You touch a nonmagical melee weapon. Until the spell ends, that weapon gains the thrown property with a range of 30/60 and becomes a magic weapon with a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls. Once during your turn, you may recall the weapon, causing it to appear in your hand, no action required.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may target one additional melee weapon for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Hymn of Praise
entries: You strike up a rousing, inspirational song that boosts  the spells cast by any number of creatures in a 30-foot radius sphere centered on you. Whenever one of those creatures casts a spell of 1st level or higher, it is considered to be cast at 1 spell slot higher than the spell slot used by the caster.

spell.name: Hypothermia
entries: Choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 9d6} cold damage and suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and does not suffer from {@condition exhaustion}.
If the target has resistance to cold damage, it does not gain a level of {@condition exhaustion}, even on a failed save

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Ice Axe
entries: You create a battleaxe-shaped formation of jagged, swirling ice shards in your hand. This magic axe lasts until the spell ends and counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. The axe deals {@damage 2d12} cold damage on a hit and you can use your spellcasting modifier instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls. In addition, if you score a critical hit with the axe, the axe shatters, dealing an additional 8 cold damage to the target.
If you drop the weapon, it shatters into icy fragments at the end of turn, which quickly dissipate. While the spell persists, you can use a bonus action to cause the axe to reappear in your hand.

components.m: a shard of ice, glass or crystal

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Ice Claw
entries: You create an icy spectral claw within range that lasts for the duration or until you cast this spell again. When you cast this spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the claw. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier cold damage and is {@condition grappled} by the claw (escape DC is your spell save DC) if it is up to one size category larger than you. Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the claw up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature  within 5 feet of the claw (including any creature it is currently grappling). If the claw moves while grappling a creature, it can drag the {@condition grappled} creature with it. If you choose not to have the claw drag the creature it is currently grappling with it when it moves, or order it to attack a different creature, that creature is no longer {@condition grappled}.

components.m: a white leather glove and a piece of clear rock crystal

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Ice Flowers
entries: You cause ambient moisture to coalesce into delicate flowers of ice for a brief moment before exploding in a shower of deadly ice shards. Choose three different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on each point you choose must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d6} cold damage and {@damage 5d6} slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one icy burst is affected only once.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the cold and slashing damage each increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Ice Gauntlet
entries: A sheen of white frost coats your fist, exploding into a spray of fine icy slivers when you strike. Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} + your spellcasting modifier cold damage and has disadvantage on the next attack it makes before the end of its next turn.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Icelance
entries: You launch a large shard of ice at a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d8} cold damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

m.text: a clear quartz gemstone worth at least 50 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Illusory Feast
entries: A magnificent feast appears, spread lavishly across a 40-foot cube within range, the contents of which shift and change to appear the most tantalizing to each observer.

Each creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this casting of the spell. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition charmed} for the duration. While {@condition charmed} by this spell, a creature is {@condition incapacitated} and can only move closer to the center of the area as it begins attempting to consume the illusory food and drink.
The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

spell.name: Illusory Pit
entries: The ground seems to simply fall away as you create the illusions of three impossibly deep pits at three locations you can see within range. Each pit is a 10-foot cube and must be centered on a solid surface. Each creature that enters one of the areas for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn as it flails around wildly, believing it is falling. On a successful save, the creature sees through the illusion and is immune to this casting of the spell.

Creatures that are flying, hovering or otherwise not standing on the ground in the area of this spell are unaffected, and creatures with a fly speed have advantage on their Intelligence saving throws.

spell.name: Imperious Glare
entries: Motes of dark energy dance before your eyes, evoking terror in those you focus your gaze upon. When you cast this spell, and as an action on subsequent turns, you may focus your gaze on a creature you can see within range. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 10d6} psychic damage and is {@condition frightened} of you for the next minute. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition frightened}. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
A creature that is unable to see you cannot be targeted by this spell.

spell.name: Improvisation
entries: You grant yourself a pool of luck, which you can use to manipulate the outcomes of tasks you perform. The pool consists of two points, which you can spend as a reaction before you make an attack roll or ability check to gain advantage on that roll.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, your pool increases by 1 for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Incite
entries: Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point in range cannot ready actions or take readied actions for the duration of the spell.

spell.name: Indomitability
entries: You grant yourself unyielding fortitude, allowing you to endure blows that would otherwise kill you. For the duration, whenever you would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, you instead drop to 1 hit point.

spell.name: Infernal Army
entries: You summon a pack of devils from the Nine Hells to serve you. These demons appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. Choose any number of Fiend (devil) creatures with a combined Challenge rating of 8 or lower. No individual creature may have a Challenge Rating below 1 or above 4. For example: the caster might choose  to summon two CR3 Bearded Devils and two CR1 Imps  or alternatively four CR2 Spined Devils. The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which has its own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 9th-level spell slot, you can summon a number of Fiend (devil) creatures with a combined Challenge rating of 16 or lower. No individual creature may have a Challenge rating below 1 or above 4.

spell.name: Infernal Threnody
entries: You create a pulsing, powerful rhythm that infuses your allies with infernal power. Whenever you or an allied creature in range that can hear you deals fire damage to another creature, that creature takes {@dice 2d6} additional fire damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every 2 slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Infernal Wound
entries: You touch a nonmagical weapon. Until the spell ends, wounds caused by that weapon continue to smolder with infernal flames. Once per turn, when a creature is hit with an attack using this weapon, it leaves a lingering wound. At the start of a wounded creature's turns, it takes {@damage 1d4} fire damage for each time it has been wounded and must make a Constitution saving throw, ending the effect of all such wounds on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Infestation of Maggots
entries: You brush your hand across a creature, infesting that creature with hundreds of writhing maggots in their flesh. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, that creature takes {@damage 6d6} poison damage  and is {@condition poisoned} until the spell ends. At the end of each of  its turns while the spell lasts, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 4d6} poison damage. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and the spell ends. If a creature dies while under the effects of this spell, their corpse ruptures in a burst of maggots and noxious gasses. When this happens, each creature within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for the remaining duration of the spell.

components.m: a handful of dead, dried flies

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the initial and ongoing damage each increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Inhibit

time.condition: which you take when a creature you see rolls for initiative

entries: A creature you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, subtract {@dice 2d6} from the target's initiative roll, or half as much on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Insidious Rhythm
entries: You recite a foolhardy ditty, tapping your foot in time. A creature you can see in range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the tune repeats endlessly in their head, making it difficult to concentrate. For the duration of the spell, the target has disadvantage on Intelligence checks and Constitution saving throws made to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level, the spell is no longer {@status Concentration|XPHB} and instead lasts until it is dispelled.

spell.name: Inspirational Boost
entries: You concentrate on bolstering yourself and your allies, ensuring their success. Whenever a friendly creature within 15 feet of you has advantage on a roll, that creature can reroll one of the dice once.

spell.name: Instant Refuge
entries: You create a set of specific triggers, allowing you to escape in an instant should the need arise. When you cast this spell, specify a location and up to six specific conditions that trigger the spell. When any of these situations occur, you and everything you are wearing or carrying are teleported to the chosen location.
