The location must be somewhere you have previously visited, even on another plane. Deities and other planar rulers can prevent you from teleporting into their presence or into their domains.

m.text: a concoction made from rare herbs and demon skin worth 250 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Interplanar Telepathic Bond
entries: You forge a telepathic link among up to eight willing creatures of your choice within range, psychically linking each creature to all the others for the duration. Creatures with Intelligence scores of 2 or less aren't affected by this spell.

Until the spell ends, the targets can communicate telepathically through the bond whether or not they have a common language. The communication is possible over any distance and extends to other planes of existence.

components.m: pieces of eggshell from two different kinds of creatures

spell.name: Invisibility, Superior
entries: You or a willing creature you touch becomes {@condition invisible} and virtually undetectable until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is {@condition invisible} as long as it is on the target's person. While {@condition invisible}, the target exudes no scent and radiates an aura of silence that absorbs all sounds in a 5-foot radius sphere centered on the target, preventing detection by {@sense Tremorsense|XPHB} or blindsight. Casting spells that require verbal components in this radius is impossible.

This invisibility is effective even against spells and abilities that normally see through invisibility or reveal {@condition invisible} creatures (such as faerie fire). Only a creature with {@sense truesight|XPHB} can see through your superior invisibility.

spell.name: Invisibility, Swift
entries: You become {@condition invisible} until the spell ends. Anything you are wearing or carrying is {@condition invisible} as long as it remains on your person. The spell ends if you attack or cast a spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the duration changes to {@status Concentration|XPHB}, up to 1 minute. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration increases to {@status Concentration|XPHB}, up to 1 hour.

spell.name: Iron Bones
entries: You touch up to three willing Undead creatures, bolstering their resilience. Each of those creature's base AC becomes 16 and it doesn't add its Dexterity modifier to its armor class.

components.m: a miniature skull made out of iron or steel

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you may target two additional creatures for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Iron Silence
entries: You touch a willing creature, causing the joints of their armor to move smoothly and silently. For the duration, the target does not suffer disadvantage to Dexterity (stealth) checks made as a result of their armor.

spell.name: Ironguard
entries: A willing creature you touch becomes immune to nonmagical metal. Metal items (including metal weapons) simply pass through you, and you can walk through metal barriers such as iron bars. If the spell expires while metal is inside you, the metal object is shunted out of your body (or you are shunted away from the metal).

m.text: a small nugget of adamantine worth 100 gp

spell.name: Ironthunder Horn
entries: The final words of your spell boom outward in a thunderous roar, knocking the foes in your path off their feet. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Jagged Tooth
entries: At your touch, you magically enhance the natural weapons of a willing creature. For the duration, the target scores a critical hit on a 19 or 20 with attacks made using its natural weapons.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Jaws of the Wolf
entries: You scatter small wooden carvings on the ground, which immediately grow into adult worgs in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. You create one worg for each statue you scatter, up to a maximum of four. The GM has the creatures' statistics. These worgs disappear when they drop to 0 hit points or when the spell ends, leaving a carving in their space. If a worg disappears as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, the carving is destroyed.

The worgs are friendly to you and your companions. They obey any mental or verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you) and take their turns immediately after you in initiative. If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.
You have advantage on attack rolls against any creature so long as there is at least one of your summoned worgs within 5 ft. of that creature and the worg isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

m.text: one carving of a worg for each worg you wish to create, worth 25 gp each

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, the maximum number of worgs you can create increases: twice as many with a 5th-level slot, three times as many with a 7th-level slot, and four times as many with a 9th-level slot.

spell.name: Joyful Noise
entries: You create waves of pleasing sounds to resonate in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on you. The sphere moves with you and negates any spell of magical effect that prevents sounds from being created within the area. In addition, any friendly creature in the area has advantage on skill checks involving musical instruments and Charisma (Performance) checks involving music.

spell.name: Junglerazer
entries: You send an invisible blast of destructive energy forth in a line 120 feet long and 5 feet wide in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d10} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A Plant, Fey or Beast that fails its save takes an additional {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage. Plants that die as a result of damage from this spell instantly crumble to dust.

components.m: a pinch of ash from a burnt plant

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Kelpstrand
entries: You create long strands of kelp, sending them streaking out to envelop foes. Choose up to three creatures you can see within range. For each creature, make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target is {@condition restrained} until the spell ends if it is huge or smaller. A {@condition restrained} creature can use its action to attempt to break free, making a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC.
If you cast this spell while within 300 feet of an ocean, you have advantage on these attacks and {@condition restrained} creatures have disadvantage on their Strength saving throws.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Know Greatest Enemy
entries: Your eyes flash with a golden light as you survey your opponents, gauging who is the strongest among them. For the duration, you have an impression of the general strength of creatures within 60 feet that you can see. You gain an impression based on each creature's Challenge Rating (or the creature's level, if it doesn't have a Challenge Rating) according to the following chart:

spell.name: Know Vulnerabilities
entries: When you cast this spell, or as a bonus action on your turn, you may choose a creature you can see in range and learn one of the following characteristics about the creature:

items: What damage immunities it has.
What damage resistances it has.
What condition immunities it has.
What damage vulnerabilities it has.

spell.name: Land Womb
entries: The ground seems open and swallow you and up to three willing Medium size or smaller creatures within 5 feet of you, as you all descend into a protective chamber in the earth below where you were standing. The chamber is 10-foot square and exists 5 feet beneath the surface. While inside the chamber, you can't see what is happening  outside and have total cover from those outside. The chamber generates air to breathe.
The can only be cast on an area of unworked stone, dirt, or similar natural material large enough to accommodate the chamber.

If cast as a ritual, the duration increases to 8 hours and does not require {@status Concentration|XPHB}. When the spell ends, any creatures or objects in the chamber are returned to the surface where you initially entered, leaving no trace of the chamber behind.

spell.name: Languor
entries: A creature you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on ability checks, saving throws and attack rolls for the duration. In addition, at the start of each turn, roll a {@dice d20}, on an 11 or higher, the creature cannot move or take actions that turn.
At the end of each of its turns, the target makes another Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Last Breath
entries: You touch a creature that has died within the last minute, restoring them to life. The magic fashions a new body for the creature to inhabit, which likely causes the creature's race to change. The GM rolls a {@dice d100} and consults the following table to determine what form the creature takes when restored to life, or the GM chooses a form.

The creature recalls its former life and experiences. It retains the capabilities it had in its original form, except it exchanges its original race for the new one and changes its racial traits accordingly.

m.text: Rare oils and unguents worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Launch Item
entries: You touch a Tiny unattended object, that weighs less than 5 pounds, causing it to launch at a creature or object you can see in range. On a hit the target takes {@damage 1d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier bludgeoning damage. Hit or miss, the object also takes the same amount of damage, potentially breaking it.

If you miss the target, roll {@dice 1d8} to determine where the object lands for a Medium or smaller target or {@dice 1d12} for a Large target, with 1 being the space straight back towards you, counting clockwise around the creature. If the creature is Huge or larger, the object lands in the same square as the target.

The spell allows you to launch multiple objects at higher levels: two objects at 5th level, three objects at 11th level, and four objects at 17th level. You can direct the objects at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each object.

spell.name: Life Bolt
entries: You channel your own life force into golden beams of energy, which you fire at targets within range. Create one primary beam of energy, then spend 1 hit die to create two additional beams. You can fire these beams at one target or several. Make a ranged spell attack for each beam. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d8} radiant damage from the primary beam, or {@damage 1d8} radiant damage from a secondary beam.
Undead and Constructs can't cast this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage from the primary bolt increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd. In addition, the damage from each secondary bolt increases by {@dice 1d8} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Life's Grace
entries: You touch a willing creature, causing symbols of warding and safety to flow from you to cover the creature in a web  of protective magic before fading from sight. For the duration, the target is immune to necrotic damage and cannot have its hit point maximum reduced. In addition, the target is immune to effects that would kill it instantaneously without dealing damage.

spell.name: Light of Lunia
entries: You invoke the powers of Celestia, emanating silvery radiance for the duration. This radiance provides bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. As an action on your turn, you may fire bolts of radiance at a creature you can see within 120 feet. To do this, make a ranged spell attack, dealing {@damage 1d10} radiant damage on a hit and an additional {@damage 1d10} radiant damage if the target is a Fiend.

Once you have fired a bolt of radiance, the light you emanate is reduced to a 15-foot radius of bright light and dim light for an additional 15 feet. Once you have fired a second bolt of radiance, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage and bonus damage against Fiends each increase by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Lightfoot
entries: You grant yourself a momentary burst of nimbleness. When you cast this spell, your movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks for the rest of the turn.

spell.name: Lightning Ring
entries: A crackling ring of electricity circles around you, granting you resistance to lightning damage. When you cast this spell, and at the start of each of your turns for the duration, the ring pulses. When the ring pulses, each creature other than you in a 5-foot radius sphere centered on you must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 12d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

In addition, as an action on your turn you can fire a bolt of lightning from the ring. These bolts originate from you and form a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 8d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

components.m: a small glass ring and a bit of animal fur

spell.name: Lionheart
entries: You touch a willing creature, removing the {@condition frightened} condition from it. For the duration, the target is immune to being {@condition frightened}.

components.m: a hair from a lion's mane

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Lion's Charge
entries: You strike a foe with the fury of a lion. As part of casting this spell, you may move up to 20 feet, then make a melee attack against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and an additional {@damage 2d10} radiant damage. In addition, the creature must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
You have advantage on this attack if you have moved at least 20 feet already in the turn when you cast it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Lion's Roar
entries: You let loose a tremendous roar, loud as a mountain falling. Each hostile creature in a 60-foot radius sphere centered on you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d8} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. A creature that fails its save by 5 or more is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

In addition, each allied creature in the spell's area that can hear you is no longer {@condition frightened} or {@condition charmed} and has advantage on the next attack roll or saving throw they make before the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Listening Coin
entries: You rub the two coins used for casting this spell together, turning them into magical hearing devices: one a sensor and the other a receiver. For the duration, anyone who holds the receiver up to their ear can hear anything audible from the sensor's location as if they were present in that location.

components.m: a pair of coins, each worth at least 1 cp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher level spell slot, the duration increases: 1 week with a 5th level slot, 1 month with a 7th level spell slot, until dispelled with a 9th level spell slot.

spell.name: Lively Step
entries: Conjuring forth a marching tune, you exhort your allies to struggle on. Choose up to three creatures you can see in range to be affected by this spell. An affected target's speed increases by 15 feet until the spell ends. If a creature takes any action other than the dash action, this spell ends on that target at the end of their turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target two additional creatures for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Living Undeath
entries: You touch a willing humanoid, imbuing it with the power of undeath. For the duration, the target's creature type becomes undead, and the target is immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition. If the target is already under the effects of a poison when this spell is cast, they can ignore its effects while the spell lasts. You can use an action to end this spell early.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, the duration increases: one week with a 5th-level slot, one month with a 7th-level slot, and until dispelled with a 9th-level slot.

spell.name: Love's Lament
entries: You create a dirge of despair, unleashing it in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a Wisdom saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d6} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature {@condition charmed} by you has disadvantage on its saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Loyal Vassal

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

With divine words, glowing silver runes encircle your allies' heads. For the duration, you and up to two willing creatures of your choice are immune to being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened} or possessed.

spell.name: Lucent Lance
entries: Ambient light coalesces around the rod in your hand, then erupts in a coruscating beam of radiance shaped like a needle-sharp lance. A creature within range that you can see must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn and takes damage based on the light available in your space when casting this spell. This damage is {@dice 12d8} in bright light, or {@dice 12d6} in dim light. On a successful save, the target takes half damage and is not {@condition blinded}. The spell fails automatically if your space is in darkness.

components.m: a clear glass or crystal rod

spell.name: Luminous Gaze
entries: Your eyes glow with an unearthly radiance. Until the  spell ends, you shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. In addition, creatures that rely on vision have disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

spell.name: Maddening Scream
entries: With an incomprehensible word and a touch of a hand wrapped in black magic, you reduce your foe to a screaming lunatic. For the duration, the target has disadvantage on saving throws. In addition, at the start of each of its turns for the next minute, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn and uses all of its speed moving in a direction of your choice.

spell.name: Maddening Whispers
entries: Your muttered words burrow unto your foes' minds like hungry maggots, spawning dark and disturbing thoughts. Each creature of your choice within a 30-foot-radius of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature is subjected to one of the following effects for the next minute:

items: {@b Hysteria:} The creature falls into fits of uncontrollable laughter or crying. It is {@condition incapacitated} and takes {@damage 4d6} psychic damage at the start of each of its turns.
{@b Panic:} The creature becomes {@condition frightened} of all other creatures.

{@b Violent Hallucinations:} The creature uses its action each turn to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach. If there is no creature within its reach, the creature uses its movement to move as close as it can to the nearest creature it is aware of first.
{@b Stupor:} The creature falls {@condition prone} as it curls up on the floor, oblivious to what is going on around it. While the spell lasts, it is {@condition paralyzed}.

entries: You may choose a different effect for each target. An affected creature may make a Wisdom save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

spell.name: Mage Armor, Greater
entries: You surround yourself with a protective magical force until the spell ends. Your AC becomes 15+ your Dexterity modifier. The spell ends if you don armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

spell.name: Mage Armor, Mass
entries: You choose up to three willing creatures you can see in range who aren't wearing armor, and a protective magical force surrounds each one until the spell ends. Each of those target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier. The spell ends on a target if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Magic Miasma
entries: A thick, sparkling cloud of billowing mist rolls into being, filling a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. The fog is so thick that any creature that starts its turn in the fog or enters the fog for the first time on a turn has its speed reduced by 30 feet, to a minimum of 5 feet. If a falling creature passes through the area, it reduces falling damage it would take by {@dice 1d6} for every 10 feet it falls through the cloud.

Magic Miasma greatly dampens the effectiveness of magic spells. A creature standing in the fog has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects and spell attack rolls made by a creature within the fog or targeting a creature within the fog have disadvantage. In addition, spells cannot be cast using a spell slot of 6th level or higher within the fog.
A wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) temporarily disperses the fog, which reforms 1 round later.

components.m: a small piece of quilted cloth

spell.name: Malevolent Miasma
entries: A brief burst of gray fog tinged with dark, malevolent streaks explodes in a 15-foot radius sphere centered on a point you can see within range. Each creature within the area must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d8} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition unconscious} for 1 hour or until it regains hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Make Manifest
entries: You attempt to draw a creature from another plane of existence to your own. You must be familiar with the target, who is immediately aware of you when you are casting the spell. The target may make a Charisma saving throw if it is unwilling. On a successful save, the target is unaffected. On a failed save, or if the target chooses not to resist the spell, the target appears in an unoccupied space you can see within range. This space must be on a solid surface. Deities and other planar entities can prevent this spell from affecting them or any creature in their domain.
When the spell ends, the target returns to its original location.

m.text: hair, blood, or another similar token from the target, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Mantle of the Icy Soul
entries: You permanently imbue a willing creature with icy resilience. The creature's skin takes on a subtle blue tint, and its breath does not frost in cold temperatures. The creature is immune to cold damage and vulnerable to fire damage.

m.text: 500 gp worth of powdered sapphire, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Manyjaws
entries: You clamp your teeth together as a trio of spectral disembodied jaws appear at a point you can see in range and begin to float towards your foes, gnashing their teeth. When you cast this spell, and as an action on your turn while the spell lasts, you may command each of these jaws to fly up to 30 feet and make a melee a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. You may direct each set of jaws to attack the same target or different targets. On a hit, a target takes {@damage 2d6} force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you summon one additional set of jaws for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Mark of the Outcast
entries: You invoke the ancient words of anathema and touch a creature, which must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, your touch leaves an indelible mark on the subject's face. A marked creature has disadvantage on all Charisma ability checks while the spell lasts.
If you concentrate on the spell for the full duration, the mark remains even after the spell ends, though it no longer has any additional effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Marked Object
entries: You hold an object in your hands, reciting ancient words of power to grant yourself knowledge about that item.
When you cast this spell, choose one of the following options:

items: {@b Track Object.} For the duration, you sense the direction of the object, regardless of distance. If you are within 100 feet of the object, you know its precise location. This spell ceases to function if the object is on another plane of existence or if any thickness of lead, even a thin sheet, blocks a direct path between you and the object.

{@b Discern Owner.} For the duration, you can call to mind an image of the object's owner in clear detail. If the object is a magic item that requires attunement, the owner is always considered to be the creature currently attuned to the item. If the object is non-magical or does not require attunement, the owner is determined by the DM.

spell.name: Master Air
entries: Currents of air circle around you, willing to aid you should the need arise. For the duration, whenever you fall, your rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round and you always land on your feet, taking no falling damage. As a bonus action, you can grant yourself a flying speed equal to your walking speed until the end of your next turn.

components.m: a wing feather from a bird

spell.name: Master Earth
entries: The ground beneath your feet suddenly seems insubstantial as you sink beneath the surface, moving through dirt and stone as easily as if you were flying through the air. When you cast this spell, you, along with everything you are wearing or carrying, are instantly transported to a destination of your choice on the same plane of existence as you travel straight through the earth itself, appearing in the nearest unoccupied space in contact with earth or stone. You may travel to any place you are familiar with, though if you do not have an exact location you are transported to the periphery of the general area you choose.
This spell only functions on the Material Plane or the Elemental plane of earth.

spell.name: Master's Touch
entries: As you cast this spell, you touch a single weapon or  shield to grant yourself an intuitive understanding of how to wield it. For the duration, you have proficiency with that weapon or shield.

spell.name: Maw of Chaos
entries: You create a yawning area of roiling purple-red energy, filling a 20-foot radius sphere centered on a point you can see within range. When a creature other than you enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must make a Charisma saving throw. A creature that fails its save takes {@damage 10d6} psychic damage and {@damage 10d6} force damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until it ends a turn outside of the affected area. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition incapacitated}.

spell.name: Maw of Stone
entries: You touch a single natural stone opening or point in a passageway no larger than 15 feet wide or 15 feet tall, causing the rock to come alive. For the duration, the maw attempts to attack any creatures that try to pass through it. Make a melee spell attack whenever the maw attacks a creature, dealing {@damage 10d8} bludgeoning damage on a hit.

The maw can only make one attack each round and will continue to attack creatures attempting to pass through it for the duration of the spell, even if you are no longer nearby. You can command the passageway not to attack certain creatures or groups of creatures. While not attacking, the maw is indistinguishable from the surrounding passageway.

spell.name: Mechanus Mind
entries: You touch a willing creature, causing their mind to feel clearer and more organized. For the duration, the target is proficient in Intelligence and Wisdom saving throws and has a +5 bonus to Intelligence checks. However, the target becomes emotionally detached, and makes all Charisma checks with disadvantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Memory Rot
entries: You exhale a cloud of glowing yellow spores, which float around you in a 15-foot-radius for the duration. On the turn when you cast Memory Rot, and as an action while the spell lasts, you may cause these spores to infest the brain of any number of creatures in the area. Each affected creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spores begin to infest that creature's brain, causing it to have disadvantage on all Intelligence-based skill checks and saving throws. In addition, the creature automatically fails saving throws against divination spell cast against them. On a successful save, nothing happens, and the creature is immune to Memory Rot for 1 minute.

Once the spores have begun to grow in a creature's brain, they last indefinitely. Any spell or magical effect that removes a disease kills the spores and ends the effect for that creature. A creature that is immune to disease is unaffected by Memory Rot.

spell.name: Mesmerizing Glare
entries: Your eyes glow with a warm, friendly fire, enrapturing those around you. Each creature in a 30-foot cone that can see you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition charmed} for the duration.

While {@condition charmed} by this spell, the creature must make a Wisdom saving at the start of each of its turns. On a successful save, it can act normally that turn. On a failed save, it spends the entire turn staring blankly at you.
The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or it can no longer see you.

spell.name: Metal Melt
entries: You alter the physical properties of a non-magic metal object of Medium size or smaller so that it runs like water. The melted metal does not change temperature but flows as a liquid before returning to its normal solid state at the beginning of your next turn, usually in a form resembling a puddle. If the target is being worn or carried by another creature, that creature may make a Dexterity saving throw. On a success, the target is unaffected.

components.m: a drop of mercury in a vial

spell.name: Miasma
entries: You hiss out a red mist that streaks toward your target, clawing into their mouth and nose. A creature you can see within range must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target's mouth and throat are filled with an unbreathable gas. For the duration, the target is {@condition poisoned}, can't breathe or speak, and begins suffocating at the start of its next turn.

A creature that is choking can survive for a number of rounds equal to its Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 round). At the start of its next turn, it drops to 0 hit points and is dying, and it can't regain hit points or be stabilized until it can breathe again.
A creature that does not need to breathe that fails its save is still unable to speak but otherwise unaffected.

spell.name: Miasma of Entropy
entries: You intone the words of this spell, sending forth a wave of entropy in a 30-foot cone originating from you. Within the area all wood, leather and other natural materials decay at an accelerated rate. All such nonmagical objects in the area of Medium size or smaller that are not being worn or carried rot into a slimy, pulpy mass and are destroyed.

spell.name: Mind Poison
entries: You infect a creature with a poison that erodes mental capabilities. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected for the duration. While affected, the target has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls and saving throws that use Wisdom or Intelligence.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is 8 hours. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration is 24 hours. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level or higher, the spell lasts until dispelled.

spell.name: Mindless Rage
entries: Choose a Humanoid you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be filled with rage for the duration. While filled with rage, the creature can only use its movement to attempt to move to a space within 5 feet of you, and can only use its action to make a melee attack against you or attempt to get closer to you if it cannot reach you.

At the end of each of its turns, the target may make a Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on a success. The target has disadvantage on this save if it can see you. If the target ends its turn and was unable to move or attack since the end of its last turn (for example: if it does not know where you are or you are in the air or otherwise inaccessible to it), the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Minor Disguise
entries: You magically create minor, cosmetic changes in your appearance. For example: you might add color to hair, paint wrinkles on your face, give yourself a scar, or darken your teeth. This spell does not change the actual structure of either your features or body. A creature that has seen you before can make an Intelligence saving throw to see through your disguise. This spell ends early if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action.

spell.name: Miser's Envy
entries: You choose one creature and one object you can see within range. The creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become consumed by a powerful desire to possess the object. For the duration of the spell, the creature must spend each turn attempting to obtain the object, going so far as to attack anyone wearing or carrying it.
If the creature obtains the object, it protects it greedily, attacking any other creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the object or attempts to take the object.
If the creature has the object in its possession, it can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

spell.name: Moment of Clarity

time.condition: which you take when another creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself fails a Wisdom saving throw or ability check

entries: With a word of encouragement, you grant a creature you can see within range a burst of unexpected clarity. The creature must reroll the triggering ability check or saving throw and use the higher roll.

spell.name: Moon Binding
entries: Translucent red chains fly from your outstretched hands to wrap around the target before fading away. Choose one creature you can see within range. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw; a creature can choose to fail this saving throw if it wishes.

If the creature fails this save, it is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form for the duration of the spell. Additionally, if the creature is a Shapechanger, it reverts to its original form and can't assume a different form while the spell lasts.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target an additional creature for each slot level above 2nd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

spell.name: Moon Blade
entries: A blazing sword of moonlight springs forth from your hand. This magic sword lasts until the spell ends and counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. The sword uses your spellcasting ability modifier for the attack and damage rolls, dealing {@damage 3d8} psychic damage on a hit. The sword leaves no visible wounds to living creatures, but against Undead, the sword deals an additional {@damage 1d8} fire damage on a hit as their substance boils away.

A successful hit with the moon blade also temporarily disrupts magic. When a Shapechanger is hit by an attack from the moon blade, it must make a Constitution saving throw, reverting to its original form on a failure. In addition, a creature hit by an attack from the moon blade has disadvantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on spells until the end of its next turn.
If you drop the weapon, it dissipates at the end of the turn. While the spell persists, you can use a bonus action to cause the sword to reappear in your hand.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 4th or 5th-level spell slot, the psychic damage increases to {@dice 3d8}. When you cast it using a 6th or 7th-level spell slot, the psychic damage increases to {@dice 4d8} and the fire damage increases to {@dice 2d8}.

spell.name: Moon Bolt
entries: Picturing the full moon in your mind, you call upon the cyclical energies of the celestial body to create a bolt of shimmering moonlight, which streaks unerringly from your outstretched hand to strike a creature you can see in range. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 6d10} radiant damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. In addition, an Undead creature that fails its save is {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A {@condition paralyzed} creature can make another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success, it is no longer {@condition paralyzed}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Moon Lust
entries: Presenting a silver ingot in your hands, you instill an obsessive fascination with the moon in a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} for the duration. A Shapechanger has disadvantage on this saving throw.

While {@condition charmed} by this spell, the target is {@condition incapacitated} and has a speed of 0. The spell ends for the target if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.
A creature that cannot see the moon is unaffected by this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

m.text: a silver ingot worth 5gp

spell.name: Moon Path
entries: You create a ribbon of glowing white translucent force to form either a bridge or set of stairs between two points you choose in range. When you initially create the bridge, you can choose to have the path be at least 5 feet and up to 20 feet wide, as well as whether or not the width varies across the path.

When you create the path, you may designate up to four creatures to receive extra protection as for as long as it is standing on the path. A protected creature has advantage on saving throws. In addition, any creature that targets a protected creature with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This doesn't protect the warded creature from area effects. If a protected creature makes an attack or casts a spell that affects a hostile creature or deals damage, they are no longer protected by the path and lose all additional benefits for the remaining duration of the spell.
Nothing can physically pass through the pass. It is immune to damage, but can be dispelled by dispel magic and is instantly destroyed by a disintegrate spell.

spell.name: Moonbow
entries: Motes of light flit among your fingers before coalescing into three glowing orbs in your space. They float in the air and orbit you for the spell's duration, providing dim light in a 20-foot radius so long as at least one orb remains. When you cast the spell, and as a bonus action on each of your turns while the spell lasts, you can fire one or more of these orbs at a creature or object you can see within 120 feet.
Make a ranged spell attack for each orb. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} radiant damage. If the target is Undead, you have advantage on this attack.
At the end of the duration, any orbs you didn't fire vanish.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the number of orbs created increases by two for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Moonfire
entries: A cone of fiery white moonlight springs from your hand. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 20d6} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Undead and Shapechangers make their save with disadvantage. In addition, a creature that is damaged by this spell immediately reverts to its normal form (this includes Shapechangers, polymorphed creatures or other magic or effects that grant a creature a different form).

spell.name: Mountain Stance
entries: Calling upon the primordial powers of elemental earth, you grant a willing creature the stubborn determination of mountains. The target can choose to root itself to the ground on its turn, no action required. While rooted, the creature has advantage on any ability check or saving throws made to resist being {@condition grappled}, knocked down, or moved involuntarily. The target can only root itself to the ground once per turn and is no longer rooted if it voluntarily moves.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Nature's Avatar
entries: You infuse a willing Beast with the spirit of nature. Until the spell ends, the target can't cast spells and gains the following benefits:

items: The target gains 100 temporary hit points.
The target has advantage on Strength, Dexterity and Constitution based ability checks as well as attack rolls that it makes with unarmed attacks.
The target's unarmed attacks deal an additional {@damage 2d12} damage and count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance or immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.
The target's size doubles in all dimensions, and its weight is multiplied by eight. It increases its size by one size category.
The target can take an additional action on each of its turns, which can only be used to take the attack, dash, disengage, or hide action.

entries: The target can end this spell for itself at any point, no action required.

spell.name: Nature's Balance
entries: You lend a willing creature your own natural ability. Choose an ability score. For the duration, you have disadvantage on all ability checks, attack rolls and saving throws that use that ability score. The target gains advantage on all ability checks, attack rolls and saving throws using that same ability score.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you may choose one additional ability score and target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Nature's Favor
entries: With a touch of your hand, you imbue up to three Beasts with magic. For each target, their natural weapons count as magic weapons for the purpose of overcoming damage resistance and immunities and have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the bonus increases to +2. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the bonus increases to +3.

spell.name: Nature's Rampart
entries: With a wave of your hand, the ground beneath your feet trembles and the landscape shifts into a new form. You can affect up to 10 5-foot spaces in range, each of which must be contiguous with one another. You shape a natural setting into a formidable defensive position, the nature of which depends on the kind of terrain:

items: {@b Outdoor Site or Cavern.} A rampart or dike of earth and stone rises 5 feet high on one side, with a 5 foot deep ditch on the other side.

{@b Marshy or Low-Lying Site.} In areas such as marsh, bog, swamp or tundra, you create a water-filled ditch 5-feet deep. A creature forced to wade the ditch must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves.

entries: Artificial structures and features (such as buildings and paved roads) are not affected. If you maintain your {@status Concentration|XPHB} on this spell for its whole duration, the rampart becomes permanent and can't be dispelled.
Otherwise, the rampart disappears when the spell ends.

m.text: a small quartz gem engraved with the image of a castle, worth at least 100 gp

spell.name: Naturewatch
entries: Using the sight granted by the powers of life, you can detect the presence of Plants and Beasts within 30 feet of you and you can sense if they are suffering from any conditions or diseases, as well as how close to death they are.

As an action before the spell ends, you can choose a Beast within 30 feet of you that isn't hostile towards you to form a mental bond with. This bond lasts until the spell ends, the target moves more than 100 feet away from you or you break the bond (no action required). While this bond lasts, you see through the target's eyes and hear what it hears, gaining the benefits of any special senses that the target has. During this time, you are deaf and blind with regards to your own senses. You have no control over the actions of the target.

spell.name: Nauseating Breath
entries: You exhale a great gout of putrid-smelling green gas. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for the next minute. Creatures that don't breathe are unaffected by this spell. At the end of each of its turns, a {@condition poisoned} creature can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the creature is no longer {@condition poisoned}.

components.m: a piece of fish at least one day old

spell.name: Negative Energy Aura
entries: You speak ancient words as an aura of black, crackling energy surrounds you and extends 10 feet around you for the duration. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

Constructs are not affected by this spell. When an Undead creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it does not take damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to your spellcasting modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Nerveskitter

time.condition: which you take when you or an ally makes an initiative roll

entries: You suffuse a willing ally with a brief, blue glow, enhancing their reactions. The target rolls an additional {@dice d20} and uses the higher roll for their initiative.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Net of Shadows
entries: The surrounding shadows shift at your command, flying towards a creature you can see in range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be wrapped in shadows for the duration. While wrapped in shadows the target is heavily obscured and is blind beyond 5 feet.
At the end of each of its turns, the target can make an Intelligence saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Nightmare Lullaby
entries: You twist the perception of a creature you can see within range, placing it in a surreal, sleepwalking state. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected for the duration. While affected, the target cannot take reactions and must roll a {@dice d10} at the start of each of its turns to determine how it acts this turn.

rows: The target briefly sees through the nightmare and can move and act normally.
The target babbles incoherently and doesn't move or take actions this turn.
The target is terrified of you and cannot take actions. It must use all of its movement to move as far away from you as possible.

The target sees twisted enemies all around and uses its action to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach. If there is no creature within its reach, the target does nothing this turn.

entries: At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Night's Caress
entries: Your touch sheds darkness, disrupting the life force of living creatures. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d12} necrotic damage and has its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

Against an Undead creature, this spell deals no damage. Instead, the target is {@condition frightened} of you and must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can. It cannot take reactions and the only action it can take is the dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the dodge action. This effect lasts for one minute or until the target takes damage.

spell.name: Nightshield
entries: A field of shadowy energy cloaks your body. For the duration, whenever you take radiant damage, that damage is reduced by 2. In addition, you take no damage from magic missile spells.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage reduction is increased by 2 for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Nightstalker's Transformation
entries: You bestow yourself with the prowess of a creature of stealth and shadow. Until the spell ends, you can't cast spells, and you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed and can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check
You ignore the first 30 feet when determining how much falling damage you would take.
You have proficiency with simple weapons, hand crossbows, rapiers, longswords, and short swords.
You have advantage on all Dexterity checks and Dexterity saving throws.

Once per turn, you can deal an extra {@damage 5d6} damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse or a ranged weapon. You don't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't {@condition incapacitated}, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

spell.name: Nimbus of Light
entries: A glittering corona of light surrounds your body. While the spell lasts, you shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. As a bonus action while the spell lasts, you may command the light to coalesce in your hand and fling it at a creature or object you can see within 60 feet of you. When you do so, make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d10} radiant damage and the spell ends. You have advantage with this attack while the target is in an area of bright light.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: One With the Land
entries: As you cast this spell you are bathed in a golden-green light from above. As it fades, you feel in touch with your natural surroundings as you forge a powerful link with nature. For the duration, you always know which way is North and have advantage on Wisdom (Animal Handling), Wisdom (Survival), and Intelligence (Nature) skill checks.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level, the duration is 4 hours. If you use a spell slot of 4th level, the duration is 8 hours. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is 24 hours.

spell.name: Ooze Puppet
entries: Upon casting this spell, you reach out to surround an Ooze you can see in range with magical strands, placing it under your control. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be controlled by you for the duration. While controlled, an Ooze cannot move or take actions or reactions unless directed to by you. On your turn, you may mentally direct the Ooze as a bonus action, dictating where it will move and what action it will take on its next turn. You must be able to see the Ooze to mentally direct it.
If a controlled Ooze splits for any reason, you retain control over one of the resulting Oozes (chosen randomly).
An Ooze with an Intelligence score of 4 or higher may attempt a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success

spell.name: Opalescent Glare
entries: Your eyes glow with a pearly light as you smite a creature you can see in range with your deadly gaze. That creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition paralyzed} by this spell can make another Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. A creature automatically succeeds on its saving throw if it is a Fey or if it can no longer see you.

If a creature with 10 hit points or fewer fails its initial saving throw, it dies instantly and each hostile creature that isn't a Fey within 20 feet of the target must make a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of you for the next minute. A creature {@condition frightened} by this spell can make a Wisdom  saving throw at the end of each turn, ending the effect on a success.

spell.name: Orb of Elements
entries: You hurl a 6-inch-diameter sphere of energy at a creature that you can see within range. You choose acid, cold, fire, force, lightning or thunder for the type of orb you create, then make a ranged spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the creature takes {@damage 6d8} damage of the type you chose and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer an additional effect based on that element:

items: {@b Acid.} The target is {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn.
{@b Cold.} The target's speed is reduced to 0 until the end of its next turn.
{@b Fire.} The target takes an additional {@damage 2d8} fire damage and each creature within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} fire damage.
{@b Force.} The target is pushed 10 feet directly away from you.
{@b Lightning.} The target is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.
{@b Thunder} The target falls {@condition prone}.

m.text: a diamond worth at least 50 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Otyugh Swarm

m.text: ruby dust worth 1000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You conjure forth a pack of {@dice 1d4 + 4} Otyughs to serve you from a large area of refuse or filth that you can see in range. You must cast this spell in an area containing at least 6,000 pounds of sewage, refuse, or offal. The DM has the Otyugh's statistics.

The Otyughs are friendly to you and your companions. The Otyughs have their own turns and act immediately after you in initiative. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions. When the duration ends, or an Otyugh is reduced to 0 hit points, it sloughs back into a pile of offal.

spell.name: Panacea
entries: You touch a willing creature, channeling positive energy to wipe away afflictions. You immediately end any diseases affecting it, as well as any of the following conditions: {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition paralyzed}, or {@condition poisoned}. In addition, the target gains {@dice 2d8} + your spellcasting modifier temporary hit points.

spell.name: Persistent Blade
entries: You bring a tiny blade of force into being, which floats around you in your space for the duration. When a creature moves into a space within five feet of you, or when a creature within five feet of you attacks or casts a spell, you may use your reaction to command the blade to lash out at that creature. When it does so, make a melee spell attack against that creature. On a hit, the target takes force damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + your spellcasting modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Phantasmal Assailants
entries: You point at a creature you can see in range. Instantly, shadowy shapes only visible to the target form at your flank and rush toward the creature you indicate, surrounding and attacking it. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, if the target fails its saving throw by 5 or more it is distracted by the assailants and any attack rolls made against the target before the end of your next turn have advantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Phantasmal Decoy
entries: You weave an illusion that is only visible to a creature you can see within range, which takes the form of their most hated enemy. You choose a space in range, which the phantasmal decoy appears in. As a bonus action on your turn, you may command the phantasmal decoy to move up to 30 feet in any direction. The phantasmal decoy can occupy the same space as another creature and its movement is not hindered by difficult terrain or other obstacles.

At the start of each of its turns while the spell lasts, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be unable to target a creature with an attack or harmful spell unless it includes the phantasmal decoy as a target. The target has advantage on this saving throw if the phantasmal decoy is in the same space as another creature or not visible to the target.

spell.name: Phantasmal Disorientation
entries: You create an area of ever-shifting phantasmal terrain and landmarks in a 150-foot cube in range that confuse anyone attempting to move through the affected area. The entire area is considered lightly obscured. When you cast the spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it.

An affected creature's speed is halved in the area, and when a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there it must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the terrain shifts and twists around the creature, seeming to move of its own accord. The creature finds it nearly impossible to move in a straight line and instead all movement is made in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll a {@dice d8} and assign a direction to each die face. The creature can only move in that direction while it remains in the area this turn. On a successful save, the creature can move normally.

spell.name: Phantasmal Thief
entries: A shapeless, {@condition invisible} force springs into existence in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. It has an AC of 10, 25 hit points, a fly speed of 30 feet, blindsight for 60 feet, a Strength of 8 and an Intelligence of 8. It can't attack and if it drops to 0 hit points the spell ends. The phantasm can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain and takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Once on each of your turns as a bonus action, you can mentally command the phantasm to obtain medium or smaller-sized objects for you, as well as a location you wish it to take them from. These can be specific objects and locations (for example: the jeweled dagger in the mayor's desk) or a general kind of object or location (for example: daggers anywhere in this town). The phantasm acts immediately after you in initiative and will spend each of its turns searching the directed area and attempting to obtain the object(s) you specify. The phantasm cannot obtain objects that are being worn or carried, or objects that weigh more than 120 pounds. When the phantasm successfully obtains an object, it stores it in an extradimensional space that only the phantasm can access. This extradimensional space can hold up to 500 pounds, and cannot exceed a volume of 64 cubic feet.

When this extradimensional space is full, or until you use a bonus action to command the phantasm to return, it will spend each of its turns moving towards you. When the phantasm reaches you, it deposits the objects it has obtained one at a time at your feet. If the spell ends, all the objects in the extradimensional space immediately spill forth where in the space where the phantasm occupied.

The phantasm always knows what direction you are and will not voluntarily move more than 500 feet away from you and if it does so (if you are teleported elsewhere, for example) then it will spend its turns moving towards you until it is within 500 feet.

spell.name: Phantom Foe
entries: Choose a creature you can see in range. The target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or be assailed by illusory duplicates of creatures hostile to the target for the duration. While these illusory duplicates last, the target has difficulty determining which image is real. Each time the target makes an attack roll during the spell's duration, roll  a {@dice d20} to determine whether the attack instead targets one of the duplicates. On a 10 or lower, the target has struck a duplicate and their attack does nothing.
A creature is unaffected by this spell if it can't see, if it relies on senses other than sight, such as blindsight, or if it can perceive illusions as false, as with truesight.

m.text: a tiny pewter figure of a warrior worth 10 gp

spell.name: Plague of Undead

m.text: A black sapphire worth 5000 gp

entries: Unleashing a cold rush of necromantic energy, you cause a host of Undead to rise from the bodies of the fallen.

Choose any number of corpses you can see in range with a combined challenge rating (or level, if they do not have a challenge rating) equal to or less than your level. Those corpses rise as a Reanimated using the template in info tab. A creature remains reanimated and under your control until the spell is dispelled or the creature is reduced to 0 hit point.

entries.name: Reanimated Template
entries: A Reanimated is any body brought back to life by the Plague of Undead spell. Constructs, Elementals, Oozes and Plants can't be reanimated. The following characteristics change or are added to a creature that becomes Reanimated.
{@b Retained Characteristics.} The Reanimated retains its Armor Class, hit points, Hit Dice, Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, vulnerabilities, resistances, and immunities.

{@b Lost Characteristics.} The Reanimated loses its original saving throw and skill bonuses, special senses, and special traits. It loses any action that isn't Multiattack or a melee weapon attack that deals bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage. If it has an action or a melee weapon attack that deals some other type of damage, it loses the ability to deal damage of that type, unless the damage comes from a piece of equipment, such as a magic item.
{@b Type.} The Reanimated's type is Undead, and it loses any tags.
{@b Alignment.} The Reanimated is Unaligned.
{@b Speed.} Reduce all the Reanimated's speeds by 10 feet, to a minimum of 5 feet.
{@b Ability Scores.} The Reanimated's ability scores change as follows: Int 2 (−4), Wis 6 (−2), Cha 1 (−5).
{@b Senses} The Reanimated has blindsight with a radius of 30 feet, and it is blind beyond this radius.
{@b Condition Immunities.} The Reanimated can't be blinded, charmed, frightened, or paralyzed.
{@b Languages.} The Reanimated loses all known languages, but it responds to orders given to it by the creature that reanimated it.
{@b Attacks.} If the Reanimated has no other means of dealing damage, it can use its fists or limbs to make unarmed strikes. On a hit, an unarmed strike deals bludgeoning damage based on its size:

spell.name: Plague of Vermin
entries: You summon swarms of Fey creatures, which appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. Choose any number of swarms with a combined Challenge Rating of 2 or lower. No individual swarm may have a Challenge Rating below ¼ or above 2. Your choices of swarms may include: bats, insects, poisonous snakes, quippers, rats, or ravens (your GM might allow other swarms to be summoned). The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which have their own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.
A summoned swarm disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends. The GM has the creatures' statistics.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the maximum combined challenge rating increases by 2 for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Planar Bubble
entries: You create a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on either a willing creature or point you can see in range, which emulates an environment you choose. If the target is a creature, then the area moves with the target. The environment chosen, along with the effects it provides are chosen from the following (your GM may make more environments available):

items: {@b Material Plane.} The atmosphere is comfortable and dry inside the bubble. In addition, the area is lit by sunlight, which provides bright light throughout the entire area.

{@b Feywild.} All sensations, both sensory and emotional are heightened within the area and magic runs more freely. Once per turn, when a creature casts a spell using a spell slot of 1st level or higher inside the area they must roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to create an additional magical effect.

{@b Shadowfell.} Colors and light seem to leech away in the bubble, and those inside the area are filled with a persistent sense of dread. Any light source in the area that would normally produce bright light produces dim light instead and all sources of dim light are darkness. In addition, creatures in the area have vulnerability to necrotic damage.

{@b Ethereal Plane.} The bubble is filled with swirling fog that limits vision. Anything further than 10 feet away in the area is heavily obscured and no sound can pass into or out of the area. In addition, creatures in the area have a flying speed equal to their walking speed.

{@b Astral Plane.} The bubble becomes a silvery void, where creatures and objects stop aging and do not suffer from hunger or thirst. As a plane of thought, each creature's walking speed is equal to 3x their Intelligence score as long as they remain in the area.

{@b Elemental Plane of Air.} Powerful winds whip throughout the bubble, causing any ranged attacks into or out of the area to be made with disadvantage. Any creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet directly away from the center of the area. If this spell is cast on a creature, that creature is immune to being pushed by this spell

{@b Elemental plane of Earth.} The entire bubble is filled with constantly churning sediment, blinding any creature as long as it remains in the area while also providing total cover. There is no air present in the area, so a creature that needs to breathe must hold its breath or begin to suffocate. In addition, a creature moving through the area must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves unless it has a burrowing speed.

{@b Elemental plane of Fire.} The bubble is filled with a sweltering heat. Any creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there; it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} fire damage. Creatures wearing medium or heavy armor, or who are clad in heavy clothing, have disadvantage on the saving throw. Flammable objects in the area that are not being worn or carried ignite.

{@b Elemental plane of Water.} The entire bubble is filled with water drawn from frigid, crushing depths. While in the area, a creature suffers from the normal effects of Frigid Waters (see "Unusual Environments" in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master's Guide).

spell.name: Plant Body
entries: You transform yourself into a new form, which lasts for the duration or until you drop to 0 hit points or die. The new form can be any nonmagical Plant of Huge size or smaller or any Plant creature whose Challenge Rating is equal to or less than your level. If your new form is a creature, your game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen creature. If your new form is a nonmagical plant, you retain your mental ability scores and the rest of your game statistics are replaced by the statistics of the chosen plant.

You are limited in the actions you can perform by the nature of your new form and you can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech unless your new form is normally able to do so.
Your gear melds into your new form. You cannot activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of your equipment.

spell.name: Poison Thorns
entries: Black, glistening thorns emerge from your skin, endangering those who draw too close. For the duration, your natural weapons and unarmed attacks deal an additional {@damage 2d6} poison damage on a hit. In addition, any creature that starts its turn grappling you or {@condition grappled} by you takes {@damage 2d6} poison damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every two slot levels above 5th.

spell.name: Poison Vines
entries: Glistening green vines spring up at your command, covering the ground in a 20-foot radius area centered on a point within range you can see. The area is difficult terrain while the spell lasts. In addition, any creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 5d8} poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until it leaves the area. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition poisoned}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Positive Energy Aura
entries: An aura of soothing white energy surrounds you. At the end of each of your turns while the spell lasts, each creature in a 10-foot radius sphere centered on you regains a number of hit points equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.
This spell has no effect on constructs or undead.

spell.name: Primal Form
entries: Calling upon ancient and timeless magical energies of the elements, you assume a primal elemental form. You transform into any Elemental whose challenge rating is equal to or less than your level (or challenge rating, if you don't have a level). The transformation lasts for the duration, or until you drop to 0 hit points or die.

Your game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen Elemental. You retain your alignment and personality. You assume the hit points of your new form. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed. If you revert as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any access damage carries over to your normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce your normal form to 0 hit points, you aren't knocked {@condition unconscious}.

You are limited in the actions you can perform by the nature of your new form, and you can only speak, cast spells, or take other actions that require hands or speech if your new form can also do so. Your gear melds into the new form. You can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of your equipment.

spell.name: Prismatic Eye
entries: With a popping sound, an apple-sized eye with a rainbow-hued iris appears in the air. The eye orbits you in your space for the duration. When you cast this spell, or as a bonus action on your turn you may command the eye to fire a beam of colored light at a creature you can see within 120 feet. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw.
Then, roll a {@dice d8} to determine the color of the ray affecting the creature.

rows: {@color Red.|#ff0000} The target takes {@damage 10d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@color Orange.|#ffa500} The target takes {@damage 10d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@color Yellow.|#ffff00} The target takes {@damage 10d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@color Green.|#008000} The target takes {@damage 10d6} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@color Blue.|#0000ff} The target takes {@damage 10d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

{@color Indigo.|#4b0082} On a failed save, the target is {@condition Restrained|XPHB}. It must then make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves three times, the spell ends. If it fails its save three times, it permanently turns to stone and is subjected to the {@condition Petrified|XPHB} condition. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive, keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind.

{@color Violet.|#ee82ee} On a failed save, the target is {@condition Blinded|XPHB}. It must then make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of your next turn. A successful save ends the blindness. If it fails that save, the creature is transported to another plane of existence of the GM's choosing and is no longer {@condition Blinded|XPHB}. (Typically, a creature that is on a plane that isn't its home plane is banished home, while other Creatures are usually cast into the Astral or Ethereal planes.)
{@b Special.} The target is struck by a ray of your choice.

spell.name: Prismatic Ray
entries: A single beam of brilliantly colored light shoots from your outstretched hand at a creature you can see in range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. Roll a {@dice d8} to determine the color and effect of the beam.

rows: {@color Red.|#ff0000}  The target takes {@damage 10d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@color Orange.|#ffa500}   The target takes {@damage 10d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@color Yellow.|#ffff00}  The target takes {@damage 10d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@color Green.|#008000} The target takes {@damage 10d6} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@color Blue.|#0000ff} The target takes {@damage 10d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
