{@color Indigo.|#4b0082} On a failed save, the target is {@condition restrained}. It must then make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves three times, the spell ends. If it fails its save three times, it permanently turns to stone and is subjected to the {@condition petrified} condition. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind.

{@color Violet.|#ee82ee}  On a failed save, the target is {@condition blinded}. It must then make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of your next turn. A successful save ends the blindness. If it fails that save, the creature is transported to another plane of existence of the GM's choosing and is no longer {@condition blinded}. (Typically, a creature that is on a plane that isn't its home plane is banished home, while other creatures are usually cast into the Astral or Ethereal planes.)
{@b Special.} The target is afflicted by multiple effects. Roll twice more, rerolling any 8.

spell.name: Probe Thoughts
entries: For the duration of the spell, you can reach out with your thoughts to access the memories and knowledge of certain creatures. For the duration, you can detect the presence of thinking creatures within 30 feet of you, including ones you can't see. The spell can penetrate barriers, but 2 feet of rock, 2 inches of any metal other than lead, or a thin sheet of lead blocks you. You can't detect a creature with Intelligence 3 or lower.

When you cast this spell and as an action on each turn until the spell ends, you can focus on a creature you can see within 30 feet. If the creature you choose has an Intelligence of 3 or lower it is unaffected. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you learn the surface thoughts of the target, as well as the answers to up to five specific questions taken from the target's knowledge and memories. On a successful save, you can only read the surface thoughts of the target but nothing deeper and the target is immune to this casting of Probe Thoughts. Success or failure, the target is unaware of the intrusion.

spell.name: Protégé
entries: You grant a willing creature a portion of your own expertise. Choose one skill, tool, or instrument that you have proficiency in. For the duration, the target gains proficiency in the chosen skill, tool or instrument if it didn't already have it. In addition, whenever you or the target take the help action to aid the other using the chosen skill and that roll does not have disadvantage, the creature being helped may reroll one of the dice once.

spell.name: Puppeteer
entries: Strings of silver energy, invisible to all but you, extend from your fingers toward a humanoid you can see in range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be ensnared for the duration. While ensnared, the creature cannot take actions or reactions and its speed is zero unless it is being directed by you.

When you cast this spell, or as an action on your turn,  you may telepathically command the target to take an action of your choice that it can perform, which it does on its next turn. In addition, whenever you use your movement, the target immediately uses its reaction to mirror that movement to the best of its ability, (for example, if you move East 10 feet, the target also attempts to move East 10 feet).
At the end of each of its turns, the target may make another Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

spell.name: Quick March
entries: Your feet and those of up to six creatures you can see in range glow with a yellow nimbus of light. Until the start of your next turn, each affected creature's walking speed increases by 30 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, affected creature's walking speed is increased by an additional 30 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Quick Potion
entries: Coppery sparks drop from your fingertips and suffuse a flask, jar, vial, or other similarly sized container filled with water. As the sparks dissolve fully into the container, you choose another spell you can cast of 2nd level or lower that targets only one creature (including spells with a range of self), and has a casting time of 1 action. For the next hour, any creature can drink the contents of the flask as an action to be affected by the chosen spell, using your spellcasting modifier or spell save DC where necessary. If the spell requires {@status Concentration|XPHB}, the creature that drinks the potion must concentrate on the spell, up to the full duration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the level of spell you can choose increases by one for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Quill Blast
entries: Needle-sharp quills emerge from your skin before spraying in all directions. Each other creature in a 20 foot radius sphere centered on you must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 10d6} piercing damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Creatures that are Small size or smaller have advantage on their saving throw, while creatures that are Large size or larger have disadvantage on their saving throw.

If a creature fails its save by 5 or more then several of the quills become lodged in the target, giving it disadvantage  on attack rolls and ability checks until it or another creature uses an action to pull the quills free. When a creature pulls these quills free it takes an additional {@damage 2d6} piercing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Quillfire
entries: You draw upon the power of nature, as the back of your hand and arms bristle with a spike-like growth of quills that lasts until the spell ends. These quills count as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. They deal {@dice 2d8} piercing and {@damage 2d8} poison damage on a hit and have the finesse, light and thrown properties (range 20/60). New quills immediately sprout to replace ones thrown.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the piercing damage or the poison damage (your choice) increases by {@dice 1d8} for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Radiant Assault
entries: With an outstretched hand, you gesture toward a point you can see in range, releasing a rainbow-colored burst of light in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point.

Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. Each creature in the area must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} radiant damage and {@damage 6d6} damage of the type you chose on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a target fails its save by 5 or more, it is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

components.m: an eye from a Fiend or Celestial creature

spell.name: Raging Flame
entries: You inflame existing fires in a 60-foot radius sphere centered on yourself. All existing fires, both magical and mundane, flare up, burning hotter and brighter. If a fire provides light, the radius of illumination they provide is doubled (for example: a torch would cast bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light for an additional 40 feet). If a fire causes damage, that damage is increased by {@dice 1d4}.
These effects last for 1 minute. When the spell ends, affected nonmagical flames are extinguished, having burnt themselves out.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level, the effects of this spell last for 1 hour. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level, the effects of this spell last for 8 hours.

spell.name: Rainbow Beam
entries: You fire a ray of swirling, multihued light at a creature you can see in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, roll a {@dice d8} to determine what kind of damage the target takes. The target takes {@damage 3d8} damage of the chosen type and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is also {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.

m.text: a small crystal prism worth at least 5 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Rainbow Blast
entries: You unleash a beam of multihued light. The beam originates from you and forms a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} cold damage, {@damage 2d6} fire damage, and {@damage 2d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher level spell slot, the beam deals additional damage of different damage types: {@damage 2d6} thunder damage at 4th level, {@damage 2d6} poison damage at 5th level, {@damage 2d6} acid damage at 6th level, {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage at 7th level, {@damage 2d6} radiant damage at 8th level, {@damage 4d6} force damage at 9th level.

m.text: a small crystal prism worth at least 50 gp

spell.name: Raise From the Deep
entries: You grant magical buoyancy to a water vehicle you can see in range. For the duration, the target cannot sink and floats effortlessly on the surface of the water. If the target is already below the water (such as a shipwreck), then it rises towards the surface at a speed of 150 feet each round.
When cast to raise a shipwreck, the spell raises all surviving fragments of the ship in range.

spell.name: Ram's Might
entries: You touch a willing creature, bolstering its strength. While the spell lasts, the target has advantage on Strength checks. In addition, ridged, hornlike ripples appear over the knuckles, nails and backs of the target's hands. For the duration, their hands count as natural weapons, which they can use to make unarmed strikes. If they hit with them, they deal bludgeoning damage equal to {@dice 1d4} + their Strength modifier.
If the target moves 20 feet straight towards a creature and hits it with an unarmed attack on the same turn, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Ray of Clumsiness
entries: A crackling ray leaps from your outstretched hand at a creature you can see in range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage and has disadvantage on Dexterity skill checks and saves for the duration of the spell. The target can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Ray of Deanimation
entries: A copper-red ray bursts from your outstretched hand towards a creature you can see in range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d8} force damage. If this attack hits a construct, it is automatically a critical hit.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Ray of Dizziness
entries: You release a drab violet ray from your palm at a creature you can see in range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target is struck with intense feelings of vertigo. On each of its turns, it can use either an action or a bonus action,  but not both. The target can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may fire one additional ray, targeting one additional creature, for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Ray of Entropy
entries: You release a crackling black ray at a creature you can see in range, filling the air with the smell of decay. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 12d8} necrotic damage and has disadvantage on all Strength, Dexterity and Constitution checks and saves for 1 minute as their life energy is consumed. The target can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Ray of Light

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 6th.

A brilliant ray of light lances from your palm towards a creature you can see in range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 12d8} radiant damage and is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition blinded} by this spell can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

spell.name: Ray of Weakness
entries: A dark ray flies forth from your hand towards a creature you can see in range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target has its vitality drained. For the duration, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and its speed is reduced by 10 feet (to a minimum of 5 feet). The target can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may fire one additional ray, targeting one additional creature, for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Reality Maelstrom
entries: With a rending sound as loud as thunder, a tear in reality opens at a point you can see in range. Everything in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point is drawn inexorably toward the tear. Any creature or object that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be drawn into the maelstrom. A creature can choose to fail this save. Any unattended object weighing less than 100 pounds in the area is automatically drawn into the maelstrom. In addition, when you initially cast the spell, each creature and unattended object in a 40-foot sphere centered on the point must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled 20 feet towards the point.
When a creature is drawn into the maelstrom, it is sent to a random plane of existence. Roll a {@dice d20} to determine where a creature or object ends up:
The maelstrom lasts until the start of your next turn. A reality maelstrom is a one-way portal, so nothing ever emerges from the hole the spell makes.

components.m: a golden hoop at least 1-inch across

spell.name: Reaving Dispel
entries: Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 9th level or lower on the target ends. For each spell that you dispel of 5th level or lower, you can reave that spell instead. When you reave a spell, all of that spell's effects are redirected to you for the remaining duration, as though you had been the original target of the spell. If a spell you reave requires {@status Concentration|XPHB}, you must concentrate to maintain the spell's effects as if you had cast it yourself. This spell does not allow you to concentrate on any additional spells, and if you reave multiple spells that require {@status Concentration|XPHB}, you may choose which one to concentrate on.

spell.name: Rebuke
entries: With a harsh word and a sharp gesture, a creature you can see in range must make a Wisdom saving throw. The target takes {@damage 2d10} psychic damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of your next turn on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

components.m: a stick at least 1 foot long

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10}  for each slot level above 2nd. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the target instantly dies instead of being {@condition incapacitated} on a failed save if its Challenge Rating is equal to or less than 5 (or the target's level, if it does not have a Challenge Rating).

spell.name: Reciprocal Gyre
entries: You manipulate the magical aura of a creature or object you can see in range, creating a damaging feedback of arcane power. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes {@damage 8d6} force damage and an additional {@damage 2d6} force damage for each spell currently affecting the target on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage per spell increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 5th.

components.m: a tiny loop of copper wire

spell.name: Red Tide
entries: A surging wave of thick, red seawater washes over everything in an area within range. The area can be up to 120 feet long, up to 20 feet wide and up to 10 feet tall. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw.

On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 12d8} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. The wave extinguishes unprotected flames.

In addition, a creature damaged by this spell is {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, a creature takes {@damage 2d8} poison damage at the end of each of its turns and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a successful save the creature is no longer {@condition poisoned}.

spell.name: Reflective Disguise
entries: You cover yourself in a special form of glamer. For the duration, or until you use your action to dismiss the spell, any creature that sees you perceives you as the same species and gender as itself, dressed in an outfit that they would consider appropriate for the current scenario and speaking in a voice that sounds appropriate to your appearance. The changes fail to hold up to physical inspection and a creature that uses its action to inspect your appearance must succeed on an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC to see through your glamer.
This spell has no effect on creatures with an Intelligence of 3 or less and on creatures more than one size category larger or smaller than you.

spell.name: Refusal
entries: You create a special ward that prevents unauthorized spellcasters from entering a 20-foot radius sphere centered on a point in range. For the duration, any creature that can currently cast a 1st level spell or higher must make a Charisma saving throw when attempting to enter the area. On a failed save, the creature is halted by an {@condition invisible} barrier that prevents passage for 1 hour.

If a creature attempts to use any teleportation spell or effect to enter the warded area it must first make a saving throw, being shunted harmlessly to the nearest unoccupied space outside the warded area on a failure.

When you first cast this spell you can designate any number of creatures to be unaffected. In addition, you may choose to designate a password or special condition by which creatures can enter the warded area.

components.m: a pinch of dust from a wizard's tomb

spell.name: Rejection
entries: With a stern word and a sharp gesture, you send your enemies flying away from you. Each creature of your choice in a 30-foot cone must make a Strength saving throw. A creature is pushed 60 feet directly away from you on a failed save, or half as far on a successful one. If a creature is pushed into an object or solid surface, it takes {@dice 1d6} points of bludgeoning damage for every 5 feet it was pushed and falls {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Rejuvenation Cocoon
entries: You touch a willing creature, drawing a cocoon of glowing yellow-green energy around them. At the start of each of its turns, the target regains 10 hit points and is cured of one disease or the {@condition poisoned} condition. As an action, you or the creature inside the cocoon can end the spell prematurely. While inside the cocoon, the target cannot move or speak, has total cover, and the only action it can take is to end the spell. The cocoon has an AC of 10 and 50 hit points. If it is destroyed, the spell ends immediately.
This spell has no effect on Constructs or Undead.

spell.name: Renewal Pact
entries: You bind a protective spell to a willing creature. The pact remains dormant until the target is subjected to one of the following effects, at which point the spell is triggered:

items: One effect that {@condition charmed} or {@condition petrified} the target.
One curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item.
Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores.
One effect reducing the target's hit point maximum.

entries: When triggered, the effect that triggered the pact immediately ends and the target gains {@dice 4d8} temporary hit points. A creature can only be subject to one Renewal Pact at a time.

m.text: a topaz worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Repair Damage
entries: A Construct or Undead creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Resist Energy
entries: For the duration, the willing creature you touch has resistance to one damage type of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, it no longer requires {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

spell.name: Resonating Bolt
entries: You unleash a tremendous bolt of thunderous energy from your open hand in a 60-foot long, 5 foot wide line in a direction you choose. Each creature and object in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 8d6} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Resonating Bolt can easily shatter or break interposing barriers. If the bolt deals enough damage to destroy a barrier, creatures behind it gain no benefit from the cover it would have provided.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Restoration, Mass
entries: You imbue up to ten creatures in range with positive energy to undo a debilitating effect. You can reduce a target's {@condition exhaustion} level by one, or end one of the following effects on a target:

items: One effect that {@condition charmed} or {@condition petrified} the target.
One curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item.
Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores.
One effect reducing the target's hit point maximum.

m.text: diamond dust worth at least 1000 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Resurgence
entries: You appeal to a greater power to grant up to three creatures of your choice within range a second chance. Each target chooses one ongoing spell or magical effect that allows a saving throw at the beginning or end of their turn. The target re-rolls their saving throw, ending the spell or effect for that creature on a successful save.

spell.name: Reveille
entries: You touch the body of a creature that has been dead for up to three days, calling on the living memory of the creature to reveal information about the events that led up to its death. The corpse speaks tersely in its native language, using no more than a dozen words or so in a round. In the first round, it describes the last thing it saw. In the second, it describes its dying wish. In the third, it describes the attack that killed it. In the fourth, it tells who killed it. In the fifth, it tells why it believes it was killed. The spell automatically fails if cast on a creature that did not speak any languages.

spell.name: Revenance
entries: You touch a creature that has died within the last hour. If its soul is free and willing, the target returns to life with half of its maximum hit points. This spell can't return to life a creature that has died of old age, nor can it restore any missing body parts. While the spell lasts, the target has advantage on all attack rolls against the creature that killed them. If the target kills the creature that killed them, or at the end of the duration, the spell ends and the target dies.

spell.name: Reverse Arrows
entries: A silver radiance flecked with blue lines surrounds you. For the duration, whenever you are hit by a ranged weapon attack, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d6} + your spellcasting modifier.

In addition, when a ranged weapon attack misses you, you can use your reaction to turn the attack back upon the creature that fired it. Make a ranged spell attack against the attacker. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon attack's normal effects and takes an additional {@damage 2d8} force damage.

components.m: a piece of tortoise shell and a ball of tree sap

spell.name: Righteous Aura
entries: You invoke your divine power, bursting alight with a golden radiance. For the duration, you shed bright light in a 30-foot-radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

If you are reduced to 0 hit points while the aura lasts, you unleash a final explosive blast of divine power and the spell ends. Each creature of your choice in a 20 foot-radius sphere centered on you must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d10} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spell.name: Righteous Fury
entries: You call a holy aura around yourself that glows golden red. You gain 20 temporary hit points and have advantage on attack rolls that you make with simple and martial weapons while the spell lasts. These temporary hit points are lost when the spell ends.

spell.name: Righteous Wrath of the Faithful
entries: You fire your allies and companions with divine fury. Choose up to four willing creatures you can see in range. For the duration, whenever one of those creatures takes the attack action, it can make one additional attack as part of that action.

spell.name: Ring of Blades
entries: You conjure forth a ring of swirling metal blades in a 10-foot radius sphere centered on you, which moves with you. When a creature other than you enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 5d6} slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Ruin Delver's Fortune

time.condition: which you take when you fail an ability check or saving throw

entries: With a desperate word, you imbue yourself with a bit of extra luck when you need it most. For the duration of the spell, you gain a bonus to the ability check or saving throw that triggered this spell equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. This bonus applies to the triggering roll.

spell.name: Rust Ray
entries: You unleash a russet ray at an object you can see in range. If the object is made of nonmagical metal and is not being worn or carried, a 1-foot cube of it is destroyed. If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, nothing happens. On a failed save, the item begins to corrode. If the object is either metal armor or a metal shield, it takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. If the object is a held metal weapon, it takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage tolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. If the target is any other kind of object, it takes 10 force damage, ignoring the damage threshold of the target.

components.m: a piece of a rust monster antenna

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the penalty for weapons, armor and shields increases by -1 and the damage to other objects increases by 10 for every two slot levels above 1st.

spell.name: Sacred Haven
entries: You shield one willing creature with a nimbus of holy energy, granting it a +2 bonus to AC. In addition, you gain an awareness of the target's health and location. For the duration, you are aware of the direction and distance to the creature so long as it is on the same plane of existence and know any conditions affecting them. These benefits last for the duration or until you cast this spell again.
While the spell lasts, you can use a bonus action to immediately teleport the target to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you, provided it is on the same plane of existence as you.

spell.name: Safe Clearing
entries: You ward a 15-foot radius sphere, centered on a point you can see in range, against attack. The area is dimly lit by tiny glittering motes reminiscent of fireflies. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets a creature in the area with an attack or harmful spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target outside the area or lose the attack or spell. A  creature has disadvantage on its saving throw if it is in the area. This spell doesn't protect the warded creatures from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball. If a warded creature makes an attack, casts a spell that affects an enemy creature, or deals damage to another creature, they are no longer warded by the safe clearing and may be attacked normally.
The area lasts for the duration or until you use an action to end the spell early.

spell.name: Salt Ray
entries: A thin shaft of whirling salt crystals lances out from your crooked finger to strike and shred a creature you can see in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d8} slashing damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is also {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Sandblast
entries: Whipping your hand in a wide arc, you spray sand from your fingers in a powerful blast. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d6} piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, a creature that fails its saving throw is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute or until it uses an action to clear its eyes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Sarcophagus of Stone
entries: The ground shakes as stone erupts around a Large or smaller creature or object you can see in range, taking the form of a sarcophagus that snaps shut around them. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be entombed. While entombed, the target is {@condition restrained} and has total cover from other creatures.
The sarcophagus is airtight and only just large enough to hold the target, containing 1 hour worth of air. The sarcophagus is an object with an AC of 17, 50 hit points and a damage threshold of 5.

spell.name: Scatterspray
entries: Choose a small collection of up to six objects in range that aren't being worn or carried, each of which must weigh less than 1 pound. Each object flies up to 30 feet in a direction you choose before falling to the ground, stopping only if it impacts against a solid surface. If the object would strike a creature, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the object strikes the target and stops moving. When the object strikes something, both the object and the target each take {@damage 1d4} piercing damage.
Each of the six objects may fly in different directions or the same.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may target two additional objects for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Scintillating Scales
entries: Your skin glistens and shimmers with a silvery protective aura reminiscent of scales. For the duration, your armor class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your spellcasting ability modifier so long as you are not wearing any armor.

spell.name: Scintillating Sphere
entries: A tiny sphere streaks from your fingers to a point you can see in range, trailing the smell of ozone, and detonates into a burst of spherical lightning. Each creature and object not being worn or carried in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 8d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Scorch
entries: A jet of roaring flame bursts from your outstretched hand in a 30 foot long, 5 foot wide line in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 3d10} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The flames ignite flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Scourge
entries: You choose up to three creatures you can see in range, causing their bodies to erupt with painful and debilitating boils, lesions, seeping abscesses and malignant cysts. Each target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 10d6} necrotic damage and is infected with a magical disease, reducing its Strength and Dexterity scores by {@dice 2d6}. The reduction caused by this spell lasts until the disease is cured. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and suffers no additional effects.

While it is infected, a target must make a Constitution saving throw at the start of each day. On a failed save, the target has its Strength and Dexterity reduced by an additional {@dice 1d6}. The disease lasts until the target succeeds on three of these saves or until it reaches 0 Strength or Dexterity, at which point the target dies.
This spell has no effect on Undead or Constructs.

components.m: a black whip or riding crop

spell.name: Sensory Deprivation
entries: You surround a foe with a black aura, creating an illusion of absolute nothingness. Choose one creature that you can see within range to make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, the target is surrounded in dark, clinging shadows for the duration. The shadows block all auditory, olfactory, taste and visual sensations, leaving the target {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened}. In addition, the target gains no benefit from blindsight or {@sense Tremorsense|XPHB} and automatically fails Perception checks based on scent.

components.m: black silk cloth tied like a blindfold

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Serene Visage
entries: You imbue yourself with an ethereal quality, inducing others to trust what you say. For the duration, you have a +5 bonus to Charisma (Deception) and Charisma (Persuasion) checks.

spell.name: Servant Horde
entries: This spell creates a number of {@condition invisible}, mindless, shapeless forces that perform simple tasks at your command. Each servant springs into existence in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. A servant has AC 10, 1 hit point, and a Strength of 2, and it can't attack. If a servant drops to 0 hit points, the servant dissipates. The spell ends when your last servant dissipates or you cast this spell again.

Once on each of your turns as a bonus action, you can mentally command any number of servants to move up to 15 feet and interact with an object. A servant can perform simple tasks that a human servant could do, such as fetching things, cleaning, mending, folding clothes, lighting fires, serving food, and pouring wine. Once you give the command, a servant performs the task to the best of its ability until it completes the task, then waits for your next command.
If you command a servant to perform a task that would move it more than 300 feet away from you, the servant dissipates.

components.m: a small crossbar to which many lengths of knotted thread are attached

spell.name: Shadow Binding
entries: You cause a multitude of ribbonlike shadows to explode outward in a 15-foot radius sphere centered on a point you can see in range. Each creature in the area must make an Intelligence saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d6} psychic damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of your next turn on a failed save, or takes half as much damage and is not {@condition incapacitated} on a successful one.

In addition, each creature that fails its saving throw is {@condition restrained} by the shadows for the duration. A creature {@condition restrained} by the shadows can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

components.m: a few links of iron chain

spell.name: Shadow Form
entries: Shadows rise from the ground to envelop you, lightly obscuring whatever space you are in for the duration. In addition, you have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) and Dexterity (Acrobatics) skill checks. Standing in an area of sunlight suppresses this spell until you leave the area.

As an action while the spell lasts, you can slip through a solid object or barrier up to 5 feet thick, taking up to 1 willing creature you touch with you. Once you have done so a number of times equal to your spellcasting modifier, the spell ends.

components.m: a small piece of black cloth taken from a funeral shroud

spell.name: Shadow Landscape
entries: You infuse the nearby landscape with power siphoned from the Shadowfell, making the surrounding terrain a more savage, dangerous place. The terrain in a 1-mile radius centered on the location where you cast this spell is affected for the duration.

The entire area becomes considerably more dangerous (Light undergrowth becomes wild and filled with thorns, cliffs become slippery and treacherous, canopies of rotting leaves block the sun, etc). The entire area is considered difficult terrain and all Wisdom (Survival) checks are made with disadvantage. In addition, any rolls for random weather or environmental hazards are made twice, with the more severe option being chosen. When you initially cast this spell, you may designate any number of creatures to be immune to these effects. Any shadow guardians are also immune to these effects.

You can call forth shadow guardians so long as you remain in the area. As an action, you can call forth up to four beasts of challenge rating 2 or lower. These guardians are fey spirits that take the form of beasts and appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. A shadow guardian disappears when it drops to 0 hit points, when the spell ends, or 1 hour after being summoned. The shadow guardians are friendly to you and your companions. The shadow guardians take their own turns as a group, immediately after you in initiative. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions. The shadow guardians will not leave the area and disappear immediately if something forces them to leave. The GM has the creatures' statistics. You can only summon shadow guardians once every hour.
If you concentrate on this spell for the full duration, the land becomes permanently tainted by contact with the Shadowfell and the effects last until dispelled.

spell.name: Shadow Phase
entries: You touch a willing creature, temporarily transposing some of their body with shadow-stuff and causing their flesh to take on a wispy, insubstantial appearance. For the duration, the target has resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing and Slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

spell.name: Shadow Mask
entries: You cause a protective mask of shadows to form around your face. For the duration, sunlight and bright light cannot impose disadvantage on your Perception checks or attack rolls. In addition, you have advantage on rolls against a spell or magical effect that requires you to see the source (such as a Medusa's petrifying gaze).

spell.name: Shadow Radiance
entries: You create a blast of bright light, filling a 20-foot radius sphere centered on a point in range. While the spell lasts, each creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make an Intelligence saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn.

spell.name: Shadow Spray
entries: As you finish casting this spell, ribbonlike shadows burst outward in the midst of your foes. Each creature in a 5-foot radius sphere centered on a point you can see in range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. In addition, on a failed save, a target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken.

spell.name: Shadow Well
entries: You create a well of shadows, which transforms your foe's own shadow into a miniature gateway into the Shadowfell. Each creature in a 10-foot radius sphere centered on a point you can see in range must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be drawn into its own shadow and become trapped in its own pocket realm within the Shadowfell. Inside a pocket realm, a target is {@condition incapacitated} and sees a deserted, gloomy duplicate of the real world, where shadowy phantasms stalk and taunt them without causing actual harm.
A target remains in the pocket realm until the spell ends, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

spell.name: Shadowy Grappler
entries: You create a spectral force, which appears as an intangible shadow being beside you. When you cast this spell, and as a bonus action on subsequent turns, you can choose a creature you can see in range. At the start of each of the current target's turns, they must make an Intelligence saving throw as the shadow being rushes them. On a failed save, they are knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition restrained}. As an action, a creature {@condition restrained} by a shadow being can attempt an Intelligence saving throw. On a successful save, the target is no longer {@condition restrained}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you create one additional shadow being, which can target the same or different creatures, for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Shard Storm
entries: You choose a point you can see in range, causing translucent shards of arcane energy to blast outward in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on that point and filling the air with the chiming sound of shattering glass. When you cast this spell, and at the start of each of your turns while the spell lasts, each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 8d6} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.
At the start of your turn, you may suppress the storm for 1 round, no action required. When you do so, it deals no damage until the start of your next turn.

components.m: a small shard of glass or crystal

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Shatterfloor
entries: You create a loud, thrumming vibration that builds to a painful crescendo before fading. Each creature and object in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you can see in range must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes {@damage 6d6} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. In addition, if the floor of the area is made of stone or any softer material, the floor is pulverized to a depth of six inches. The resulting area is considered difficult terrain until properly cleared.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

components.m: a miniature hammer and a bell

spell.name: Sheltered Vitality
entries: You touch a willing creature, imbuing them with a warm, protective glow. For the duration, the target cannot gain levels of {@condition exhaustion} and cannot have its ability scores or maximum hit points reduced.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Shield of Faith, Mass
entries: A shimmering field appears and surrounds each creature of your choice within range, granting them a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.

components.m: A small parchment with a bit of holy text written on it

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Shield of Warding
entries: You touch a nonmagical shield. Until the spell ends, a creature gains a +1 bonus to Armor Class while wielding that shield.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the bonus increases to +2. When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the bonus increases to +3.

spell.name: Shieldbearer
entries: You touch a shield and point to a creature you can see within range. For the duration, the shield floats in the air and follows the target around, attempting to protect them from harm. The shield acts immediately after you in initiative and can move up to 30 feet in a round, ignoring difficult terrain. The shield can occupy the same space as another creature without hindering that creature. While in the same space as the target, the target gains the benefit of wielding a shield, even if their hands are full or they are not normally proficient with shields.

spell.name: Shifting Paths
entries: The path before you becomes shrouded in shadows and false underbrush, even as a new path appears in a direction you designate, wandering off in a different direction. While the spell lasts, the path you are following is covered in an illusory veil, as well as any tracks or other signs of passage left by you or any creature of your choice within 30 feet of you.

Meanwhile, an illusory trail continues from the point where you cast this spell in the direction you indicated to the limit of the spell's range, where it ends abruptly. The illusory path avoids minor obstacles and provides no bridges, ladders, stairs, or other means of traversing such obstacles. If the path reaches a large obstacle, such as a ravine or deep river, it ends abruptly, but picks up again on the other side directly across from where it left off provided the maximum range is not exceeded.
A creature that spends at least 10 minutes closely examining the illusory trail can make an Intelligence saving throw, seeing through the illusion on a success.

spell.name: Shock and Awe
entries: You blast a creature you can see in range with a sudden, impressive jolt of electricity . The target must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} lightning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, if the target fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it is {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. A creature {@condition frightened} by this spell can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Shroud of Undeath
entries: You shroud yourself with necromantic energy, causing Undead to recognize you as one of their own. While the spell lasts, Undead creatures with an Intelligence score of 3 or lower perceive you as a fellow Undead creature, completely ignoring you. In addition, you have advantage on Charisma checks while interacting with Undead creatures with an Intelligence score of 4 or greater. The spell ends if you make an attack or cast a spell that affects an enemy Undead.

components.m: dust or bone fragments from any undead creature

spell.name: Silent Portal
entries: You touch a single portal (door, window, gate, drawer, chest lid, and so on), which can be no larger than 10 feet in any dimension, negating any sounds it would make from being opened for the duration. Silent portal only covers normal and nonmagical means of opening or closing the portal. Breaking a window, kicking a door in or casting a spell such as knock still makes noise, but opening a door that is falling off its hinges does not. The spell lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action.
Portals composed of magical energy are not affected by this spell.

spell.name: Sink
entries: You cause a creature to lose its natural buoyancy, so that it sinks like a stone in water or liquids of similar density. A creature you see in range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be affected by this spell for the duration. While affected by this spell, the target must succeed on a Strength (Athletics) check each round (the DC is your spell save DC) or else begin to sink. The target sinks at a rate of 60 feet each round.
If the target has a swim speed, its swim speed is reduced by half (to a minimum of 5 feet). A creature can choose to willingly fail its save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Sirine's Grace
entries: You infuse yourself with an unearthly grace and confidence. For the duration, you have advantage on Charisma and Dexterity checks and your base AC becomes 10 + your Charisma modifier + your Dexterity modifier while you are not wearing armor. In addition, you gain a swim speed of 60 feet and the ability to breathe water.

spell.name: Skeletal Guard
entries: You scatter your bag of fingerbones on the ground, causing animate skeletons to spring up where they land. You create up to four skeletal guards, each in an unoccupied space you can see in range. These creatures use the Skeletal Guard stat block. A skeletal guard crumbles to dust when it drops to 0 hit points or the spell ends.

The skeletal guards are friendly to you and your companions and act immediately after you in initiative. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.

m.text: a bag of fingerbones, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Slashing Darkness
entries: You create four ribbons of pure darkness and hurl them at creatures within range. You can hurl them at one target or several. Make a ranged spell attack for each ribbon aimed at a non-Undead creature. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage. For each ribbon aimed at an Undead creature, the target regains {@dice 1d6} hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you create one additional ribbon for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Slide
entries: Choose a willing creature you can see in range. You can move the target up to five feet in any direction into an unoccupied space.
The maximum distance you can move a target increases by 5 feet when you reach 5th level (10 feet), 11th level (15 feet), and 17th level (20 feet).

spell.name: Slime Wave
entries: You summon a wave of green slime that violently splatters forward from you in a line 60 feet long and 15 feet wide in a direction you choose. Each creature and object in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 12d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Each creature or object damaged by the initial wave takes an additional {@damage 1d6} acid damage at the end of each of its turns for the duration. A creature can use an action to scrape the slime off a target, ending the effect for that target.

The wave spreads around walls and corners, coating walls and ceilings and lasting until the spell ends, at which point the slime evaporates. Any creature that comes into contact with the slime (typically by moving into the affected area) is subject to the ongoing damage as though they had been damaged by the initial wave.
The slime deals no damage to creatures or objects made entirely out of stone.

components.m: a few drops of stagnant pond water

spell.name: Smell of Fear
entries: You brush a hand against a creature, bestowing upon it an aura which attracts predatory animals. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected for the duration. While affected, any Beast with Intelligence of 3 or lower is hostile towards the target. Hostile Beasts prefer to attack the subject over other creatures and have advantage on all attack rolls made against the target.

spell.name: Snake's Swiftness
entries: You indicate a target to a friendly creature, both of which must be in range. The friendly creature may immediately use its reaction to make a single melee or ranged attack against the target.

components.m: a few scales from a snake

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may choose one additional friendly creature to make an attack for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Snakebite
entries: One of your arms transforms into a venomous snake with a fanged maw for the duration. You can't hold items in your transformed hand. This snake can be used to make unarmed strikes at targets up to 10 feet away, using either Strength or Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls. The snake deals {@damage 1d6} + your Strength or Dexterity modifier piercing damage plus {@damage 4d4} poison damage on a hit.

spell.name: Solipsism
entries: You manipulate the senses of one creature you can see in range so that it perceives itself to be the only real creature in all of existence and everything around it to be merely an illusion. The target must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or be affected for the duration.

While affected, the target is {@condition incapacitated}, has disadvantage on saving throws and any attack rolls against it have advantage. Whenever the target takes damage, it may make an Intelligence saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

spell.name: Songbird
entries: You lace your next performance with trace amounts of magic, subtly improving your results. The next time you make a Charisma (Performance) check, you gain advantage on that check and the spell ends. In addition, while the  spell lasts, you can perfectly imitate the sound of any Beast you have heard before.

spell.name: Sonic Blast
entries: The words of your spell twist upon each other and grow stronger. Then, they streak toward a creature or object you can see in range and detonate in a screaming bellow. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d10} thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. In addition, if the target fails its save by 5 or more, it is also {@condition deafened} for one minute. A creature {@condition deafened} in this way may make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Sonic Rumble
entries: You create a deep, rumbling hum as loud as the din of a battlefield, which blasts out from you in a 30-foot cone and lingers in the area for the duration. Each creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d10} thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} until the start of its next turn on a failed save, or half as much damage and is not {@condition deafened} on a successful one.

components.m: a hollow cone of brass and gold worth 50 gp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Sonic Snap
entries: You create a brief but powerful burst of sound centered on a creature you can see in range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d8} thunder damage and be {@condition deafened} until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d8}), 11th level ({@dice 3d8}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Sonic Whip
entries: A whip of hissing blue energy appears in your hand. This magic whip lasts until the spell ends. It counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. It deals {@damage 3d6} thunder damage on a hit and has the finesse and reach properties. In addition, as a bonus action on your turn you can crack the whip. When you do, each Beast with an Intelligence score of 3 or lower within 30 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn.
If you drop the weapon, it dissipates at the end of the turn. Thereafter, while the spell lasts, you can use a bonus action to cause the whip to reappear in your hand.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Sonorous Hum
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Sound Lance
entries: You unleash a projectile of intense sonic energy at a creature or object you can see in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d8} thunder damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Spark of Life
entries: You outline an Undead creature you touch with a faint glow. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, which it can choose to fail. On a failed save, the target's creature type changes to the creature type it possessed before it became Undead. If it was never alive, the DM chooses an appropriate creature type.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may target up to two additional Undead creatures for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Speechlink
entries: You forge a telepathic bond with a willing creature. While this bond lasts, you and the target can telepathically communicate over any distance, provided you are both on the same plane of existence. You do not need to both share a common language. Creatures with Intelligence scores of 2 or less aren't affected by this spell.

spell.name: Spell Engine
entries: When you cast this spell, or as an action while the spell lasts, you and any number of creatures of your choice in a 30-foot radius sphere centered on you can swap out any or all of their prepared spells for other spells that they can prepare.

m.text: a disk of polished bone, one of your tears, and a silver wheel worth 100 gp

spell.name: Spell Immunity
entries: At your touch, silvery motes of light begin to snow down on a willing creature of your choice in range. While the spell lasts, the next time that creature is targeted by, or included in the area of effect of, a spell of 2nd level or lower, that spell has no effect on the target. Once the target has been protected from another spell, this spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the triggering spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.

spell.name: Spell Vulnerability
entries: A violet spray springs from your fingertips and wraps around a creature you can see in range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or gain vulnerability to one of the following damage type of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. If the target has resistance to that damage type, it loses that resistance instead for the duration. If the target is immune to that damage type, this spell has no effect on it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Sphere of Ultimate Destruction
entries: You conjure a featureless black sphere of nothingness that utterly destroys anything it touches. The sphere appears in a space you can see in range. Any creature that enters the same space as the sphere for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d6 + 40} force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The target is disintegrated if this damage leaves it with 0 hit points. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell. On each of your turns after you cast this spell, you can use an action to move the sphere up to 60 feet in any direction.

If the sphere enters the same space as a large or smaller nonmagical object or a creation of magical force (such as the wall created by wall of force) the target is automatically disintegrated. If the target is a huge or larger object or creation of force, a 5-foot-cube portion of it is disintegrated instead. A magic item is unaffected by this spell.

components.m: a pinch of dust from a disintegrated creature

spell.name: Spider Curse
entries: You transform a creature you can see in range into a spider-like monstrosity that obeys your mental commands. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be transformed for the duration. The spell ends early if the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. While transformed, the target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of a drider (the GM has the creatures' statistics). The target assumes the hit points of its new form. When it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked {@condition unconscious}.
The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech.

The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment. The target can only use actions from its new stat block if it is provided the proper equipment to do so (such as longbow or longsword attacks)

While the creature is transformed, it is {@condition charmed} by you and has a telepathic link to you. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands to the creature while you are conscious (no action required), which it does its best to obey. You can specify a simple and general course of action, such as "Attack that creature," "Run over there," or "Fetch that object." If the creature completes the order and doesn't receive further direction from you, it defends and preserves itself to the best of its ability. Each time the target takes damage, it makes a new Wisdom saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 7th-level spell slot, the duration is {@status Concentration|XPHB}, up to 10 minutes. When you use a 8th-level spell slot, the duration is {@status Concentration|XPHB}, up to 1 hour. When you use a spell slot of 9th level or higher, the duration is {@status Concentration|XPHB}, up to 8 hours.

spell.name: Spiderskin
entries: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, causing their skin to become tougher and more like carapace. The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier. In addition, the target ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing and can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down and on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check. The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.

spell.name: Spirit Worm
entries: You create a lingering decay in the spirit and body of a creature you can see in range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become infected for the duration. While infected, the target cannot regain hit points and takes {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

components.m: a piece of fire-blackened ivory or bone carved in the shape of a segmented worm

spell.name: Spiritjaws
entries: A massive set of ghostly dinosaur jaws appears and attacks a creature you can see in range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d6} force damage and is {@condition grappled} by the jaws if it is Large-sized or smaller. A creature can use an action to attempt to break free from the jaws (escape DC is your spell save DC). At the end of each of its turns while {@condition grappled}, the target takes an additional {@damage 2d6} force damage.

components.m: a piece of bone from a dinosaur's jaw

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4tf level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd and the ongoing damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Spiritual Chariot
entries: You summon a large and ornate chariot made of transparent, faintly glowing azure energy in an unoccupied space you can see in range. When you cast this spell, you must choose one willing creature to be properly harnessed to it. The chariot is made of force and weighs nothing. The chariot has enough room to hold one Medium creature or two Small creatures in addition to the driver. The creature harnessed to the chariot can end the spell early as an action. If the target has a flying speed, the chariot stays upright behind them.

spell.name: Spiritwall
entries: You create a an immobile, swirling mass of greenish-white forms resembling tortured spirits. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d8} necrotic damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. A creature that passes through the wall or ends its turn inside the wall takes {@damage 6d8} necrotic damage.

One side of the wall, selected by you when you cast this spell, emits a low groaning, which can be heard up to 30 feet away by creatures on that side of the wall. Whenever a creature enters the area for the first time in a turn or starts its turn there it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the wall for the duration. A creature {@condition frightened} of the wall can repeat this saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
Undead and Constructs are unaffected by this spell and can pass through the wall unhindered.

m.text: a clear cut gemstone

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Splinterbolt
entries: You launch two javelin-sized shards of wood at targets you can see in range. You can launch them at one target or several. Make a ranged spell attack for each shard. On a hit, a target takes {@damage 2d10} piercing damage. You may choose a Large-sized or larger tree as the origin point instead of yourself. If you do so, both the tree and the target must both be within range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you create one additional shard for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Stalking Brand
entries: At your touch, you cause a tiny mark to appear on a creature you can see. The tiny mark appears in a location of your choice and is visible only to you or by someone with the ability to detect magic. You choose what the mark looks like when you cast this spell, which can be no larger than 1 inch in diameter. You can see the brand even if the subject uses magical means to change or hide its appearance.

spell.name: Stalwart Pact
entries: You create a bond between a willing creature and a greater power, which provides a measure of protection when the need is dire. Once before the spell ends, if the target is reduced to fewer than half of their maximum hit points, the pact activates. When the pact activates, the target immediately gains 25 temporary hit points and has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons for one minute. The pact can only be activated once before the spell ends. The spell ends immediately if you cast it again.

m.text: powdered silver worth 1000 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Standing Wave
entries: You command the waters to lift a willing creature or object you can see in range and propel it forward. An object so lifted may contain creatures or other objects. The target is lifted up to 20 feet above the water surface and is propelled at a speed of 60 feet in a straight line at the end of each of your turns. When you cast this spell, or as a bonus action on your turn, you may choose the direction the target will be propelled in. When the target reaches land, the waters harmlessly lower the target and the spell ends. The target may be up to Medium size.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a higher level spell slot, the maximum size increases: Large with a 5th-level slot, Huge with a 7th-level slot, Gargantuan with a 9th-level slot.

spell.name: Starvation
entries: When you cast this spell, and at the beginning of each of your turns for the duration, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes {@damage 6d10} necrotic damage and suffers one level of {@condition exhaustion} on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once the target has made three successful saving throws against this spell, the spell ends. When this spell ends, all levels of {@condition exhaustion} caused by this spell go away.

spell.name: Steeldance
entries: You cause a pair of daggers to grow to the size and shape of longswords, appearing in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. The swords use the statistics of flying swords (the GM has the creature's statistics) with the following change: each of the swords uses your spellcasting ability modifier for their to hit and damage rolls. A sword crumbles to dust when it drops to zero hit points or when the spell ends.

The swords are friendly to you and your companions and take their turns immediately after you in initiative. They obey verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.
As a bonus action while the spell lasts, you can touch up to two daggers to transmute them into additional swords. You can have a maximum of two swords at a time.

m.text: a pair of daggers, which the spell consumes

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the maximum number of swords you can control at one time increases by 1 for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Steam Vent
entries: You draw upon the power of steaming volcanic vents, creating a 15-foot-radius sphere of boiling steam at a point you can see within range, which begins to roil away from you. The sphere spreads around corners and its area is heavily obscured. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes {@damage 4d6} fire damage and is {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn on a failed save, or half as much damage and is not {@condition blinded} on a successful one. A creature that fails its save by 5 or more is {@condition blinded} until it receives magical healing.
At the start of each of your turns while the spell lasts, the sphere moves 10 feet away from the location you were standing when you cast the spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Stick
entries: You affix one object weighing up to 5 pounds to another object. At the end of the duration the object falls loose. The bond is not particularly strong and the two items can be separated by even a small amount of force.

spell.name: Sticky Saddle
entries: A colorless glow surrounds you and your mount for an instant. When the glow fades, you feel more attentive to the movements of your mount, even while an unseen force holds you fast to it. For the duration, you cannot be dismounted as a result of being knocked {@condition prone} or as a result of involuntary movement from you or your mount. You may end this spell at any time, no action required.

spell.name: Sting Ray
entries: From your outstretched hand leaps forth a ray of glittering energy at a creature you can see in range, which appears to be composed of countless miniscule writhing insects. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d10} poison damage and must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is left with the lingering sensation of many tiny insects biting and crawling across their body. For the next minute, the target can't take reactions and has disadvantage on Constitution saves made to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB}. The target can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Stolen Breath
entries: You attempt to steal the air from the lungs of a creature you can see in range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be affected for the duration. While affected, the target cannot speak or cast spells that require verbal components. In addition, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
This spell has no effect on creatures that don't need to breathe.

spell.name: Stone Body
entries: Your flesh begins to stiffen and turn gray, as you transform your body into living stone. Until the spell ends, this transformation grants you several benefits:

items: While you are not wearing armor, your armor class becomes 17. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.
You gain 50 temporary hit points. If any of these remain when the spell ends, they are lost.
You are immune to any other spell or affect that would alter your form.
You have advantage on Constitution saving throws.
You have resistance to poison damage and resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine.

components.m: a piece of stone from an earth elemental or stone golem

spell.name: Stone Sphere
entries: You create a 5-foot-diameter sphere of stone, which appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range and lasts for the duration. The sphere has an AC of 17 and 500 hit points and weighs approximately 5 tons. As a bonus action, you can move the stone up to 30 feet. When you move the sphere, any creatures or objects in its path must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 7d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The sphere stops moving if it enters the space of a Large-sized or larger object, unless it deals enough damage to destroy the target.

components.m: a smooth sphere of marble1 inch in diameter

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
