entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Stonehold
entries: Choose up to 6 10-foot squares you can see in range. Each 10-foot square must include a surface of stone, dirt, sand or mud. Whenever a creature enters one of the areas for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition grappled} as several arms made of solid rock burst forth to seize the target. While {@condition grappled} by the arms, the target is also immobilized. A creature {@condition grappled} by the arms can use an action to attempt to break free (escape DC is your spell save DC).
Each 10-foot square can only hold one creature at a time. When you initially cast this spell, you may designate any number of creatures to be unaffected.

spell.name: Storm of Elemental Fury
entries: A roiling black storm cloud appears in the shape of a cylinder that is 10 feet tall with a 40-foot radius, centered on a point you can see within range. The spell fails if you can't see a point in the air where the storm cloud could appear (for example, if you are in a room that can't accommodate the cloud). As a bonus action, you may move the cloud up to 40 feet in any direction.

The area beneath the cloud is constantly buffeted by a swirling windstorm. Ranged attacks that pass into or out of the area have disadvantage and each creature that enters the area for the first time in a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. In addition, when you initially cast this spell, or at the start of your turn on subsequent rounds, you may choose one of the following effects:

items: {@b Fire.} Flames pelt the area beneath the storm cloud. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 12d8} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

{@b Earth.} Chunks of rock fall from the sky. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d8} bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. In addition, the rubble left behind is difficult terrain

{@b Water.} A deluge of rain extinguishes unprotected flames. Everything in the area is heavily obscured. In addition, a creature moving through the area must spend 4 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves.

spell.name: Storm Tower
entries: You form an enormous tower of dark, swirling storm clouds and howling wind. The tower appears as a 20-foot radius, 100-foot high cylinder centered on a point you can see in range. Each creature in the area is immune to lightning damage and ranged attacks that pass into or through the area automatically miss. The edge of the area provides heavy obscurement and the roaring winds prevent sounds from entering or leaving the area. In order to pass the edge of the area, a creature must use an action to attempt to push through the stormwall. When a Huge-sized or smaller creature does so, it must first succeed on a Strength saving throw or be stopped at the edge of the area. If it fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it is knocked {@condition prone}.

A creature that ends its turn within 10 feet of the outside of the wall must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d10} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

spell.name: Stormrage
entries: You harness the powers of wind and storm to move, protect yourself, and attack. For the duration, you have a flying speed of 40 feet, gain three-quarters cover against ranged attacks and are completely unaffected by natural or magical wind.

As an action once per round while the spell lasts, you can discharge a bolt of electricity from your eyes at a creature you can see within 120 feet. When you do so, make a ranged spell attack against the target, dealing {@damage 10d6} lightning damage on a hit.

spell.name: Stun Ray
entries: A quick jolt darts from your raised hand at a target you can see in range, leaving a lingering smell of ozone. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target is {@condition stunned} for the duration. A {@condition stunned} target can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends.

spell.name: Stunning Breath
entries: You exhale with a concussive force. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d8} thunder damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn on a failed save, or takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned} on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Submerge Ship
entries: You connect yourself to a Large-sized or larger water vehicle you can see in range until the spell ends. While you are riding the connected vessel, you extend your senses to see and hear anything that happens around the vehicle. In addition, you can command the ship to submerge as an action.

While the ship is submerged, it gains a swim speed equal to its normal sailing speed. You control the movement of the ship on your turn while submerged. All interior spaces of the ship remain dry, even if the doorway or porthole is open while the ship is underwater.

When the spell ends, the magic lingers for an additional 1 minute. During that time, the vehicle ascends towards the water's surface if it is still submerged, at a rate of 60 feet per round. When this additional time runs out, it immediately sinks if it is still submerged.

m.text: a miniature wooden rudder inlaid with silver, worth 2,500 gp

spell.name: Subvert Planar Essence
entries: Taking command of the forces that connect the material plane to all others, you disrupt the natural defenses of outsiders. Each Celestial, Elemental, Fey and Fiend in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on a point you can see in range must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or lose all resistances and immunities to damage for the duration.

components.m: a tuning fork made from cold iron

spell.name: Sudden Stalagmite
entries: You gesture towards a creature you can see in range, and a razor-sharp stalagmite immediately bursts from the ground at their feet to impale them. The target and any creatures up to 10 feet straight above their space must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 10d6} piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. In addition, a creature that fails its saving throw by five or more is impaled by the stalagmite and {@condition restrained}. A {@condition restrained} creature can use its action to break free with a Strength (Athletics) check against your spell save DC.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Surefooted Stride
entries: You make up to three willing creatures as surefooted as any mountain goat, which makes walking in even the most treacherous terrain child's play. For the duration, moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs a target no extra movements.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may target up to two additional creatures for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Suspended Silence
entries: You sprinkle a handful of gem dust on an object in range, readying a spell to be unleashed at a later time. When you initially cast this spell, choose a command word. Until the spell ends, if you speak the command word while within 60 feet of the target the stored magic is released.

When released, no sound can be created or pass through a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on the target, which moves with the target. Any creature or object entirely inside the sphere is immune to thunder damage, and creatures are {@condition deafened} while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a verbal component is impossible there. Once released, the area of silence lasts for one minute before the spell ends.

m.text: a feather and a handful of gem dust worth 50 gp, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Swamp Lung
entries: A sea-green halo forms around the head of a creature you can see in range. Moments later, the target's lungs begin to fill with fetid water. For the next minute, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw at the start of each of its turns or be {@condition incapacitated} until the start of its next turn. In addition, on a failed save the target contracts {@disease Sewer Plague} (see "Diseases", DMG ch. 8). If the target succeeds on three of these saves, the spell ends.
A creature that doesn't need to breathe or can breathe water is unaffected by this spell.

spell.name: Swamp Stride
entries: You gain the ability to enter a pool of water and move from inside it to inside another pool of water within 500 feet. Both pools of water must be at least large enough for you to fully submerge yourself. You must use 5 feet of movement to enter a pool. You instantly know the location of all other pools of water within 500 feet and, as part of the move used to enter the pool, can either pass into one of those pools or step out of the pool that you're in. You appear in a spot of your choice within 5 feet of the destination pool, using another 5 feet of movement. If you have no movement left, you appear within 5 feet of the pool you entered.
If you enter a single large body of water, you can instead use your movement to transport yourself 500 feet in any direction within the same body of water.
You can use this transportation ability once per round for the duration.

spell.name: Sword of Darkness
entries: A spectral blade of pale green force to appears at a point you can see in range, which lasts for the duration or until you cast this spell again. When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the weapon. On a hit, the target takes necrotic damage equal to {@dice 2d8} + your spellcasting ability modifier. In addition, the next time the target makes a saving throw in the next hour, it does so at disadvantage and the effect ends. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the sword up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every two slot levels above 5th. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the target's maximum hit points are reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

spell.name: Symbol of Spell Loss
entries: You trace a symbol that attacks the minds of spellcasters, either upon a surface (such as a table or a section of floor or wall) or within an object that can be closed (such as a book, a scroll, or a Treasure chest) to conceal the symbol. If you choose a surface, the symbol can cover an area of the surface no larger than 10 feet in diameter. If you choose an object, that object must remain in its place, if the object is moved more than 10 feet from where you cast this spell, the symbol is broken and the spell ends without being triggered. The symbol is nearly {@condition invisible} and requires a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC to be found.

You decide what triggers the symbol when you cast the spell. For symbols inscribed on a surface, the most typical triggers include touching or standing on the symbol, removing another object covering the symbol, approaching within a certain distance of the symbol, or manipulating the object on which the symbol is inscribed. For symbols inscribed within an object, the most common triggers include opening that object, approaching within a certain distance of the object, or seeing or reading the symbol. Once a symbol is triggered, this spell ends. You can further refine the trigger so the spell activates only under certain circumstances or according to physical characteristics (such as height or weight), creature kind (for example, the symbol could be set to affect Aberrations or drow), or alignment. You can also set conditions for creatures that don't trigger the symbol, such as those who say a certain password.

Once triggered, the symbol remains active for 10 minutes, attacking the minds of spellcasters in a 30-foot radius sphere centered on the symbol. Any character that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there is affected. An affected creature with the Spellcasting or Innate Spellcasting trait must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or else it loses the highest level spell slot they have available of 5th level or lower.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the highest level spell slot a target can lose increases by 1 for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Symphonic Nightmare
entries: You place a curse on a creature, haunting its sleep with nightmares of a discordant orchestra. Whenever the target attempts to take a long test it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or gain none of the benefits of a long rest. In addition, on a failed save, the target gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}. After succeeding on three of these saving throws, the creature breaks the curse and the spell ends.
The caster can end the curse early as an action. A creature that does not need to sleep is immune to this spell.

m.text: a small statue of an opened skull, within which is a miniature orchestra, worth at least 1,000 gp

spell.name: Tactical Precision
entries: You bond up to four willing creatures you can see in range together, granting them a greater understanding of one another's actions. For the duration, each bonded creature has a +2 bonus on melee attack rolls and deals an additional {@damage 1d8} damage with melee attacks against a creature if at least one of the other bonded allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the bonded ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Telepathic Aura
entries: You create an invisible psychic aura around yourself. For the duration, you can mentally communicate with any creature with an Intelligence score of 3 or higher within 120 feet of you. This communication is one way (you can send messages to creatures but they can't respond) and works whether or not you share a common language.

spell.name: Thunderhead
entries: Black mist forms near the ground and sweeps upward to join a small cloud forming above a creature you can see in range. Miniature peals of thunder erupt from the cloud, which moves with the target and follows it unerringly even if it becomes {@condition invisible} or leaves the area. At the start of each of the target's turns while the spell lasts, the target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 1d4} lightning damage as a miniature bolt of lightning leaps from the thundercloud to strike the target.
The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action.

components.m: a small piece of copper wire

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Thunderlance
entries: A gray, shimmering spear appears in your hand. This magic spear lasts until the spell ends. It counts as a simple melee weapon with which you are proficient. It deals {@damage 3d8} thunder damage on a hit and has the reach and thrown properties (range 20/60). In addition, when you use the spear to attack a target that is protected by a magical spell that increases its AC (such as shield or mage armor) of 3rd level or less, that spell ends (before resolving the attack roll).
If you drop the spear or throw it, it dissipates at the end of the turn. Thereafter, while the spell persists, you can cause the spear to reappear in your hand, no action required.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every two slot levels above 4th.

spell.name: Thunderous Roar
entries: Calling upon the lost voices of dead creatures, you fill a 20-foot radius sphere centered on a point you can see with the enraged roaring of a thousand dinosaurs. Each creature and object not being worn or carried in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 5d8} thunder damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has disadvantage on this saving throw. The roar can be heard for miles.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Tortoise Shell
entries: At your touch, a willing creature grows the armor plating of a tortoise across its torso and a tough, leathery skin elsewhere. For the duration, the target's base AC is 16 and its speed is reduced by 10 feet (to a minimum of 5 feet). The spell ends if the target dons armor or if you dismiss the spell as an action.
As long as the target is a Beast, it gains an additional +2 bonus to AC while the spell lasts.

spell.name: Touch of Madness
entries: You touch a living creature, clouding their mind. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. The target takes {@damage 3d8} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, if the target fails its save by 5 or more, it is {@condition incapacitated} until the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Transfix
entries: You create an area of enchantment in a 20-foot radius sphere centered on a point you can see in range, which can transfix any creature that enters it. Each Medium-sized or smaller creature that enters the area for the first time in a turn or starts its turn there must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed saving throw a target is {@condition charmed} for the duration. While {@condition charmed} by this spell, that creature is {@condition paralyzed}.

At the end of each hour, or whenever it takes any damage, an affected creature can make a Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If an affected creature is removed from the area, it is freed from the spell's effects.
Once a creature has successfully saved against this spell, it is unaffected by this casting of Transfix.

spell.name: Transmute Lava
entries: You transform a 10 foot cube of nonmagical material of any sort that you can see in range into an equal volume of red-hot molten lava. If the cube of lava is on a wall or ceiling, the lava flows down to the floor, spreading out in a 15-foot radius pool at the start of your next turn.

When you first cast this spell, any creature standing in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a success, that creature can move up to 5 feet into an unoccupied space adjacent to the area. Each creature or object that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there takes {@damage 20d6} fire damage.
The lava cools naturally as time passes, slowly reverting to stone. Each hour after being transformed, the area deals {@damage 1d6} less damage.

spell.name: Transposition
entries: Two creatures instantly teleport to the others current position. A solid object such as the ground, a bridge, or a rope must connect both targets. Both targets must be within range. Objects worn or carried by the target are teleported with them, but other creatures are not. An unwilling target may make a Wisdom save to resist this effect. If either target successfully saves, the spell fails and nothing happens.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the range of this spell increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 2nd. If you cast this spell at 5th level or higher, an unwilling creature has disadvantage on its Wisdom saving throw.

spell.name: Treasure Scent
entries: For the duration, you can sense the presence and location of copper, silver, gold, electrum, platinum and precious gems within 60 feet of you. You can also identify the different kinds of materials in each case.
The spell can penetrate barriers, but it is blocked by a thin sheet of lead.

spell.name: Tremorsense
entries: You touch a willing creature to grant it the ability to detect even the most subtle of vibrations. For the duration, that creature has {@sense Tremorsense|XPHB} out to a range of 60 feet.

components.m: a bit of skin from a bulette

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Triadspell
entries: Choose one spell you have prepared that is 3rd-level or lower with a casting time of an action or bonus action. As part of initially casting this spell, or as an action on your turn while the spell lasts, you may cast the chosen spell without expending a spell slot. Once you have cast the chosen spell three times, this spell ends.

spell.name: True Creation
entries: You create a nonmagical, unattended object of any sort of matter. The object created must be no larger than a 25-foot cube, and the object must be of a form and material that you have seen before. Objects created are permanent and can be used as spell components.

m.text: a tiny piece of the kind of matter you intend to create, which the spell consumes

spell.name: Tunnel Swallow
entries: You cause a section of tunnel, up to 20 feet wide and 50 feet long to flex with peristaltic convulsions, crushing contents and moving them along its length in the direction you designate. Each creature in the area must make a Strength saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 12d8} bludgeoning damage and is pushed up to 30 feet towards the end you designate on a failed save, or it takes half as much damage and is not pushed on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d8} for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Unbinding
entries: You release a burst of energy, which coalesces around a creature you can see in range. When you cast unbinding, all spells or magical effects that charm, paralyze, frighten, petrify, stun or restrain the target end and the target is immune to such spells for the duration. In addition, any magical barriers (such as wards or walls) do not impede the target and magical difficult terrain costs no additional movement. This does not prevent damage dealt by spells, even those that also impede movement.

components.m: a lodestone and a pinch of saltpeter

spell.name: Undead Bane Weapon
entries: You touch a nonmagical weapon. Until the spell ends, the weapon becomes a magic weapon, which deals an extra {@damage 2d6} damage to Undead.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Undead Lieutenant
entries: You designate one willing creature in range as your lieutenant, granting it a measure of command over the Undead in your control. For the duration, the target can give orders to any Undead under your direct control (such as those created by the animate dead spell). Any orders given by you supersede orders given by your lieutenant.
You may choose to end the spell early as an action.

spell.name: Undead Torch
entries: With a dark incantation, a willing Undead creature you can see in range bursts into blue flames, which shed dim light in a 20-foot radius. The flames do not harm the target, and any melee attacks it makes count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage and deal an additional {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage. Undead, Constructs and Elementals are unaffected by this additional damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Undersong
entries: A familiar and soothing song wells up in your mind, helping you to focus on the task at hand. For the duration, whenever you are forced to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain your {@status Concentration|XPHB}, you can instead make a Charisma (Performance) check instead.

spell.name: Unyielding Roots
entries: You touch a willing creature, causing thick tree roots to anchor it to the ground and provide it with life sustaining healing. For the duration, the creature has a speed of zero and can't benefit from any bonus to its speed. The target has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws and any attempts to move the creature against its will automatically fail. In addition, the target regains 30 hit points at the start of each of its turns and ends any poison or disease currently affecting it.
The creature must be touching the ground when the spell is cast to have an effect on it. This spell has no effect on Constructs or Undead.

spell.name: Updraft
entries: Detritus and loose debris on the ground beneath you begins to spin about, caught in a small vortex, which quickly coalesces into a column of dirty gray-brown air thick enough to hold you aloft. When you cast the spell, you are propelled up to 30 feet into the air, then gently float back down to the ground. While you descend, you can use any movement you have remaining to move horizontally. You take no falling damage on the turn you cast this spell.

spell.name: Valiant Fury
entries: You imbue a willing creature with a fighting spirit. For the duration, whenever the target takes the attack action on its turn, it can make one additional attack as part of that action.

spell.name: Veil of Shadow
entries: Swirling wisps of darkness obscure your form, surrounding you and obscuring you from foes. For the duration, you are lightly obscured.

spell.name: Vigorous Circle
entries: You bathe a 10-foot radius sphere, centered on a point you can see in range, with sacred light. Each creature that ends its turn in the area regains one hit point. You can end this spell early as an action.

spell.name: Vile Death

m.text: a bit of brimstone and a bloodstone worth 5000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You summon the spirit of a Fiend and bind it to the body of an Undead creature with a Challenge Rating of 3 or higher. The target permanently gains several benefits:

items: If the target has an Intelligence of less than 12, its Intelligence becomes 12.
The target gains resistance to cold damage as well as resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing from nonmagical attacks.
The target has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magic effects.
The target gains immunity to fire and poison damage.
The target is immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition.
The target has telepathy out to 120 feet.
The target gains {@sense darkvision|XPHB} out to 120 feet.
•The target gains the Fiend creature type in addition to its Undead creature type. It can be affected by any game effects that work on either of its creature types.

spell.name: Vine Mine
entries: You create an explosion of plant growth in a 10-foot radius sphere centered on a point you can see in range. When you cast this spell, choose one of the following effects:

items: {@b Climbing.} The vines form into convenient handholds and footholds throughout the entire area. Any creature can climb them as easily as a regular ladder.

{@b Binding.} The vines wrap themselves around anything in the area. Each creature that ends its turn in the area must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by the vines until the spell ends or you change the effect. A creature {@condition restrained} by the plants can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success it frees itself.
{@b Hindering.} The vines are thick and gnarled, turning the entire area into difficult terrain.
{@b Camouflage.} The vines sprout a thick cover of foliage. Any creature in the area is heavily obscured.

spell.name: Visage of the Deity
entries: You invoke the blessings of a divine being. For the duration, you grant a willing creature the following benefits:

items: The target gains resistance to acid, cold and lightning damage if they are Evil, or resistance to cold, fire and radiant damage if they are Good or Neutral.
The target can use Charisma instead of Strength or Dexterity for attack and damage rolls with weapon attacks.
The target gains {@sense darkvision|XPHB} out to a range of 60 feet.

spell.name: Viscid Glob
entries: You fling a small glob of viscous material at a Huge-sized or smaller creature you can see in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target is {@condition restrained} for the duration as the glob expands and dries on the target. A creature {@condition restrained} by this spell can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. Once it has succeeded on this check three times, the spell ends.
Applying a pint or more of alcohol can dissolve the glob instantly, as does Oil of Etherealness or Universal Solvent.

components.m: a tiny ball of spider silk

spell.name: Voice of the Dragon
entries: For the duration, you can speak and understand Draconic. In addition, any creature that can understand you and speaks with you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by you for the duration, or until you or any of your companions do anything harmful to it. A {@condition charmed} creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance. This spell has no effect on creatures you or your companions are fighting.

spell.name: Vortex of Teeth
entries: A huge school of transparent piranhas swirls rapidly through the air around a point you can see in range. The vortex creates a 40-foot radius, 20-foot high hollow cylinder with a 5-foot radius safe zone in the center. A creature takes {@damage 8d4} piercing damage when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Wail of Doom
entries: You unleash a terrible cry of malice and anger. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Wisdom saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 8d6} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, each creature that fails its save is {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. A creature {@condition frightened} by this spell can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect for itself on a success.
Whenever a hostile creature dies due to damage from this spell, each creature in a 5-foot radius sphere centered on that creature takes {@damage 2d6} psychic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Wall of Gears
entries: A massive wall made of machinery springs into existence, occupying ten contiguous five-foot squares that you can see in range. Each section is five feet wide, ten feet tall, and 6-inches thick, consisting of a mass of moving iron cogs, wheels, gears, pistons and assorted mechanical parts.

When you cast the spell, choose one of the following damage types: bludgeoning, piercing or slashing. When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d6} damage of the chosen type, or half as much on a successful save. If a creature would be surrounded on all sides by the wall (or the wall and another solid surface), that creature can use its reaction to move up to its speed so that it is no longer enclosed by the wall on a successful save. Each creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the wall takes {@damage 6d6} damage of the chosen type. As a bonus action, you can change the type of damage the wall deals.

Each five-foot square has an AC of 19 and 20 hit points. If a section of the wall is reduced to 0 hit points, it is destroyed and no longer impedes movement in that space. At the end of each of your turns, destroyed sections of the wall regenerate.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Wall of Gloom
entries: You create a wall of dark shadows to appear. You can make the wall up to 40 feet long, 10 feet high and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 15 feet in diameter, 10 feet high and 1 foot thick. The wall is opaque, blocking all light from passing through it, and lasts for the duration. Dark whispers constantly issue forth from the wall, making any speech heard from the opposite side of the wall to be completely unintelligible.

The wall is insubstantial, so creatures can move through it freely. The first time a creature moves through the wall in a turn or starts its turn in the same space as the wall, it takes {@damage 4d4} psychic damage.

components.m: a bit of fleece from a black sheep

spell.name: Wall of Limbs
entries: You conjure forth a writhing mass, which rises up and forms a wall comprised of thousands of wriggling arms. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick. The wall provides total cover, though creatures can move through the wall, treating it as difficult terrain.

Each creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the wall or attempts to pass through the wall for the first time on a turn must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 5d8} bludgeoning damage, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, if a creature attempting to pass through the wall fails its saving throw, it is caught by the grasping arms and is {@condition restrained} until the spell ends. A creature that starts its turn in the area and is already {@condition restrained} by the arms takes {@damage 5d8} bludgeoning damage.
A creature {@condition restrained} by the arms can use its action to make a Strength or Dexterity check (its choice) against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Wall of Smoke
entries: With a wave of your hands, black smoke swirls into existence as a dark wall. You can make the wall up to 30 feet long, 10 feet high and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 10 feet in diameter, 10 feet high and 1 foot thick. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

The area is heavily obscured and any creature that enters the area for the first time in a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature {@condition poisoned} by the wall may make a Constitution save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

spell.name: War Cry
entries: You let loose a victorious cry, inspiring panic in your enemies. The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, the attack deals an extra {@damage 2d6} damage to the target. Additionally, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} of you for 1 minute. While this spell lasts, you deal an additional {@damage 1d6} psychic damage to any creature you hit with a weapon attack that is {@condition frightened} of you.
A creature {@condition frightened} by this spell makes a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, it is no longer {@condition frightened}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Waterspout
entries: You cause water to rise up into a whirling, 5-foot radius, 80-foot tall cylinder centered on a point you can see in range, which must contain a body of water at least 10 feet wide and 20 feet deep. Any object that isn't being worn or carried or any creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn in the area of the waterspout must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 10d6} bludgeoning damage and, if it is Large or smaller, is carried to the top of the waterspout before being thrown out the top to land {@condition prone} 10 feet away in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll a {@dice d8} and assign a direction to each die face. On a successful save, a creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet to any side of the waterspout. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw.

As a bonus action, you may move the waterspout up to 30 feet horizontally. When the waterspout moves into the space of a creature or object, that creature or object must make a saving throw as if it had ended its turn in the waterspout's area. A creature can only be affected by the waterspout once each time you move it.

spell.name: Wave of Grief
entries: Emitting a mournful wail, you send out a pulse of magic imbued with sorrow and sadness in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the cone must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks for the duration. Undead and creatures immune to being {@condition charmed} aren't affected by this spell.

spell.name: Weapon Shift
entries: You touch the weapon used in casting this spell, transforming it into a different nonmagic simple or martial melee weapon of your choice. The new weapon must be composed of the same materials as the original weapon. You may end the spell early during your turn, no action required. The weapon transforms back when the spell ends. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three transformed weapons active at a time.

m.text: one nonmagic melee weapon worth at least 1 cp

spell.name: Weather Eye
entries: You accurately predict the natural weather that will occur over the next week in a 1-mile radius sphere centered on you. If the current weather is unnatural (such as the result of a spell or other magical effect), you become aware of this, though gain no other information on the cause.

components.m: a bowl, mirror, crystal ball, or other scrying device

spell.name: Whirling Blade
entries: You hurl the weapon used to cast this spell, which continues whirling forward in a 5-foot wide, 60-foot long line. Make a single melee spell attack against each creature in the line. On a hit, the creature takes the weapon's normal damage dice + your spellcasting ability modifier damage. The weapon automatically returns to your hand after reaching the end of the line.

m.text: a melee weapon worth at least 1 sp

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Wind at Back
entries: You intone words that will give you and up to six other willing creatures speed and stamina for the long journey ahead. This spell doubles the overland travel speed of all targets, so long as they are all traveling together in the same direction. This spell has no effect in combat.

spell.name: Wind Tunnel
entries: You evoke the powers of the sky, and the wind picks up around you. It blows from your back, wrapping itself around your allies' missiles, sending them to their targets more surely. When you cast this spell, choose up to five willing creatures. For the duration, their ranged weapon attacks have advantage, and their normal and long ranges are each doubled.

spell.name: Winter Chill
entries: With the sound of whirling wind, you will a frigid air to overcome your foe. A creature you can see in range must make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes {@damage 2d8} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If the target fails its save by 5 or more, it also gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}. Levels of {@condition exhaustion} caused by this spell go away after one hour. A creature that has resistance or immunity to cold damage cannot gain levels of {@condition exhaustion} from this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Winter's Embrace
entries: You clutch the air as though grabbing a nearby creature, then blow on your fist. As you do so, ice and snow appear around a creature you can see in range. When you cast this spell, or as a bonus action on subsequent turns you can force the target to make a Constitution saving throw. The target takes {@damage 4d8} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If the target fails its save by 5 or more, it also gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}. Levels of {@condition exhaustion} caused by this spell go away when the spell ends. A creature that has resistance or immunity to cold damage cannot gain levels of {@condition exhaustion} from this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Wither Limb
entries: You attempt to wither the limbs of a creature you can see in range. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be affected for the duration. When you cast this spell, choose one of the following options:

items: {@b Arms.} The affected creature cannot use objects (including using weapons) or cast spells with somatic components. The target drops anything it was holding when the spell was cast.
{@b Legs.} The affected creature falls {@condition prone} and is unable to stand up while the spell lasts. The target's speed is reduced by 10 feet.
{@b Wings.} The affected creature loses the use of its wings. If it has a fly speed requiring the use of its wings, its fly speed is reduced to 0.

entries: The target suffers no negative effects from this spell if it does not possess the chosen limbs. When the spell ends, the withered limbs return to normal. An affected creature can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

spell.name: Withering Palm
entries: Make a melee weapon attack against a creature in range. If the attack hits, the target takes {@damage 10d10} necrotic damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target's Strength and Dexterity scores are reduced by {@dice 1d10}. The target dies if this reduces either of those scores to 0. Otherwise, this reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. If the target fails its save by 5 or more, the reduction lasts indefinitely.

spell.name: Word of Binding
entries: You speak a word of power, as a set of shining steel manacles appear around the wrists and ankles of a creature you can see in range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be bound until the spell ends. While bound, the target is {@condition restrained}. In addition, if it attempts to cast a spell requiring somatic components, it must first make a Dexterity or Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it can cast the spell normally. On a failure, the spell fails and has no effect.
As an action, the bound creature can make a Dexterity check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

spell.name: Wounding Whispers
entries: The words of this spell produce hissing, sibilant echoes that spin around you, invoking doom upon those who dare to harm you. You can end this spell early by using an action to dismiss it. While the spell lasts, you have resistance to psychic damage. In addition, whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, the whispers lash out at their mind. The attacker takes {@damage 2d6} psychic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 3rd. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage dice increases to {@dice d8}.

spell.name: Wrack
entries: You attempt to curse a creature you can see in range with crippling pain. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes {@damage 8d10} psychic damage and is {@condition paralyzed} until the spell ends. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and is not {@condition paralyzed}. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

In addition, on a failed save, the target is {@condition frightened} of you for another 10 minutes after you stop {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on this spell. A creature {@condition frightened} by this spell can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each or its turns. On a successful save the target is no longer {@condition frightened}.

spell.name: Wraithstrike
entries: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, it drains the life of the target hit, dealing an additional {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage to the target. Additionally, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have its hit point maximum reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Wrathful Castigation
entries: You brandish a whip, and a creature you can see in range must make a Wisdom saving throw. The target takes {@damage 12d10} psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, on a failed save the target is {@condition stunned} and falls {@condition prone}. At the end of its next turn, a {@condition stunned} creature must make another Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature dies. On a successful save, the creature is no longer {@condition stunned}.

spell.name: Xorn Movement
entries: You grant a willing creature the ability to move through earth and stone with the ease of a xorn. For the duration, the target can move across difficult terrain made of earth or stone without spending extra movement. The target can move through solid earth or stone as if it was air without destabilizing it. The target can breathe normally, even while surrounded in earth and rock. If the target is still surrounded in earth or rock when the spell ends, it is ejected to the nearest unoccupied space and {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

components.m: a scale from a xorn's hide

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you may target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Zeal
entries: You invoke a divine shield to protect you as you close with a chosen opponent. When you cast this spell, choose one hostile creature within 120 feet. Attack rolls made against you by creatures other than the target have disadvantage. In addition, your movement doesn't provoke attacks of opportunity as long as you are moving closer to the target.

spell.name: Zone of Respite
entries: You create a 20-foot radius sphere centered on yourself that is temporarily warded against interplanar intrusion. Conjuration spells cast within the area automatically fail and have no effect. In addition, any spell or effect that would teleport a creature or object into the area fails and has no effect.
The spell ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using certain higher level spell slots, the duration increases: 24 hours with a 5th-level slot, 1 week with a 7th-level slot and until dispelled with a 9th-level slot.

components.m: a small amount of blood from a gorgon

spell.name: Zone of Revelation
entries: You ward a 30-foot radius sphere centered on a point you can see against that which is hidden. Anything in the area can be perceived by any creature looking at it as if they had truesight.

components.m: a handful of ash from an undead creature

spell.name: One Mind
entries: You forge a bond between yourself and your mount, instinctively supporting one another. For the duration,  while you are mounted, you and your mount can communicate telepathically (even if neither of you share a language) and have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence (Investigation) skill checks that either of you make. In addition, your mount can use your ability modifier for Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma saving throws instead of its own.

monster.name: Amorphous Creature
languages: Understands all the languages of the target

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The amorphous creature can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The amorphous creature can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The amorphous creature can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Slam
entries: The Amorphous Creature makes one
unarmed strike, dealing {@dice 1d4}+Strength modifier
bludgeoning damage on a hit.

action.name: Resume Form
entries: The Amorphous Creature ends the
spell and resumes its previous form.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: (Air, Fire, and Water Only). The animated element can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Slam.
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5ft.,
one target. Hit ({@dice 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage
(Air, Earth, and Water only) or fire damage (Fire
only).

monster.name: Bogun
languages: understand the languages you speak but can't speak.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: ability is based on its master. It can innately cast
the following spells, requiring no material

action.name: Claws.
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5ft.,
one target. Hit {@damage 1d4 + 2} piercing damage plus
{@damage 1d4} poison damage.

reaction.name: Channel Magic.
entries: The Bogun delivers a spell you
cast that has a range of touch. The bogun must
be within 120 feet of you to use this ability.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The bat can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The bat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft.,
one target. {@h}({@dice 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus
({@dice 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The bat exhales fire in a
15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must
make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21
({@dice 6d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as
much damage on a successful one.

monster.name: Fantastic Machine
languages: understands and can speak the languages you speak

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The skeletal guard makes two attacks, either with its longsword or its longbow.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with both hands, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Guard
entries: The Skeletal Guard can choose to redirect an attack roll to itself from another creature, provided it is within 5 feet of the creature it is guarding and it can see the attacking creature.
